subsetdef: Bryophytes "Term used for mosses, liverworts, and/or hornworts"
Pteridophytes "Term used for ferns and allies"

comment: The embryo proper is the entire embryo exclusive of the suspensor.
def: "An embryonic plant structure (PO:0025099) that is the body of a developing plant embryo (PO:0009009) attached to the maternal tissue in an plant ovule (PO:0020003) by a suspensor (PO:0020108)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000001.name: plant embryo proper

comment: Has an outer epidermis (exothecium) and an endothecium and may have additional layers. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A microsporangium wall (PO:0025307) that is part of an anther (PO:0009066)." [ISBN:0471244554, ISBN:9780003686647]
PO:0000002.name: anther wall

comment: Examples include plant embryo (PO:0009009), megagametophyte (PO:0025279) and microgametophyte (PO:0025280).
def: "A plant structure (PO:0005679) which is a whole organism." [POC:curators]
PO:0000003.name: whole plant

comment: In vitro growth is defined as microbe-free growth in a sterile, culture environment, usually in the laboratory. An example of a sterile culture environment is growth on or in a nutrient medium in a Petri dish, culture flask or test tube. Microbes may be intentionally added to the culture environment, such as in co-culture with Agrobacterium.
def: "A plant structure (PO:0009011) that is grown or maintained in vitro." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000004.name: in vitro plant structure

comment: Includes isolated plant cells and small plant cell aggregates that proliferate while suspended in sterile liquid medium or spread on a solid agar medium.
def: "A plant cell (PO:0009002) that is grown or maintained in vitro." [POC:curators]
PO:0000005.name: cultured plant cell

comment: The cell wall is generally removed using polysaccharide-degrading enzymes such as cellulase, pectinase and /or xylanase. The cultured plant cell may be in suspension culture or from callus culture on solid media.
def: "A cultured plant cell from which the entire plant cell wall has been removed." [POC:curators]
PO:0000006.name: plant protoplast

comment: May be derived from cultured plant callus or plant protoplast that was induced from a segment of leaf. In the case of the plant protoplast, after the re-establishment cell walls.
def: "A cultured plant cell that was derived from leaf tissue." [POC:curators]
PO:0000007.name: leaf-derived cultured plant cell

comment: May be derived from cultured plant callus or plant protoplasts induced from a segment of root. In the case of the plant protoplast, after the re-establishment plant cell walls.
def: "A cultured plant cell that was derived from root tissue." [POC:curators]
PO:0000008.name: root-derived cultured plant cell

comment: Cultured plant callus may induced to form from plant protoplasts or cultured plant cells in suspension culture. After supplementation with the appropriate plant growth regulators, further differentiation may lead to the development of plant tissues, plant organs and ultimately, a whole plant.
def: "A plant callus (PO:0005052) grown or maintained in vitro." [POC:curators]
PO:0000009.name: cultured plant callus

comment: Includes isolated and maintained mature or immature zygotic embryos, somatic embryos or haploid embryos (derived from male gametophyte).
def: "A plant embryo (PO:0009009) that is grown or maintained in vitro." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000010.name: cultured plant embryo

comment: Cultured somatic plant embryos are commonly induced after the formation of callus from an explant and treatment with plant growth regulators.
def: "A somatic plant embryo grown and maintained in vitro." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000011.name: cultured somatic plant embryo

def: "Hook-like structure which develops at the apical part of the hypocotyl in dark-grown seedlings in dicots." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000012.name: apical hook

comment: In Arabidopsis, refers to the leaves that are borne on the elongated inflorescence branches. May ocur singly or pairs/whorls of leaves.
def: "A vascular leaf (PO:0009025), borne on the stem (PO:0009047)." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000013.name: cauline leaf

comment: Arabidopsis, vegetative development is characterized by the production of the rosette leaves.
def: "A vascular leaf (PO:0009025) born in a circular pattern around a stem (PO:0009047) with compressed stem internodes (PO:0020142)." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000014.name: rosette leaf

def: "A phyllome primordium (PO:0025128) that develops from a cotyledon anlagen (PO:0025432) and is part of a vegetative shoot apex (PO:0025223) and is committed to the development of a cotyledon (PO:0020030)." [POC:curators]
PO:0000015.name: cotyledon primordium

comment: A lateral root primordium may arise from cells of a pericycle (PO:0006203) in a root, as in most seed plants (pericyclic lateral root primordium; PO:0025492), or from cells of an endodermis (PO:0000252) or other tissue in ferns and some seed plants (non-pericyclic lateral root primordium: PO:0025493). Transition from lateral root primordium to lateral root occurs with the formation of a root cap (PO:0020123), shortly after the development of a root apical meristem (PO:0020147), which can occur before the lateral root penetrates the exterior of the parent root.
def: "A root primordium (PO:0005029) that is part of a root (PO:0009005) and is committed to the development of a lateral root (PO:0020121)." [POC:curators]
PO:0000016.name: lateral root primordium
synonym: "portion of lateral root primordium tissue" EXACT []

def: "A phyllome primordium (PO:0025128) that develops from a vascular leaf anlagen (PO:0025431) and is part of a vegetative shoot apex (PO:0025223) and is committed to the development of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000017.name: vascular leaf primordium
synonym: "portion of vascular leaf primordium tissue" EXACT []

comment: The transition from ovule primordium to ovule occurs when an integument (PO:0020021) begins to develop from the protoderm (PO:0006210).
def: "A floral structure primordium (PO:0025477) that is committed to the development of an ovule (PO:0020003)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0000018.name: ovule primordium

comment: Use carpel primordium (PO:0004703) for the primordium (PO:0025127) of an individual carpel (PO:0009030).
def: "A floral structure primordium (PO:0025477) that is committed to the development of a gynoecium (PO:0009062)." [POC:curators]
PO:0000019.name: gynoecium primordium

comment: Uninformative definition
def: "OBSOLETE. Cells characterized by conspicuous and rather stable accumulation of starch." [ISBN:044174520]
PO:0000020.name: starch sheath cell
synonym: "c&#233lula con almid&#243n de la vaina (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A phyllome primordium (PO:0025128) that develops from a petal anlagen (PO:0025484) and is committed to the development of a petal (PO:0009032)." [POC:curators]
PO:0000021.name: petal primordium

comment: The plant cuticle is produced in and secreted by epidermal cells (PO:0004013) of leaves (PO:0025034), stems (PO:0009047), fruits (PO:0009001), and other aerial plant structures. It has as parts an inner cuticle proper (PO:0025387) and an outer layer of epicuticular wax (PO:0025388).
def: "A portion of plant substance (PO:0025161) composed of cutin (PO:0025385), a polyester matrix of hydroxy- and hydroxy epoxy fatty acids C16 and C18 chains, embedded and overlayed with cuticular wax (PO:0025386) and forming a layer on the surface of a plant epidermis (PO:0005679)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000022.name: plant cuticle

comment: Comment: this term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology (GO:0048226).
def: "OBSOLETE. A band-like wall formation within primary walls that contains suberin and lignin; typical of endodermal cells in roots, in which it occurs in radial and transverse anticlinal walls." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000023.name: casparian strip

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043680.
def: "OBSOLETE. A complex of cell wall invaginations in a synergid cell similar to those in transfer cells." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000024.name: filiform apparatus

def: "The apical most portion of the root (PO:0009005) including the root apical meristem (PO:0020147) and root cap (PO:0020123)." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000025.name: root tip

def: "The portion of the primary root including the meristem and root cap." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000026.name: primary root tip
synonym: "punta de la ra&#237z primaria (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root tip (PO:0000025) of a lateral root (PO:0020121)." [PO:austin_meier, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000027.name: lateral root tip
synonym: "punta de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This term was made obsolete because it is a subcellular component. See GO for the term pollen tube tip (GO:0090404). Since a pollen tube tip is part_of a pollen tube, which is part of a pollen cell, annotations for pollen tube tip may also go to the more general term pollen tube cell (PO:0025195).
def: "OBSOLETE. Tip portion of the pollen tube that is rapidly growing." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000028.name: pollen tube tip

comment: This term was made obsolete because it is a subcellular component. Root hair tip (GO:0035619) has been added to GO. To annotate to a cell that has a root hair tip, consider root hair cell (PO:0000256).
def: "OBSOLETE. Tip portion of an outgrowth of a root epidermal cell." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000029.name: root hair tip
synonym: "punta del pelo de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A septum is formed by the fusion of the walls of two adjacent organs (ovary walls or anther walls), for example, the partition between two sections of an orange, seen in cross-section.
def: "A collective organ part structure composed of two or more layers of various tissues that is a partition that divides a cavity formed by the fusion of two or more organs." [POC:curators]
PO:0000030.name: septum

comment: Gas can be exchanged through the lenticel.
def: "A portion of ground tissue composed of a loosely-packed mass of cork cells occurring especially in the young stem, bark or even leaf of a plant, visible on the surface as a raised, often powdery-appearing spot." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000031.name: lenticel

def: "A portion of plant tissue consisting of four microspores that remained joined together shortly after meiosis. Each cell will give rise to a male gametophyte." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000032.name: tetrad of microspores

comment: A valve may develop from an entire carpel (as in Brassicaceae) or from part of a carpel (as in Fabaceae).
def: "A valve that is a part of a fruit that splits apart when the fruit dehisces." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000033.name: fruit valve

comment: A vascular system consist of the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a plant structure. May include other portions of plant tissue or plant cells (PO:0009002) of other types, such as parenchyma (PO:0005421) or fiber cells (PO:0025407).
def: "A maximal portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015) in a whole plant (PO:0000003), collective plant structure (PO:0025497), multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025496), or cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025498)." [ISBN:0471245208, ISBN:0716710072, POC:curators]
PO:0000034.name: vascular system

def: "A vascular system that is part of a cotyledon." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000035.name: cotyledon vascular system

def: "A phyllome vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a leaf." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000036.name: leaf vascular system
synonym: "sistema vascular de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot axis (PO:0025029) that is the most distal part of a shoot system (PO:0009006) and has as parts a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and the youngest primordia (PO:0025127)." [POC:curators]
PO:0000037.name: shoot apex

def: "Cell produced by the fusion of sperm cell nucleus and two polar nuclei of the central cell (or diploid secondary endosperm nucleus, in cases where two polar nuclei fuse together before double fertilization). The first cell of the endosperm, often triploid." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000038.name: primary endosperm cell

comment: Can occur in a stem or branch.
def: "A vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a shoot axis." [POC:curators]
PO:0000039.name: shoot axis vascular system
relationship: part_of PO:0025205 ! shoot system vascular system
synonym: "sistema vascular del eje del epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Unlike the root nodules, these contain functioning chloroplasts in the nodule cortex and are therefore capable of carbon fixation. Note: stem nodule is commonly used term for this structure, although the nodules are formed at positions of dormant adventitious root primordia.
def: "Enlargement or swelling at position of dormant adventitious root primordium (on the stem), inhabited by nitrogen-fixing bacteria." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000040.name: adventitious root nodule
synonym: "n&#243dulo de la ra&#237z adventicia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Developmentally different from periderm cork cell (i.e., phellem), produced by cork cambium. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025).
def: "One of the two types of short cells in the epidermis of grasses and bamboos. It is usually paired with silica cell." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000041.name: epidermal cork cell

def: "A root (PO:0009005) that develops from shoot axis (PO:0025029) tissue." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000042.name: shoot-borne root
synonym: "epiblasto (epiblastema) que se origina en la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot-borne nodal root (PO:0003005) formed at a stem base (PO:0008039)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000043.name: crown root

comment: This term is perhaps best defined functionally to prop the plant up.
def: "A shoot-borne nodal root (PO:0003005) formed at a stem node above the ground, and growing directly into the soil." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000044.name: prop root

def: "A root (PO:0009005) that is initiated in a developing plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000045.name: embryo root

def: "An embryo root (PO:0000045) formed within the scutellar node (PO:0004708) of the plant embryo (PO:0009009) in some monocotyledonous plants." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000046.name: seminal root

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of leaf epidermis that is part of a leaf lamina." [POC:curators]
PO:0000047.name: leaf lamina epidermis
synonym: "epidermis de la l&#225mina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a leaf lamina." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000048.name: leaf lamina vascular system
synonym: "sistema vascular de la l&#225mina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of leaf lamina epidermis that covers the abaxial/lower surface of a leaf lamina." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000049.name: leaf lamina abaxial epidermis
synonym: "epidermis abaxial de la l&#225mina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of leaf lamina epidermis that covers the adaxial/upper surface of a leaf lamina." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000050.name: leaf lamina adaxial epidermis
synonym: "epidermis adaxial de la l&#225mina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of leaf epidermis that is part of a petiole." [POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000051.name: petiole epidermis

def: "A vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a leaf petiole." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000052.name: petiole vascular system

def: "A portion of cortex (PO:0005708) that is part of a petiole (PO:0020038)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000053.name: petiole cortex

def: "A phyllome vascular system (PO:0025206) that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a petal (PO:0025218)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000054.name: petal vascular system

def: "An undeveloped shoot system (PO:0009006)." [POC:curators]
PO:0000055.name: bud

def: "A bud that develops into a flower." [POC:curators]
PO:0000056.name: flower bud

def: "A bud that develops into an inflorescence." [POC:curators]
PO:0000057.name: inflorescence bud

def: "A bud (PO:0000055) that develops into a vegetative shoot system (PO:0025607)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000058.name: vegetative bud

def: "An initial cell that is part of a root apical meristem and by division gives rise to two cells, one of which remains in the meristem, while the other is produces different root cells." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
disjoint_from: PO:0030067 ! protonema side branch initial cell
PO:0000059.name: root initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula inicial de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root initial cell that produces root cortex and endodermis. In direct contact with quiescent center." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000060.name: root cortex-endodermis initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula inicial del cortex/endodermis de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root initial cell that produces lateral root-cap cells and root epidermis." [POC:curators]
PO:0000061.name: lateral root-cap epidermal initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula inicial del caliptra de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "An epidermal initial cell (PO:0000349) that undergoes several rounds of uneven division, each time giving rise to a larger daughter cell that differentiates into an epidermal ground cell and a smaller daughter cell that remains meristematic, until the meristematic cell (PO:0004010) differentiates into a guard mother cell (PO:0000351)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000062.name: stomatal initial cell

comment: Leaf procambial cells may be derived from the shoot apical meristem or can arise throughout the mesophyll of a developing leaf.
def: "A procambial cell (PO:0025258) that is part of a leaf procambium (PO:0025259)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000063.name: leaf procambial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula procambial de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Xylem pole pericycle cells are cells in the pericycle that are adjacent to the protoxylem pole of a vascular bundle. Pericycle cells that are adjacent to other xylem cells in the vascular bundle are not considered xylem pole pericycle cells. Xylem pole pericycle cells may retain some meristematic activity and are the site of lateral root initiation.
def: "A pericycle cell that is adjacent to the protoxylem of a vascular bundle." [PMID:17993548]
PO:0000064.name: xylem pole pericycle cell
synonym: "c&#233lula del polo xilem&#225tico del periciclo (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Phloem pole pericycle cells are cells in the pericycle that are adjacent to the protophloem pole of a vascular bundle. Pericycle cells that are adjacent to other phloem cells in the vascular bundle are not considered phloem pole pericycle cells. Phloem pole pericycle cells are distinct from xylem pole pericycle cells in that they display cytoplasmic characteristics of a more differentiated status.
def: "A pericycle cell that is adjacent to the protophloem of a vascular bundle." [PMID:17993548]
PO:0000065.name: phloem pole pericycle cell
synonym: "c&#233lula del polo floem&#225tico del periciclo (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Proposed to be involved in the retrieval of solutes from the xylem sap.
def: "A parenchyma cell of the mesophyll of a hydathode found between the xylem endings and the epidermis." [ISBN:0471245208, PMID:12662305]
PO:0000066.name: epithem cell

comment: The terms proteoid root, cluster root, and root cluster have all been used in the literature to describe either the proteoid root axis or clusters of rootlets, and caution should be taken when comparing studies because the definitions of these terms vary (Watts and Evans, 1999; Plant Physiology).
def: "A root (PO:0009005) that forms one or more clusters of closely spaced lateral roots (PO:0020121) of limited growth along its length." [PMID:10517822, POC:austin_meier]
PO:0000067.name: proteoid root

comment: Companion cells are connected to sieve tube elements through plasmodesmata and function in phloem loading of small molecules, including photosynthate (either sucrose or raffinose-family oligosaccharides). May participate in phloem sucrose loading (GO:0009915). Molecules can be loaded into the companion cells from surrounding cells through either symplastic (via plasmodesmata) or apoplastic (transmembrane) transport. Unlike sieve tube elements, companion cells retain their nuclei and other organelles at maturity. A sieve tube element may have one or more or no companion cells associated with it. This term should not be used for other types of parenchyma cells (PO:0000074) that do not arise from the same phloem mother cell as a sieve tube element. Companion cells are found in angiosperms, as compared to albuminous cells (PO:0025412), which are found in non-angiosperm vascular plants. Companion cells may be specialized as transfer companion cells (PO:0025458), ordinary companion cells (PO:0025459), or intermediary companion cells (PO:0025460). Multiple types of companion cells may be found in the same plant.
def: "A parenchyma cell (PO:0000074) that is adjacent to a sieve tube element (PO:0000289) and arises from the same phloem mother cell (PO:0000400) as the sieve tube element." [PO_REF:00011]
PO:0000071.name: companion cell

def: "A relatively unspecialized ground tissue cell with a nucleate protoplast." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000074.name: parenchyma cell

def: "An elongated plant cell with unevenly thickened non-lignified primary walls that is alive at maturity." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000075.name: collenchyma cell

def: "A parenchyma cell containing chloroplasts; a component of leaf mesophyll and other green parenchyma tissue." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000076.name: chlorenchyma cell

comment: May be dead at maturity. The secondary cell wall of a sclerenchyma cell is often thicker than other cell types in the same plant structure, but it is not always easy to distinguish from tracheary elements (PO:0000290) or sclerified parenchyma cells (PO:0000074). Compare with collenchyma cells (PO:0000075) that are always alive at maturity, have irregularly thickened primary cell walls, and do not have lignified secondary cell walls. Collenchyma cells provides flexibility while sclerenchyma cells provide hardness. Sclerenchyma cells include plant fiber cells (PO:0025407) and sclerid cells (PO:0025418).
def: "A ground tissue cell (PO:0025030) with a lignified secondary cell wall." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000077.name: sclerenchyma cell

comment: Appear to be specialized for short-distance transfer of solutes. Transfer cells can occur anywhere there is a junction between two individuals, such as between a sporophyte and a gametophyte, or between a parasitic plant and its host.
def: "A cell with wall ingrowths (or invaginations) that increase the surface of the plasmalemma." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000078.name: transfer cell

def: "An elongated cambial initial cell (PO:0000295) with approximately wedge-shaped ends that is part of the vascular cambium (PO:0005598) and gives rise to axial cells." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000079.name: fusiform initial cell

comment: This term was made obsolete because it is not appropriate. It is replaced by sieve element, tracheary element, and fiber cell.
def: "OBSOLETE. A vascular cell derived from the fusiform cambial initial and oriented with its longest diameter parallel with the main axis of stem or root." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000081.name: axial cell

def: "A cambial initial cell (PO:0000295) that gives rise to ray cells of the secondary xylem (PO:0005848) and secondary phloem (PO:0005043)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000082.name: ray initial cell

comment: The sperm cell is usually smaller than the egg cell. Male gametes may be defined as the motile gamete, rather than the smaller gamete. Plant sperm cells lack a cell wall.
def: "A gamete (PO:0025006) produced by an antheridium (PO:0025125) or a microgametophyte (PO:0025280)." [POC:curators]
PO:0000084.name: plant sperm cell

comment: Can occur on a stem or branch.
def: "A portion of shoot system epidermis (PO:0006035) that is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000112.name: shoot axis epidermis
synonym: "epidermis del eje del tallo (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot epidermal cell (PO:0025165) that surrounds a trichome (PO:0000282) and provides its support." [ISBN:0471245208, PMID:10938806, PMID:15319479]
PO:0000115.name: socket cell
synonym: "cell located at the base of the trichome" RELATED []

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that has as part a separation layer (PO:0006211) and a protective layer (PO:0006212), and is involved in the abscission (GO:0009838) of a fruit (PO:0009001), flower (PO:0009046), leaf (PO:0025034) or other plant structure (PO:0009011)." [ISBN:047124529, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000146.name: abscission zone

def: "Cell, usually two in number, in the micropylar end of the embryo sac of angiosperms associated with the egg in the egg apparatus." [ISBN:047125208, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0000191.name: synergid

def: "An endosperm in which at least the first karyokinesis is not followed by cytokinesis." [ISBN:0080374913, ISBN:0471245194]
PO:0000198.name: free nuclear endosperm

def: "Endosperm in which the first karyokinesis event is accompanied by cytokinesis." [ISBN:0080374913, ISBN:0471245194]
PO:0000199.name: cellular endosperm

def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the region of the endosperm closest to the micropyle of the seed." [TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000200.name: micropylar endosperm

comment: Not in current literature. More like an attribute.
def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the part of the endosperm nearest the chalazal region of the ovule and forming a cyst-like structure." [ISBN:047124529, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000201.name: chalazal cyst

def: "A portion of shoot epidermis that is part of a nectary." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000207.name: nectary epidermis

comment: Can occur in a stem or branch.
def: "A portion of cortex (PO:0005708) that is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029)." [ISBN:047124529, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000223.name: shoot axis cortex
synonym: "cortex del eje del epiblasto (epiblastema) del tallo (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]
"portion of shoot axis cortex tissue" EXACT []

comment: Functions as a population of stem cells that replenishes the meristem.
def: "An area of densely packed cells in the shoot apex that divide infrequently." [ISBN:0521288959, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000224.name: central zone

def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) which is the organogenic region of the meristem, characterized by higher rates of cell division." [ISBN:0521288959, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000225.name: peripheral zone

def: "The region of the shoot apical meristem that lies below the central zone and is flanked by the peripheral zone." [ISBN:0521288959, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000226.name: rib zone

comment: In Zea mays and other grasses, the floret meristem is part of a spikelet and develops into a specific type of floret. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the spikelet type that the meristem is part of. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet (PO:0009051), ear spikelet (PO:0006320), ear pedicellate spikelet (PO:0006348), ear sessile spikelet (PO:0006349), tassel spikelet (PO:0006309), tassel pedicellate spikelet (PO:0006312), tassel sessile spikelet (PO:0006311).
def: "A portion of reproductive shoot apical meristem tissue (PO:0008028) that gives rise to the floral organs (PO:0025395)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:curators]
PO:0000229.name: flower meristem

def: "A meristem that gives rise to an inflorescence." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0000230.name: inflorescence meristem

def: "A shoot system meristem (PO:0006079) formed in an axil (PO:0025224)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000232.name: axillary bud meristem

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A megaspore(s) that forms an embryo sac." [TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000244.name: functional megaspore

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "In monosporic and bisporic megasporogenesis: the megaspore(s) that would not participate in megagametogenesis." [TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0000245.name: degenerate megaspore

comment: Forms a sheath around the vascular system. It may have secondary walls later, part_of cortex.
def: "A portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) that is the inner most layer of a cortex (PO:0005708) and has a casparian strip in its anticlinal cell walls." [ISBN:047124529, POC:curators]
PO:0000252.name: endodermis

comment: Compare with non-hair root epidermal cell (PO:0000263). This term is for an entire epidermal cell that contains a root hair extension. To describe only the cell extension, see root hair (GO:0035618) or root hair tip (GO:0035619).
def: "A root epidermal cell (PO:0025164) that develops from a trichoblast (PO:0000262) and has as part a root hair (GO:0035618)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000256.name: root hair cell
synonym: "c&#233lula del pelo de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: In dicots and gymnosperms, the cortex consists of mainly parenchyma cells. In monocots sclerenchyma develops in addition to parenchyma.
def: "A portion of cortex (PO:0005708) that is part of a root (PO:0009005)." [ISBN:047125208, POC:curators]
PO:0000258.name: root cortex

def: "A root epidermal cell that is the smaller cell produced by the asymmetric division of an epidermal intial and gives rise to a root hair." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000262.name: trichoblast

comment: Compare to root hair cell (PO:0000256), which develops from a trichoblast (PO:0000262).
def: "A root epidermal cell (PO:0025164) that develops from an epidermal initial (PO:0000349) and does not have as part a root hair (GO:0035618)." [ISBN:0387987819, PMID:14627722]
PO:0000263.name: non-hair root epidermal cell

comment: Develops while the vascular tissue (PO:0009015) is still elongating. When protoxylem tracheary elements (PO:0025575) are destroyed they may become obliterated by surrounding parenchyma cells (PO:0000074). Protoxylem has smaller elements than the metaxylem (PO:0000372).
def: "A portion of primary xylem (PO:0000272) tissue that has as part one or more protoxylem tracheary elements (PO:0025575) embedded in parenchyma (PO:0005421) tissue." [ISBN:047125208, ISBN:0471738433, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000272.name: protoxylem

comment: This term was made obsolete because it was not appropriate. Replaced by tracheary element (PO:0000290) and xylem fiber cell (PO:0000274).
def: "OBSOLETE. A cell making up xylem tissue." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000273.name: xylem element

comment: It may be difficult to distinguish xylem fiber cells, especially fiber tracheids (PO:0000355), from tracheary elements (PO:0000290). Fiber tracheids have bordered pits with smaller pit cavities than the vessel members (PO:0002003) or tracheids (PO:0000301) of the same wood and a distinct pit cavity leading to the cell lumen through the cell wall.
def: "A fiber cell (PO:0025407) that is part of a portion of xylem (PO:0005352) tissue." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000274.name: xylem fiber cell

comment: This class is the union of unicellular trichome (PO:0025537) and multicellular trichome (PO:0025162). A trichome can vary in length and shape and may be branched or unbranched.  It may be glandular or non-secretory.
def: "A unicellular or multicellular plant structure (PO:0009011) that forms a non-sclerified outgrowth from the epidermis (PO:0005679)." [PMID:19939948, POC:curators]
PO:0000282.name: trichome

comment: Often contains deposit of minerals or products of secondary metabolism. May have a specialized function.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that markedly differs in form, size, or contents from other cells in the same tissue." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000283.name: idioblast

def: "An epidermal cell associated with a stoma and at least morphologically distinguishable from the other epidermal cells." [ISBN:047124520]
PO:0000284.name: subsidiary cell

comment: Sieve tube elements have sieve areas that are specialized into those with wide pores in sieve plates and those with narrow pores in lateral sieve areas. Sieve tube elements may have inclined end walls with compound or simple sieve plates. Typical of angiosperms. Differ from sieve cells (PO:0025415), which have less pronounced specialization of sieve areas and no sieve plates.
def: "A sieve element (PO:0025406) that is part of a sieve tube (PO:0025416) and has as parts sieve areas aggregated into sieve plates (GO:0097218)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000289.name: sieve tube element

comment: Tracheary elements are dead at maturity, are more or less elongated, and have pits of various types in the cell wall. Tracheary elements function in the conduction of water and dissolved substances such as mineral nutrients from the roots to the shoot system. Tracheary elements can be distinguished from fiber cells (PO:0025407) by the presence of bordered pits, although there are intermediate forms called fiber tracheids (PO:0000355).
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that has a lignified cell wall with secondary thickening and bordered pits." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000290.name: tracheary element

comment: They cause the opening and closing of the pore by changes in turgor.
def: "One of a pair of cells flanking the stomatal pore." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000293.name: guard cell

def: "An initial cell (PO:0004011) that is part of the vascular cambium (PO:0005598) or cork cambium (PO:0005599), and by periclinal divisions, produces cells to the outside or inside of the cambial axis." [POC:curators]
disjoint_from: PO:0030067 ! protonema side branch initial cell
PO:0000295.name: cambial initial cell

comment: May have any of the kinds of secondary wall thickenings found in tracheary elements. The area of contact between two tracheids has only bordered pits, whereas in vessel members (PO:0002003), it has openings in the cell wall called perforations, organized into perforation plates (term has been requested in GO).
def: "A tracheary element (PO:0000290) that has no perforations in its cell wall." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000301.name: tracheid

def: "A portion of parenchyma tissue that is part of a nectary." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000309.name: nectary parenchyma

comment: May have sinuous anticlinal cell walls that overall give a jigsaw like appearance to the epidermis. Pavement cells are epidermal cells that are not directly associated with a stomatal complex or trichome at maturity, but they share similar developmental origins.
def: "A shoot epidermal cell that is relatively unspecialized at maturity." [POC:curators]
PO:0000332.name: epidermal pavement cell

def: "An initial cell (PO:0004011) that is part of an epidermis (PO:0005679) and gives rise to specialized cell types of the epidermis." [TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
disjoint_from: PO:0030067 ! protonema side branch initial cell
PO:0000349.name: epidermal initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula inicial de la epidermis (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot epidermal cell that divides to produce the guard cells." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000351.name: guard mother cell
synonym: "c&#233lula madre de la c&#233lula guardiana (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A cell containing glucosinolates (\"mustard oil glucosides\") and myrosinases, enzymes hydrolyzing the glucosinolates." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000352.name: myrosin cell

def: "A ground tissue cell that is part of an exodermis or an endodermis and remains thin walled when the associated cells develop thick secondary walls." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000353.name: passage cell

comment: Fiber tracheids generally have pointed ends and bordered pits that have lenticular to slit-like apertures. If both libriform fiber cells (PO:0004520) and fiber tracheids are present, the libriform fiber cells usually have thicker walls. Fiber tracheids have bordered pits with smaller pit cavities than the vessel members (PO:0002003) or tracheids (PO:0000301) of the same wood and a distinct pit cavity leading to the cell lumen through the cell wall.
def: "A xylem fiber cell (PO:0000274) with bordered pits with pit cavities." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000355.name: fiber tracheid

comment: Metaxylem has larger tracheary elements (PO:0000290) than the protoxylem (PO:0000272), and develops after the formation of the protoxylem, once elongation of the plant axis (PO:0025004) has completed.
def: "A portion of primary xylem (PO:0005849) tissue that has as part one or more metaxylem tracheary elements (PO:0025576) embedded in parenchyma (PO:0005421) tissue and may contain xylem fiber cells (PO:0000274)." [ISBN:047125208, ISBN:0471738433, POC:curators]
PO:0000372.name: metaxylem

comment: Functional term
def: "OBSOLETE. Cell containing mucilages or gums or similar carbohydrate material characterized by the property of swelling in water." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0000373.name: mucilage cell

comment: Phloem islands can be formed in the middle of the xylem.
def: "A cambial initial cell (PO:0000295) which is destined to differentiate into secondary phloem." [POC:curators]
PO:0000400.name: phloem mother cell

comment: A plant zygote is a whole plant that is a single cell formed by fertilization (syngamy).
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) which is a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the plant zygote stage (PO:0001097)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0000423.name: plant zygote

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A sporocyte (PO:0006204) that produces four haploid (1n) megaspores (PO:0020019)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0000431.name: megasporocyte

comment: This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. the root meristem gets organized" [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0001000.name: meristem elaboration

comment: Defined by characteristic morphological, structural, histological or other visible features of a fruit. Includes as subclasses fruit formation stage (PO:0025501) and fruit ripening stage (PO:0025502). May have as part a seed development stage (PO:0001170). This stage applies to an individual fruit. For development stages of a whole plant (PO:0000003) based on fruit development, use whole plant fruit development stage (PO:0025500) or its subclasses.
def: "A multi-tissue plant structure development stage (PO:0025571) that has as primary participant a single fruit (PO:0009001)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
is_a: PO:0025571 ! multi-tissue plant structure development stage
PO:0001002.name: fruit development stage

comment: The initial stage of leaf development when cells in the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) are already determined to form a vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017), but the primordium is not yet morphologically distinguishable.
def: "A vascular leaf initiation stage (PO:0007040) during which the vascular leaf founder cells (PO:0025592) of the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) form a vascular leaf anlagen (PO:0025431)." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001003.name: vascular leaf anlagen formation stage
synonym: "vascular leaf founder cell formation stage" EXACT []

def: "Stages of development of the anther defined by characteristic morphological, cytological, histological or other visible features." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001004.name: anther development stage

def: "An initial stage during which archesporial cells arise in four corners of L2 layer. Change in shape of primordia to more oval." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001005.name: A archesporial cells visible stage

def: "Stage during which the microsporocytes become conspicuous." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001006.name: B enlarged microsporocyte stage

def: "A microgametophyte development stage (PO:0025602) during which the pollen (PO:0025281) develops." [POC:Felipe_Zapata, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0001007.name: pollen development stage

def: "Stage during which diploid pollen mother cells become separated from each other and from tapetum by a callose wall." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001008.name: C callose wall formation in pollen mother cells stage

def: "Stage during which pollen mother cells undergo meiosis to form tetrads of microspores." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001009.name: D pollen mother cell meiosis stage

def: "Stage of microgametophyte development during which the callose wall between the tetrads breaks down and haploid microspores are released and lie freely in locules." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001010.name: F microspore release stage

def: "An initial stage during which the archesporial cells divide to give rise to primary parietal and sporogenous cells." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001011.name: A microsporogenous mass stage

def: "Stage of microgametophyte development during which the microspores round up and small vacuoles appear in their cytoplasm. The microspore walls thicken due to the formation of the exine." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001012.name: G early unicellular microspore stage

def: "Stage of microgametophyte development during which a large vacuole is formed in each microspore causing a rapid increase in size and a displacement of the nucleus to one side." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001013.name: H late unicellular microspore stage

def: "Stage of microgametophyte development during which the asymmetric, first mitotic division of the microspores occurs producing a large vegetative cell and small generative cell, located near pollen wall." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001014.name: I first mitotic division stage

comment: In taxa with mature two-celled pollen (PO:0025281), the second mitotic division takes place after pollen germination (GO:0009846), in the germinating pollen tube cell (PO:0025195). Note: This term overlaps with the GO BP term: generative cell mitosis (GO:0055047): The process in which the generative cell divides by mitosis to form two haploid cells. These will subsequently differentiate into sperm cells.
def: "A pollen development stage (PO:0001007) during which the generative cell (PO:0020097) undergoes mitotic division to form two male gametes, the pollen sperm cells (PO:0025121)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001015.name: K second mitotic division stage

comment: Mature pollen stages is reached at three-celled pollen in some angiosperms (maize, rice and Arabidopsis), while in others, the maturepollen has two haploid cells (tobacco, snapdragon).
def: "Stage of microgametophyte development during which the pollen reaches mature stage and desiccates." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001016.name: L mature pollen stage

def: "The final stage in the life cycle of the male gametophyte. Upon rehydration, mature pollen grain forms a tubular outgrowth, the pollen tube, which carries the male gametes." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001017.name: M germinated pollen stage

def: "Stage during which the primary parietal and primary sporogenous layers are derived from archesporial cells." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001018.name: B formation of primary parietal and sporogenous cells stage

comment: The vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017) develops from the vascular leaf anlagen (PO:0025431).
def: "A vascular leaf initiation stage (PO:0001051) during which a vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017) forms in the peripheral zone (PO:0000225) of the vegetative shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001019.name: vascular leaf primordium formation stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0001003 ! vascular leaf anlagen formation stage

def: "Stage of leaf development when a hood-shaped primordium is formed, partially enclosing P1 and SAM, as in Poaceae." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001020.name: hood-shaped primordium stage

def: "A vascular leaf expansion stage (PO:0001052) when conical P3 leaf completely encloses SAM, and the ligule (PO:0020105) primordium is visible." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001021.name: formation of ligule primordium stage

def: "A vascular leaf expansion stage (PO:0001052) during which a rapid elongation of the leaf lamina (PO:0020039) occurs." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001023.name: rapid elongation of vascular leaf lamina stage

comment: Occurs in the Poaceae.
def: "A vascular leaf expansion stage (PO:0001052) during which a rapid elongation of the leaf sheath (PO:0020104) occurs." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001024.name: rapid elongation of leaf sheath stage

def: "Stage during which the four-lobed anther pattern with two developing stomium regions (notch) are formed." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001025.name: C four anther lobes formed stage

def: "Stage during which the four clearly defined locules are established. All anther cell types present and microspore mother cells appear." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001026.name: D locules established stage

def: "OBSOLETE. The meristematic zone is formed" [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0001027.name: meristamtic zone formation

def: "OBSOLETE. The cells of root primordium undergo elonagtion" [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0001028.name: elongation zone formation

def: "Stage immediately following meiosis, during which the tetrads of microspores are still hold together, enclosed by the callose wall." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001029.name: E tetrad stage

def: "OBSOLETE. The cells develop their characteristic morphology." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0001030.name: specialization zone formation

comment: In some plant species this stage is subdivided into distal and proximal elongating zones.
def: "The stage at which root is elongating." [POC:curators]
PO:0001031.name: 4 root elongation stage

comment: Microspores within single locule are at unicellular stage.
def: "An anther development stage (PO:0001004) during which degeneration of the anther wall tapetum (PO:0009071) is initiated, as the deposition on the surface of the microspore (PO:0020048) primexine proceeds." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001032.name: E anther wall tapetum degeneration initiated stage

def: "Stage during which anther becomes bilocular, after degeneration and breakage of septum below stomium." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001034.name: F bilocular anther stage

def: "Stage during which the dehiscence of anthers occurs. Anther breaks along stomium and pollen is released." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001035.name: G anther dehiscence stage

def: "Stage during which the senescence of anther and stamen occurs. Shrinkage of cells and anther structure takes place." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001036.name: H anther senescence stage

def: "A seed development stage (PO:0001170) during which the mature seed reaches a low moisture content." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001040.name: dry seed stage

def: "The initial stage of endosperm development during which the chalazal and micropilar domains are established." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001041.name: chalazal and micropylar domain establishment stage

def: "Stage of endosperm development during which the functional specialization of the maturing endosperm occurs." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001042.name: functional specialization of the endosperm stage

def: "Stage of calyx development defined by differentiation and expansion of sepal." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001044.name: sepal differentiation and expansion stage

def: "Stage of calyx development when sepal is fully expanded." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001045.name: fully expanded sepal stage

def: "A phyllome development stage (PO:0025579) that has as a primary participant a lemma (PO:0009037)." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar, POC:Felipe_Zapata, POC:Laura_Moore]
PO:0001047.name: lemma development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0007600 ! floral organ differentiation stage

def: "A phyllome development stage (PO:0025579) that has as a primary participant a palea (PO:0009038)." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar, POC:Felipe_Zapata, POC:Laura_Moore]
PO:0001048.name: palea development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0007600 ! floral organ differentiation stage

def: "A phyllome development stage (PO:0025579) that has as a primary participant a lodicule (PO:0009036)." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar, POC:Felipe_Zapata, POC:Laura_Moore]
PO:0001049.name: lodicule development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0007600 ! floral organ differentiation stage

def: "A phyllome development stage (PO:0025579) during which the development of vascular leaves (PO:0009025) and non-vascular leaves (PO:0025075) occurs." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, POC:curators, TAIR:Tanya_Berardini]
PO:0001050.name: leaf development stage

comment: Localized cell divisions in the peripheral zone (PO:0000225) transition from anticlinal to periclinal divisions.
def: "A vascular leaf development stage (PO:0025570) which begins with the onset of the vascular leaf anlagen formation stage (PO:0001003) and ends with the termination of the vascular leaf primordium polarity determination stage (PO:0001052)." [PMID:9254931, POC:Brian_Atkinson, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0001051.name: vascular leaf initiation stage

comment: During this stage leaf shaping (GO:0010358) occurs which is defined as the developmental process that pertains to the organization of a leaf in three-dimensional space once the structure has initially formed.
def: "A vascular leaf development stage (PO:0025570) during which vascular leaf size increases primarily through cell expansion." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001052.name: vascular leaf expansion stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0025574 ! vascular leaf differentiation stage

def: "A vascular leaf development stage (PO:0025570) that begins when the vascular leaf (PO:0009025) is fully expanded and ends with the onset of the vascular leaf senescence stage (PO:0001054)." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001053.name: vascular leaf post-expansion stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0001052 ! vascular leaf expansion stage
synonym: "fully expanded leaf stage in Arabidopsis" RELATED []

def: "A vascular leaf development stage (PO:0025570) that begins with the formation of a abscission zone at the base of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025) and ends with leaf separation and death." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Tanya_Berardini]
PO:0001054.name: vascular leaf senescent stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0001053 ! vascular leaf post-expansion stage

comment: The lemma primordium forms in 1/2 alternate phylotaxy in rice spikelet.
def: "Stage of lemma development that begins when the lemma primordia arise." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001055.name: lemma primordia visible stage

def: "Stage of lemma development defined by differentiation and expansion of lemma." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001056.name: lemma differentiation and expansion stage

def: "Stage of lemma development when lemma is fully expanded." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001057.name: fully expanded lemma stage

comment: The palea primordium forms in 1/2 alternate phylotaxy in rice spikelet.
def: "Stage of palea development that begins when the palea primordia arise." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001058.name: palea primordia visible stage

def: "Stage of microgametophyte development during which the small generative cell moves inward, becoming completely surrounded by the cytoplasm of the vegetative cell." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001059.name: J bicellular pollen stage

def: "Stage of palea development defined by differentiation and expansion of palea." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001070.name: palea differentiation and expansion stage

def: "Stage of palea development when palea is fully expanded." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001071.name: fully expanded palea stage

comment: Two lodicules form on the side of the lemma in rice spikelet.
def: "Stage of lodicule development that begins when the lodicule primordia arise." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001072.name: lodicule primordia visible stage

def: "Stage of microgametophyte development during which the generative cell undergoes a mitotic division to form two male gametes, the sperm cells." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001074.name: N second mitotic division stage in germinating pollen

def: "Stage of lodicule development defined by differentiation and expansion of lodicule." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001077.name: lodicule differentiation and expansion stage

comment: During this stage, the plant embryo (PO:0009009) continues to undergo a process of developmental growth (as a result of both cell division (GO:0051301) and cell expansion (GO:0016049), which ends with the onset of a mature plant embryo stage (PO:0001081). For species that develop true leaves in the plant embryo, (vascular leaves (PO:0009025) that develop after the cotyledons (PO:0020030) or coleoptile (PO:0020033)), growth may continue in the plant embryo true leaf formation stage (PO:0001095). For other species, the plant embryo transitions directly from a plant embryo cotyledonary stage (PO:0001078) to a mature plant embryo stage (PO:0001081).
def: "A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between the beginning of rapid elongation of the plant embryo axis (PO:0019018) and plant embryo cotyledons (PO:0025470), and the onset of a plant embryo true leaf formation stage (PO:0001095), when present, or a mature plant embryo stage (PO:0001081)." [GO:0016049, GO:0051301, POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001078.name: plant embryo cotyledonary stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0004507 ! plant embryo bilateral stage
precedes PO:0001081 ! mature plant embryo stage

def: "Stage of lodicule development when lodicule is fully expanded." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0001079.name: fully expanded lodicule stage

comment: In some seed plants, this occurs some time after the fruit ripening stage (PO:0025502) and after the dispersal of the seed (PO:0009010). This stage may be very short in plants that do not enter a plant embryo dormant stage (PO:0025377).
def: "A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) during the interval between when a plant embryo (PO:0009009) has stopped developmental growth involved in morphogenesis (GO:0060560) and one of the following: the beginning of the seed germination stage (PO:0007057) in seed plants, formation of the first vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in pteridophytes, the beginning of development of a sporangium (PO:0025094) in bryophytes, or the beginning of the formation of a plant organ (PO:0009008) such as a root (PO:0009005), shoot axis (PO:0025029), or vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in a cultured plant embryo (PO:0000010)." [APweb:Glossary, POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001081.name: mature plant embryo stage

def: "A reproductive shoot system development stage (PO:0025530) that has as primary participant a inflorescence (PO:0009049)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
is_a: PO:0025530 ! reproductive shoot system development stage
PO:0001083.name: inflorescence development stage

comment: This stage occurs in grasses and other monocots.
def: "A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between the beginning of elongation of the plant embryo axis (PO:0019018), with the formation of a plant embryo coleoptile (PO:0025286), a plant embryo shoot apical meristem (PO:0006362) and root apical meristem (PO:0020147), and ends with the onset of a plant embryo true leaf formation stage (PO:0001095), when present, or a mature plant embryo stage (PO:0001081)." [MaizeGDB:67376, PMID:20044449, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001094.name: plant embryo coleoptilar stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0004507 ! plant embryo bilateral stage
precedes PO:0001081 ! mature plant embryo stage

comment: A true leaf is vascular leaf (PO:0009025) that forms after the formation of the cotyledons (PO:0020030) or a coleoptile (PO:0020033). Not all species form true leaves in the plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631). If it occurs, a plant embryo true leaf formation stage is preceded by either a plant embryo cotyledonary stage (PO:0001078) or a plant embryo coleoptilar stage (PO:0001094), depending upon the species.
def: "A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between the beginning of the formation of the first vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017) in the plant embryo proper (PO:0000001), and the onset of a mature plant embryo stage (PO:0001081)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001095.name: plant embryo true leaf formation stage
relationship: precedes PO:0001081 ! mature plant embryo stage

def: "One cell stage that takes place following the fertilization, produced by the fusion of sperm cell nucleus and one or more polar nuclei." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001096.name: primary endosperm cell stage

comment: Precedes the sporophyte vegetative stage (PO:0007134). Refers to the GO biological process term fertilization (GO:0009566).
def: "A sporophyte development stage (PO:0007134) that occurs during the interval between fertilization and the first cell division of the plant zygote (PO:0000423)." [POC:curators]
PO:0001097.name: plant zygote stage

def: "OBSOLETE. Stage of endosperm development during wich the formation of starchy endosperm occurs." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001098.name: formation of starchy endosperm

def: "Differentiation of aleurone layer, the outermost endosperm tissue, and the internal starchy tissue." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
is_a: PO:0001042 ! functional specialization of the endosperm stage
PO:0001099.name: formation of aleurone and starchy layers stage

comment: Includes the stages of seed development, from fertilization to the dry or quiescent state. May have as part an embryo development stage.
def: "A multi-tissue plant structure development stage (PO:0025571) that has as primary participant a seed (PO:0009010)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
is_a: PO:0025571 ! multi-tissue plant structure development stage
PO:0001170.name: seed development stage

comment: The plant proembryo stage occurs prior to the differentiation of the three main tissue systems (vascular system (PO:0000034) epidermis (PO:0005679); and the portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059)).
def: "A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between the first cell division of a plant zygote (PO:0000423) and the onset of the plant globular embryo stage (PO:0001185)." [APweb:Glossary, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001180.name: plant proembryo stage

comment: During the plant embryo globular stage, differentiation of the three main tissue systems (vascular system (PO:0000034); epidermis (PO:0005679); and the portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059)) occurs.
def: "A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between when a plant embryo proper (PO:0000001) increases in diameter through cell division, but retains radial symmetry (with the concomitant formation of a protoderm (PO:0006210)), and the onset of a plant embryo bilateral stage (PO:0004507)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0001185.name: plant embryo globular stage

def: "Stage of calyx development that begins when the developing sepals enclose the floral meristem." [ISBN:0387940898]
is_a: PO:0001044 ! sepal differentiation and expansion stage
PO:0001378.name: sepals enclosing meristem stage

def: "Stage of calyx development that begins when the sepals enclose the floral bud." [ISBN:0387940898]
is_a: PO:0001044 ! sepal differentiation and expansion stage
PO:0001380.name: sepals enclosing flower bud stage

def: "A portion of shoot epidermis that has as parts two guard cells and a stomatal pore. May also contain subsidiary cells." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0002000.name: stomatal complex

comment: This terms was made obsolete because it is a sub-cellular compartment. Plant cell papilla (GO:0090395), leaf papilla (GO:0090396), and stigma papilla (GO:0090397) have been added to GO. To annotate to a cell that has a papilla, consider papilla cell (PO:0025166), leaf papilla cell (PO:0025167), or stigma papilla cell (PO:0025168).
def: "OBSOLETE. A soft protuberance on an epidermal cell of the stigma." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0002001.name: papillae

comment: The zygote divides to form an embryo apical cell and an embryo basal cell.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is the lower-most cell formed after the first division of the plant zygote (PO:0000423) and is part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0002002.name: embryo basal cell

comment: Commonly thick walled, with pointed ends and bordered pits that have lenticular to slit-like apertures. If both libriform fibers (PO:0004520) and fiber tracheids are present, the libriform fibers usually have thicker walls. Fiber tracheids have bordered pits with smaller pit cavities than the vessel members (PO:0002003) or tracheids (PO:0000301) of the same wood and a distinct pit cavity leading from the pit cavity to the cell lumen through the thick cell wall.
def: "A tracheary element (PO:0000290) that is part of a xylem vessel (PO:0025417) and has as parts perforation plates." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0002003.name: xylem vessel member

def: "The silk scar is composed of the shrivelled remains of the intercalary region of the silk, together with the base of the silk which is the true stylar tissue of the silk arising from the distal end of the developing kernel (caryopsis)." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0002004.name: silk scar

def: "A region of the root between the meristem and the region of rapid elongation in which isodiametric growth (cell expansion) occurs." [Agricola:IND23249552]
PO:0003000.name: transition zone

comment: This term was made obsolete because the definition was not correct. A new term with the same name and correct definitions was created to replace it.
def: "OBSOLETE. A zone of small, densely cytoplasmic cells that are dividing and expanding in size located behind the zone of cell division in the primary root." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003003.name: obsolete primary root elongation zone
synonym: "zona de elongaci&#243n obsoleta de la ra&#237z primary (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Term is specific for parasitic plants only.
def: "OBSOLETE. The root of particular parasitic plants that becomes cemented to the host axis and intrudes into the tissues of the host." [http://www.botgard.ucla.edu/html/botanytextbooks/generalbotany/typesofroots/]
PO:0003004.name: haustorial root

def: "A shoot-borne root (PO:0000042) that forms at a shoot axis node (PO:0005004)." [http://www.botgard.ucla.edu/html/botanytextbooks/generalbotany/typesofroots/, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0003005.name: shoot-borne nodal root

comment: This term was brought back from OBSOLETE node (original reason for OBSOLETE: synonym of term stele). Since stele encompasses both vascular system and the pith, in roots with pith, vascular system and stele are not synonymous.
def: "A vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a root." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0003011.name: root vascular system
synonym: "sistema vascular de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This term was made obsolete because the definition was not correct. A new term with the same name and correct definitions was created to replace it.
def: "OBSOLETE. The portion of the lateral root located behind the zone of cell division that includes small, densely cytoplasmic cells that are dividing and expanding in size." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003014.name: obsolete lateral root elongation zone
synonym: "zona de elongaci&#243n obsoleta de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root differentiation zone that is part of a primary root." [POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003015.name: primary root differentiation zone
synonym: "zona de diferenciaci&#243n de la ra&#237z primary (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root differentiation zone that is part of a lateral root." [POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003016.name: lateral root differentiation zone
synonym: "zona de diferenciaci&#243n de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root cap that is part of a primary root tip." [POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003017.name: root cap of primary root
synonym: "caliptra de la ra&#237z primary (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root cap that is part of a lateral root tip." [POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003018.name: root cap of lateral root
synonym: "caliptra de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A central root cap that is part of a root cap of lateral root." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003019.name: central root cap of lateral root
relationship: part_of PO:0003018 ! root cap of lateral root
synonym: "caliptra de la ra&#237z central de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A lateral root cap that is part of a root cap of lateral root." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003020.name: lateral root cap of lateral root
relationship: part_of PO:0003018 ! root cap of lateral root
synonym: "caliptra de la ra&#237z lateral de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A central root cap that is part of a root cap of primary root." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003021.name: central root cap of primary root
relationship: part_of PO:0003017 ! root cap of primary root
synonym: "caliptra de la ra&#237z central de la ra&#237z primaria (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A central root cap that is part of a root cap of primary root." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0003022.name: lateral root cap of primary root
relationship: part_of PO:0003017 ! root cap of primary root
synonym: "caliptra de la ra&#237z lateral de la ra&#237z primaria (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Root nodules are a symbiosis between a plant (often, but not exclusively, of the Fabaceae) and bacteria of the genus Rhizobium, Bradyrhizobium, or Azorhizobium.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is an outgrowth of a root (PO:0009005) and is inhabited by nitrogen-fixing bacteria." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0003023.name: root nodule

comment: The stolon develops from an axillary bud and produces adventitious roots at the nodes and a terminal aerial stem. That stem then sends out one or more stolons from its axillary buds and the process is reiterated. A unique part of this process is that the first internode of a stolon is very long and then the shoot becomes an erect rosette.
def: "A branch that is slender, prostrate or trailing and above-ground and produces roots and sometimes erect shoots at its nodes." [APweb:Glossary, POC:curators]
PO:0003024.name: stolon

comment: This term was originally named apical cell. It was made obsolete to avoid confusion with the new term apical cell (PO:0030007). This term is replaced by embryonic apical cell (PO:0025284).
def: "OBSOLETE. An embryonic plant cell that is the uppermost cell formed after the first division of the zygote." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004000.name: obsolete apical cell

comment: Also called motor cell because of its presumed participation in the mechanism of rolling and unrolling of leaves. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "An enlarged more or less thin-walled leaf pavement cell, present, with other similar cells, in longitudinal rows in leaves of monocots." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004001.name: bulliform cell

comment: Not used in current plant literature.
def: "OBSOLETE. An axial parenchyma or a ray cell physiologically associated with a tracheary element. Also a cell next to a stoma." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004002.name: contact cell

comment: Protective in function because the walls are highly impervious to water.
def: "A portion of ground issue centrifugally derived from cork cambium, non-living at maturity, and having suberized walls." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0004003.name: phellem

comment: Functional term
def: "OBSOLETE. A compact layer of cells, often secretory in function, covering a free surface or lining a cavity." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004004.name: epithelium cell

comment: Obsoleted: Too general definition of the term. Replaced by laticifer cell (PO:0025031).
def: "OBSOLETE. A specialized cells or ducts resembling vessels; they form branched networks of latex-secreting cells in the phloem and other parts of plants." [http://academic.kellogg.edu/herbrandsonc/bio111/glossary/glossary.htm]
PO:0004005.name: laticiferous cell

def: "A chlorenchyma cell that is part of a mesophyll." [POC:curators, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004006.name: mesophyll cell

comment: Not used in current plant literature. Confusing definition.
def: "OBSOLETE. A cell within the phellem (cork) but distinct from the cork cell in having no suberin in its walls." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004007.name: phelloid cell

comment: Functional characterization is not part of the criteria.
def: "OBSOLETE. A chloroplast-containing cell engaged in photosynthesis." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004008.name: photosynthetic cell

comment: One of two types of short cells in the epidermis of grasses. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025).
def: "Cells with deposits of silica in them. One of the two types of short cells in the epidermis of grasses and bamboos. It is usually paired with epidermal cork cell." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004009.name: silica cell

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) synthesizing protoplasm and producing new cells by division and with only a primary cell wall." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0004010.name: meristematic cell

comment: Initial cells are often part of a portion of tissue that is composed mostly of somewhat older, differentiating cells. The division of an initial cell is often uneven, with the smaller daughter cell remaining meristematic.
def: "A meristematic cell (PO:0004010) that by division gives rise to two cells, one of which remains meristematic, while the other is added to the plant body." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004011.name: initial cell

comment: This is a functional term.
def: "OBSOLETE. Cell that produces secreted substances." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004012.name: secretory cell

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is part of a portion of epidermis (PO:0005679)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0004013.name: epidermal cell

def: "A vascular leaf expansion stage (PO:0001052) at which a leaflet primordium (PO:0025481) is initiated on the leaf rachis (PO:0020055) of a compound leaf (PO:0020043)." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004500.name: formation of vascular leaflet primordia stage

def: "Stage of gynoecium development defined by differentiation and expansion of carpels." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004501.name: gynoecium differentiation and expansion stage

comment: Closure of the carpel can occur in various ways, by fusion or secretion.
def: "Stage of gynoecium development defined by the closure of the carpel(s)." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004502.name: closure of carpel(s) stage

def: "Epidermal cells at the top of developing style differentiate stigma." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004503.name: stigma cell differentiation stage

def: "Stage of ovule development defined by differentiation and expansion of ovules." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004504.name: ovule differentiation and expansion stage

def: "The earliest stage of seed development immediately following double fertilization." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004505.name: fertilized ovule stage

def: "Stage of seed development characterized by seed growth and differentiation." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004506.name: developing seed stage

comment: A plant embryo bilateral stage is commonly known as the heart stage in dicotyledonous plants and the transition stage in monocots. Preceded by a plant embryo globular stage (PO:0001185).
def: "A plant embryo development stage (PO:0007631) that occurs during the interval between the transition from radial to bilateral symmetry in a plant embryo proper (PO:0000001) and the onset of either the plant embryo cotyledonary stage (PO:0001078) or the plant embryo coleoptilar stage (PO:0001094)." [PMID:24784759, POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0004507.name: plant embryo bilateral stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0001185 ! plant embryo globular stage

def: "A trichome (PO:0000282) that secretes or sequesters a portion of plant substance (PO:0025161)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004509.name: glandular trichome

def: "A trichome that develops from seed coat epidermis." [POC:curators]
PO:0004511.name: seed trichome

comment: Heartwood has ceased to function in storage and conduction, and the reserve materials have been removed or converted into heartwood substances. It is generally darker colored than sapwood (PO:0004513) and is found in the center of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) or root (PO:0009005), interior to the sapwood. Heartwood forms at the end of a cell death stage of secondary xylem (PO:0025466).
def: "A portion of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) that lacks living secondary xylem parenchyma cells (PO:0004525)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0004512.name: heartwood

comment: Sapwood contains reserve materials and may function in the conduction of water and minerals (xylem sap (PO:0025539)). It is generally lighter colored than the heartwood (PO:0004512) and is located between the heartwood and the vascular cambium (PO:0005598) of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) or root (PO:0009005). Sapwood forms during a secondary xylem development stage (PO:0025427).
def: "A portion of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) that has as parts living secondary xylem parenchyma cells (PO:0004525)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0004513.name: sapwood

comment: Appears as a ring in a transverse section of plant axis (PO:0025004). May be an annual ring (one growth ring per year) or a false annual ring (more or less than one growth ring per year).
def: "A portion of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) that has as parts a single layer of early wood (PO:0004515) and a single layer of late wood (PO:0004516) from the same growth season and is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) or root (PO:0009005)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0004514.name: growth ring

comment: The transition from early wood to late wood may be gradual and is not always easy to distinguish.
def: "A portion of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) that is a part of a growth ring (PO:0004514) formed during the early part of a growing season, has lower density than late wood (PO:0004516) of the same growth ring, and has as parts early wood tracheary elements (PO:0025461) with generally larger lumens than the late wood tracheary elements (PO:0025462) of the same growth ring." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0004515.name: early wood

comment: The transition from early wood to late wood may be gradual and is not always easy to distinguish.
def: "A portion of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) that is a part of a growth ring (PO:0004514) formed during the later part of a growing season, has higher density than early wood (PO:0004515) of the same growth ring, and has as parts late wood tracheary elements (PO:0025462) with generally smaller lumens than the early wood tracheary elements (PO:0025461) of the same growth ring." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0004516.name: late wood
