comment: Used to describe the boundary area between two adjacent growth rings, which may be distinct or indistinct.
def: "A portion of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) that includes the last-formed late wood (PO:0004516) of one growth ring (PO:0004514) and the earliest-formed early wood (PO:0004515) of the next growth ring." [POC:curators]
PO:0004517.name: growth ring boundary
synonym: "l&#237mite del anillo de crecimiento (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "All tissues outside the vascular cambium or the xylem; in older trees may be divided into dead outer bark and living inner bark, which consists of secondary phloem." [POC:curators]
PO:0004518.name: bark

def: "A fiber cell (PO:0025407) that is part of a portion of phloem (PO:0005417) tissue." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004519.name: phloem fiber cell

comment: Libriform fiber cells have simple (unbordered) pits while fiber tracheids (PO:0000355) have bordered pits. Many intermediate forms exist and are generally classified as fiber tracheids (PO:0000355). If both libriform fiber cells and fiber tracheids are present, the libriform fiber cells usually have thicker walls. Libriform fiber cells have a slit-like aperture toward the cell lumen, but no pit cavity.
def: "A xylem fiber cell (PO:0000274) with simple pits." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004520.name: libriform fiber cell

comment: A septate fiber septum is composed of the adjacent primary cell walls of two internal cells that arise from mitosis within the septate fiber cell after it has formed a secondary cell wall (GO:0009531).
def: "A plant fiber cell (PO:0025407) with thin transverse walls (septa), which are formed when mitosis occurs within the cell after development of a secondary cell wall (GO:0009531)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0004521.name: septate fiber cell

def: "Cambium at the outer margin of the xylem cylinder." [POC:curators]
PO:0004522.name: outer vascular cambium

def: "Cambium occurring within xylem." [POC:curators]
PO:0004523.name: included vascular cambium

def: "A portion of secondary phloem tissue produced by included vascular cambium." [POC:curators]
PO:0004524.name: included phloem

def: "A parenchyma cell (PO:0000074) that is part of a portion of secondary xylem parenchyma (PO:0004532)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0004525.name: secondary xylem parenchyma cell
synonym: "c&#233lula parenquim&#225tica de la madera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A secondary xylem parenchyma cell (PO:0004525) that is part of a portion of axial secondary xylem parenchyma (PO:0004533)." [ISBN:0471245208]
intersection_of: part_of PO:0004533 ! axial secondary xylem parenchyma
PO:0004526.name: axial secondary xylem parenchyma cell
relationship: part_of PO:0004533 ! axial secondary xylem parenchyma

synonym: "par&#233nquima axial de la madera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Occurs in bands or rays of variable width and height that extend radially in the secondary xylem (PO:0005848) and secondary phloem (PO:0005043) of a plant axis (PO:0025004).
def: "A portion of secondary xylem parenchyma (PO:0004532) that is part of a ray system (PO:0025411) and has as parts ray secondary xylem parenchyma cells (PO:0004527)." [ISBN:0471245194]
PO:0004534.name: ray secondary xylem parenchyma
synonym: "par&#233nquima de rayo de la madera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of placenta tissue that is part of a fruit and to which seeds are attached." [POC:curators]
PO:0004535.name: fruit placenta

comment: The ultimate branch in an infructescence.
def: "An infructescence branch (PO:0025243) that supports an individual fruit (PO:0009001)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0004536.name: fruit pedicel

comment: Common in Citrus.
def: "A somatic plant embryo derived directly from nucellus cells." [POC:curators]
PO:0004537.name: nucellar plant embryo

comment: Nodule is persistent and may continue to grow after a physiological stress.
def: "A root nodule characterized by a persistent meristem, presence of vascular transfer cells, and cell division in the inner cortex with non-dividing infected cells and bacteria." [ISBN:1842460137, POC:curators]
PO:0004538.name: indeterminate nodule

comment: Nodules are not persistent.
def: "A root nodule characterized by a dividing infected cells and bacteria, vascular transfer cells absent and cell division is in the outer cortex." [POC:curators]
PO:0004539.name: determinate nodule

def: "A columella that forms the central axis of a fruit." [POC:curators]
PO:0004540.name: fruit columella

comment: In ferns and many monocots, a rhizome is a primary axis (stem), while in other species, it is a branch. Usually produces scale-like leaves.
def: "A swollen shoot axis (PO:0025029) that grows horizontally at or below the substrate surface and produces shoots above and roots or rhizoids below." [POC:curators]
PO:0004542.name: rhizome

comment: Functions in storage of photosynthate metabolites. This term should be used for tubers derived from branches, as found in Solanum spp. (e.g. potato) or Dioscorea spp. (e.g. yam) and other species. Use the term tuberous root tuber (PO:0025476) for tubers derived from roots, such as those found in Cassava, Ipomoea, or Hemerocallis.
def: "A tuber (PO:0025522) that develops from a branch (PO:0025073)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004543.name: shoot axis tuber

def: "A shoot system that is initiated from a root." [POC:curators]
PO:0004544.name: root-borne shoot system
synonym: "sistema de epiblasto (epiblastema) que nace en la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot system that is initiated from a shoot." [POC:curators]
PO:0004545.name: shoot-borne shoot system
synonym: "sistema de epiblasto (epiblastema) que nace en el epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot-borne shoot system (PO:0004546) developing from a stem (PO:0009047)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004546.name: epicormic shoot system

comment: Functions in storage of photosynthate metabolites. This term should be used for tubers derived from branches, as found in Solanum spp. (e.g. potato) or Dioscorea spp. (e.g. yam) and other species. Use the term tuberous root tuber (PO:0025476) for tubers derived from roots, such as those found in Cassava, Ipomoea, or Hemerocallis.
def: "A shoot axis tuber (PO:0004543) that develops below ground." [POC:curators]
PO:0004547.name: subterranean tuber

def: "A shoot axis tuber (PO:0004543) that develops above ground." [POC:curators]
PO:0004548.name: aerial tuber

comment: May be a single or double layer. Usually crushed by the endothecium and therefore almost invariably degenerates early during anther development. In some angiosperms, including Arabidopsis, it develops from an anther wall outer secondary parietal cell layer. In other angiosperms, it develops directly from an anther wall primary parietal cell layer, while in still others, two layers of the middle layer may develop from both an anther wall outer secondary parietal cell layer and an anther wall inner secondary parietal cell layer.
def: "A portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) directly internal to an anther wall endothecium (PO:0020002) that develops from an anther wall secondary parietal cell layer (PO:0006007)." [ISBN:9780003686647, POC:curators]
PO:0004700.name: anther wall middle layer
relationship: develops_from PO:0006007 ! anther wall secondary parietal cell layer

def: "Shoot system in which the internodes elongate little or at all, bearing reproductive structures and/or leaves." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0004701.name: short shoot

def: "Shoot system in which all or most of the internodes elongate." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0004702.name: long shoot

def: "A phyllome primordium (PO:0025128) that develops from a carpel anlagen (PO:0006005) and is committed to the development of a carpel (PO:0009030)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004703.name: carpel primordium

def: "A phyllome primordium (PO:0025128) that develops from a sepal anlagen (PO:0025485) and is committed to the development of a sepal (PO:0009031)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004704.name: sepal primordium

def: "A phyllome primordium (PO:0025128) that develops from a stamen anlagen (PO:0025486) and is committed to the development of a stamen (PO:0009029)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004705.name: stamen primordium

comment: This term was made obsolete because it is ambiguous. Use flower meristem (PO:0000229) or floral structure primordium (PO:0025477) instead. If annotating to a primordium of a floral structure, it is better to use the more specific term, such as petal primordium (PO:0000021) or anther primordium (PO:0006089).
def: "OBSOLETE. A primordium that will develop into a flower." [POC:curators]
PO:0004706.name: flower primordium

comment: Upon fruit maturation by drying, undergoes cell separation, allowing the valves to detach from the replum and seeds to be dispersed.
def: "A dehiscence zone that is part of a fruit." [POC:curators]
PO:0004707.name: fruit dehiscence zone
synonym: "zona de dehiscencia del fruto (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Found in grasses where no hypocotyl is present. The scutellar node may represent a reduction of the hypocotyl and cotyledonary node.
def: "A stem node that is the part of an embryo axis directly above the radicle where the scutellum is attached." [ISBN:0471244554]
PO:0004708.name: scutellar node

def: "A bud (PO:0000055) that develops from an axillary bud meristem (PO:0000232)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004709.name: axillary bud

def: "An axillary bud that develops into a flower." [POC:curators]

def: "An axillary reproductive bud that develops into an inflorescence." [POC:curators]

def: "An axillary bud (PO:0004712) that develops into a shoot system (PO:0009006) that has as organ parts only vegetative organs." [POC:curators]

def: "A bud that develops from a shoot apical meristem." [POC:curators]

PO:0004714.name: terminal flower bud

def: "A terminal reproductive bud develops into an inflorescence." [POC:curators]
PO:0004715.name: terminal inflorescence bud

def: "A terminal bud (PO:0004713) that develops into a shoot system (PO:0009006) that has as organ parts only vegetative organs." [POC:curators]
PO:0004716.name: terminal vegetative bud

comment: In the leaf epidermis of Poaceae and Joinvilleaceae, long cells and short cells often alternate in longitudinal rows. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A more or less rectangular leaf pavement cell in which the proximodistal dimension is several times longer than the transverse dimension." [POC:curators]
PO:0004717.name: long cell

comment: In the leaf epidermis of Poaceae and Joinvilleaceae, long cells and short cells often alternate in longitudinal rows. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "An isodiametric leaf pavement cell." [POC:curators]
PO:0004718.name: short cell

def: "A canal (PO:0025132) that is a longitudinal groove in the testa through a prominent hilum (PO:0020063) of a seed (PO:0009010)." [POC:curators]
PO:0004719.name: hilum groove

def: "A portion of cortex (PO:0005708) that is part of an inflorescence branch (PO:0009081), also called a paraclade." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]

def: "A portion of cortex (PO:0005708) that is part of a pedicel (PO:0009052)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]

def: "A phyllome vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a sepal." [POC:Ramona_Walls]

def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is the part of a plant axis (PO:0025004) where a radicle (PO:0020031) joins a hypocotyl (PO:0020100)." [ISBN:9780881928501, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0004724.name: hypocotyl-root junction
synonym: "union del hipoc&#243tile con la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: While the abaxial side of the leaf is usually the lower surface, the vascular leaves (PO:0009025) of some plants may not have an obvious adaxial or abaxial side such as the leaves of many xerophytic (arid-adapted) species. The adaxial and abaxial side may appear considerably more rounded and this could be due to early activity of the vascular leaf adaxial meristem (PO:0025401) and/or leaf abaxial meristem (PO:0025401).  In other cases, such as Alstromeria, the leaves may be twisted or resupinate.
def: "A portion of vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017) that is distal to the axis of the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and develops into the abaxial side of the leaf lamina (PO:0020039)." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0004725.name: vascular leaf primordium abaxial side
synonym: "lado abaxial del primordio de hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: While the adaxial side of the leaf is usually the upper surface, the vascular leaves (PO:0009025) of some plants may not have an obvious adaxial or abaxial side such as the leaves of many xerophytic (arid-adapted) species. The adaxial and abaxial side may appear considerably more rounded and this could be due to early activity of the vascular leaf adaxial meristem (PO:0025401) and/or leaf abaxial meristem (PO:0025401). In other cases, such as Alstromeria, the leaves may be twisted or resupinate.
def: "A portion of vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017) that is proximal to the axis of the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and develops into the adaxial side of the leaf lamina (PO:0020039)." [POC:Brian_Atkinson, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0004726.name: vascular leaf primordium adaxial side
synonym: "lado adaxial del primordio de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Called a tiller in the Poaceae.
def: "An axillary shoot system (PO:0006343) that is part of a stem base (PO:0008039)." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0005001.name: basal axillary shoot system

comment: The genetic distinction between cauline axillary branches and tillers may or may not be unique to the Poaceae. There are no data for other plant families.
def: "An axillary branch that forms from a leaf above the very base of the shoot." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0005002.name: cauline axillary shoot

comment: Can occur on a stem or branch.
def: "A trichome that is part of a shoot axis epidermis." [PMID:17217456, POC:curators]
PO:0005003.name: shoot axis trichome
synonym: "eje de tricoma del epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) where a bud (PO:0000055) may form and develop into a branch (PO:0025073), leaf (PO:0025034), flower (PO:0004541), inflorescence (PO:0009049) or nodal root (PO:0003005)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0005004.name: shoot axis node

comment: The articulated laticifer cells are joined longitudinally to form a tube, with cross-walls that may be partially to fully perforated.
def: "A portion of secretory tissue (PO:0005656) that has as parts articulated laticifer cells (PO:0006221)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:curators]

comment: This term was made obsolete because a nom-articulated laticifer is not a tissue type but consists of a single cell. Use non-articulated laticifer cell (PO:0006222) instead.
def: "OBSOLETE. A structure consisting of long multinucleate tubes in which latex is found, having no cross walls." [APweb:Glossary, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005007.name: non-articulated laticifer

comment: This term was made obsolete because it was ambiguous. It has been replaced by the more precise terms fruit septum (PO:0025268) and fruit replum (PO:0025267). Annotations for Arabidopsis should go to fruit replum.
def: "OBSOLETE. A thin partition or membrane that divides a cavity or a mass of tissue in the fruit that is derived from the carpel septum." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0005008.name: obsolete fruit septum

comment: Carpel septum was made obsolete because it was ambiguous. It has been replaced by the more precise terms ovary septum (PO:0025262) and ovary replum (PO:0025272). Annotations for Arabidopsis should go to ovary replum (PO:0025272).
def: "OBSOLETE. A thin partition or membrane that divides multilocular ovary. Often found in species with syncarpous (multiple carpels fused) pistil." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005009.name: carpel septum

def: "A septum that is present in an anther dehiscence zone." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005010.name: anther septum

comment: Extends along the entire length of the anther and is observed as an indentation between the locules of each theca. Upon anther maturation, cell separation within the dehiscence zone allows the anther wall to break open and pollen to be released.
def: "A dehiscence zone that is part of an anther." [POC:curators]
PO:0005011.name: anther dehiscence zone
synonym: "zona de dehiscencia de la antera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot axis vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a pedicel." [PMID:17217456, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0005012.name: pedicel vascular system

def: "The outermost primary cell layer of the hypocotyl." [PMID:15368128, TAIR:Donghui_Li]

comment: Can occur in the hypocotyl and root.
def: "A portion of cortex (PO:0005708) that is part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [PMID:16543410, POC:curators, TAIR:Donghui_Li]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue
PO:0005014.name: embryo cortex

def: "A portion of endodermis (PO:0000252) that is part of an plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [PMID:16543410]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue

comment: This term was made obsolete to avoid confusion with the new terms fruit replum and ovary replum. Consider ovary replum (PO:0025272) or fruit replum (PO:0025267).
def: "OBSOLETE. A false septum formed by the ingrowth from the placenta of an ovary rather than from the carpel walls. This is formed post fertilization." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:13678595, PMID:15035986]

comment: Because a vascular system is defined as the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in a plant structure, the vascular systems of floral parts are part of the flower vascular system.
def: "A shoot system vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a flower." [POC:Ramona_Walls]

synonym: "sistema vascular de la flor (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A phyllome vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a stamen." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0005018.name: stamen vascular system

def: "A phyllome vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a carpel." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0005019.name: carpel vascular system

comment: May also contain portions of ground tissue (PO:0025059). The bundle sheath (PO:0006023) can also be part of a vascular bundle, if it is present.
def: "A portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015) that is a unit strand of the vascular system (PO:0000034) and has as part xylem (PO:0005352) or phloem (PO:0005417)." [POC:curators]
PO:0005020.name: vascular bundle

def: "The margin of a sepal." [PMID:15269176, TAIR:Donghui_Li]
PO:0005021.name: sepal margin

def: "A wall of an ovary that is composed of abaxial (outer) and adaxial (inner) epidermis and a middle layer, composed of mesophyll cells and a distinct subepidermal adaxial cell layer (as found in Arabidopsis)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:10332605]
