def: "The epidermal cell layer of the abaxial/outer surface of the ovary." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005023.name: abaxial epidermis of ovary

def: "The epidermal cell layer of the adaxial/inner surface of the ovary." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005024.name: adaxial epidermis of ovary

comment: The cells in the mesophyll layer(s) may not differentiate similar to the spongy and palisade cells found in the leaf mesophyll.
def: "A portion of tissue that is composed of one or more mesophyll layers. It may have a distinct subepidermal adaxial cell layer (as found in Arabidopsis)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:10332605]
PO:0005025.name: middle layer of ovary wall
synonym: "capa media de la pared del ovario (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "Multinucleate cell developed by a series of events involving kayokinesis but not cytokinesis of the initial feeding cell. The events are induced by root knot nematodes (e.g., Meloidogyne sp. ) entering the feeding cells (any cells) of the root vascular system." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:15053756]
PO:0005026.name: root giant cell
synonym: "c&#233lula gigante de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "Multinucleate cell developed by a series of events involving fusion with the neighboring dividing cells. The events are induced by cyst nematodes (e.g. Heterodera schachtii) entering the feeding cells (any cells) of the root vascular system." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:15053756]
PO:0005027.name: root syncytium cell

def: "A shoot system vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in an inflorescence." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0005028.name: inflorescence vascular system

comment: A root primordium may arise from cells of a pericycle (PO:0006203) in a root in most seed plant (pericyclic lateral root primordium; PO:0025492), from cells of an endodermis (PO:0000252) in ferns and some seed plants (non-pericyclic lateral root primordium: PO:0025493), or from cells of a shoot axis (PO:0025029), in the case of a basal root primordium (PO:0025479) or shoot-borne root primordium (PO:0025480). Transition from root primordium to root occurs with the formation of a root cap (PO:0020123), shortly after the development of a root apical meristem (PO:0020147).
def: "A primordium (PO:0025127) that develops from a root anlagen (PO:0025433) and is committed to the development of a root (PO:0009005)." [ISBN:0521288959, POC:curators]
PO:0005029.name: root primordium

comment: One of the major chalconoids from hops is xanthohumol (CHEBI:66331).
def: "A glandular trichome (PO:0004509) that synthesizes terpenophenolic resins and prenylflavonoids." [CHEBI:66331, PMID:18223037, PO:austin_meier]
PO:0005030.name: lupulin gland

def: "A strobilus (PO:0025083) that bears only pollen (PO:0025281)." [POC:austin_meier, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0005031.name: microsporangiate strobilus

def: "A strobilus (PO:0025083) that bears only plant ovules (PO:0020003)." [POC:austin_meier, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0005032.name: megasporangiate strobilus

comment: Contributes to primary thickening of a shoot axis (PO:0025029), adventitious (shoot-borne) root (PO:0000042) formation, and formation of linkages between shot axis (PO:0000039), leaf (PO:0000036), and root (PO:0003011) vascular systems. Contiguous with the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) in some species, but not all. Produces more or less distinct vascular bundles (PO:0005020) surrounded by ground tissue (PO:0025059), as opposed to the more or less continuous xylem (PO:0005352) and phloem (PO:0005417) produced by a vascular cambium (PO:0005598). A primary thickening meristem is a multi-layered structure, compared to the single layer of a cambium. Found in many monocotyledons.
def: "A shoot lateral meristem (PO:0006344) that is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) and has a parts multiple layers of meristematic cells (PO:0004010) located near the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148)." [ISBN:0471245208, JSTOR:4354165]
PO:0005039.name: primary thickening meristem

def: "A portion of pith (PO:0006109) that is part of a root stele (PO:0020124)." [ISBN:0080280307]
PO:0005040.name: root pith

comment: Can occur in a stem or branch.
def: "A portion of pith (PO:0006109) that is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029)." [ISBN:0080280307]
PO:0005041.name: shoot axis pith
synonym: "m&#233dula del eje del epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Secondary phloem develops as part of secondary growth (GO:0080117).
def: "A portion of phloem (PO:0005417) tissue that develops from a vascular cambium (PO:0005598)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0005043.name: secondary phloem

comment: After secondary growth, the periderm may replace the epidermis in stems and roots, rarely in other organs. In some cases, the epidermis is retained after periderm development. Periderm is derived from lateral meristem and may contain secondary phloem.
def: "A peripheral portion of ground tissue in a plant axis that is composed of phellogen, phellem, and phelloderm." [ISBN:047124529, POC:curators]
PO:0005046.name: periderm

def: "A portion of periderm that is part of a root." [POC:curators]
PO:0005047.name: root periderm

comment: Can occur on a stem or branch.
def: "A portion of periderm that is part of a shoot axis." [POC:curators]
PO:0005048.name: shoot axis periderm
synonym: "peridermis del eje del epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of ground tissue often resembling cortical parenchyma produced centripetally by the cork cambium." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005050.name: phelloderm

comment: A layer or layers of cells beneath the epidermis that is distinct in appearance from adjacent tissues.
def: "A portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) that is the outermost layer of a portion of cortex (PO:0005708)." [POC:curators]
PO:0005051.name: hypodermis

comment: Consists primarily of parenchyma cells but may contain other cell types as the callus begins to differentiate. May be formed as a result of wounding or may develop in culture.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that consists of mass of undifferentiated plant cells (PO:0009002)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:curators]
PO:0005052.name: plant callus

comment: This term was made obsolete because its had only one subclass. Consider non-articulated laticifer (PO:0005007), articulated laticifer cell (PO:0006221) or non-articulated laticifer cell (PO:0006222) instead.
def: "OBSOLETE. A secretory structure that produces latex." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005053.name: laticifer

comment: Can occur in a stem or branch.
def: "A portion of shoot axis hypodermis (PO:0005057) that is part of a stem cortex (PO:0000223)." [ISBN:0080374913, POC:curators]
PO:0005057.name: shoot axis hypodermis
synonym: "hipodermis del eje del epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Can occur in a stem or branch.
def: "A portion of endodermis (PO:0000252) that is part of a shoot axis cortex (PO:0000223)." [POC:curators]
PO:0005058.name: shoot axis endodermis
synonym: "endodermis de eje del epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of endodermis that is part of a root cortex." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005059.name: root endodermis

comment: Often found in the leaf of Gymnosperms and elsewhere.
def: "A portion of endodermis that is part of a vascular leaf." [POC:curators]
PO:0005060.name: leaf endodermis

comment: The term was made obsolete because schizo-lysigenous form is an attribute of regular aerenchyma.
def: "OBSOLETE. Aerenchyma, originating by a combination of two processes, separation and degradation of cell walls." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005349.name: schizo-lysigenous aerenchyma

comment: Functions in the translocation of water and solutes from roots (PO:0009005) to the shoot system (PO:0009006) and in support. Tracheary elements have lignified cell walls with secondary thickening and are dead at maturity.
def: "A portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015) that has as part one or more tracheary elements (PO:0000290)." [ISBN:0471245194]
PO:0005352.name: xylem

def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the outermost layer of endosperm in a seed, its cells being characterized by presence of protein bodies containing seed storage proteins." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005360.name: aleurone layer

comment: Often devoid of intercellular spaces.
def: "A portion of seed storage parenchyma that is part of an endosperm." [ISBN:0080374913, POC:curators]
PO:0005415.name: endosperm parenchyma

comment: Functions in the conduction of organic substances in vascular plants.
def: "A portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015) that has as parts sieve elements (PO:0025406)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0005417.name: phloem

comment: Parenchyma contains relatively unspecialized cells.
def: "A portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) composed of polyhedral cells typically with thin, non-lignified cellulosic cell walls and nucleate, living protoplasts." [POC:curators]
PO:0005421.name: parenchyma

def: "Living tissue composed of more or less elongated cells with thick non-lignified primary cell walls." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005423.name: collenchyma

def: "Chloroplast-containing parenchyma tissue." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005426.name: chlorenchyma

def: "A supporting tissue composed of fibers or sclereids." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005427.name: sclerenchyma

comment: This term is applied to only two types of meristems: vascular cambium (PO:0005598) and cork cambium/phellogen (PO:0005599).
def: "A lateral meristem (PO:0020145) that has as part a single layer of cambial initial cells (PO:0000295) and their derivatives, arranged orderly in radial files." [ISBN:047125208]
PO:0005597.name: cambium

comment: A vascular cambium produces cells in both directions, centrifugally and centrifically, leading to an increase in the cross-sectional area of a plant axis (PO:0025004).
def: "A cambium (PO:0005597) that is located between and gives rise to secondary xylem (PO:0005848) and secondary phloem (PO:0005043)." [ISBN:047125208]
PO:0005598.name: vascular cambium

comment: Cork cambium is located between the phellem and phelloderm and produces phellem toward the outside and phelloderm toward the inside of a plant axis (PO:0025004).
def: "A cambium (PO:0005597) that is part of a periderm (PO:0005046) and produces phellem (PO:0004003) and phelloderm (PO:0005050)." [ISBN:047125208]
PO:0005599.name: cork cambium

comment: The term was made obsolete because angular form is a common attribute of ordinary collenchyma.
def: "OBSOLETE. A form of collenchyma in which the primary wall thickening is most prominent in the angles where three or more cells are joined." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005621.name: angular collenchyma

comment: The term was made obsolete because the lacunar form is an attribute of regular collenchyma.
def: "OBSOLETE. A collenchyma characterized by intercellular spaces and cell wall thickenings facing the intercellular spaces." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005632.name: lacunar collenchyma

comment: The term was made obsolete because lamellar form is an attribute of regular collenchyma.
def: "OBSOLETE. A collenchyma in which cell wall thickenings are deposited mainly on tangential walls." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005633.name: lamellar collenchyma

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "The chloroplast-containing, photosynthetic parenchymatous tissue situated between the two epidermal layers of the foliage leaf." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005645.name: leaf mesophyll

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "Leaf mesophyll parenchyma characterized by little elongated cells, that are not closely packed and have conspicuous intercellular spaces." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005647.name: spongy mesophyll

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "Parenchyma containing closely packed elongated chlorenchymatous cells oriented perpendicular to the leaf surface and which are active in photosynthesis." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005648.name: palisade mesophyll

comment: The synonym gland does not imply non-secretory 'glands'.
def: "Tissues that form specialized structures producing a secretion." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:047124529]
PO:0005656.name: portion of secretory tissue

comment: Hydathodes may have one or more pores that are similar to stomata but lack the ability to open and close. Hydathodes are involved in the release of water or xylem sap through pores via guttation or secretion. Generally, hydathodes are located at the end of a minor vein in a phyllome. In many plants, hydathodes includes a portion of thin-walled parenchyma between the tracheary elements and the pore, known as an epithem. In some plants, hydathodes are associated with secretory tissue.
def: "A cardinal organ part that releases water through a hydathode pore." [ISBN:0471244554]
PO:0005660.name: hydathode

comment: A crust of salt forms on leaves which tastes bad and the white surfaces act to reflect light. Example, as is Mangrove vegetation.
def: "A specialized tissue where excess salt absorbed in water from the soil is concentrated, being stores or excreted." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005661.name: salt gland

def: "A canal (PO:0025132) of schizogenous origin, lined with secretory resin cells (PO:0025604) and containing plant resin (PO:0025603)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913, PMID:11337413, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0005665.name: resin canal

comment: Oil glands are schizogenous.
def: "A gland or a cavity lined with cells that secrete oils." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0005669.name: oil gland

comment: The epidermis can be composed of one or more layers of cells. In some species of vascular plants, the epidermis, which is a primary tissue, is replaced by periderm, which is secondary tissue, later in development. The epidermis can also include trichomes, stomatal pores, root hairs, and rhizoids.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) composed of epidermal cells (PO:0004013) that develops from the protoderm (PO:0006210) and covers the surface of a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [POC:curators]
PO:0005679.name: epidermis

comment: As applied to an intercellular space, originating by one or a combination of two processes, separation and degradation of cell walls.
def: "A portion of parenchyma tissue containing particularly large intercellular spaces of schizogenous or lysigenous origin." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005702.name: aerenchyma

comment: The term was made obsolete because rhexigenous form is an attribute of regular aerenchyma.
def: "OBSOLETE. Aerenchyma originating by rupture of cells." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005704.name: rhexigenous aerenchyma

comment: The term was made obsolete because lysigenous form is an attribute of regular aerenchyma.
def: "OBSOLETE. Aerenchyma originating by dissolution of cells." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005706.name: lysigenous aerenchyma

def: "A maximal portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) between the vascular system (PO:0000034) and the epidermis (PO:0005679) in a plant." [POC:curators]
PO:0005708.name: cortex

def: "OBSOLETE. Meristematic tissue consisting of apical initials, together with cells derived from them and which are still close to the initial." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005752.name: promeristem

comment: The cell walls are thickened and contain suberin. Absent in pteridophytes, fibrous in Phoenix and accompanied by sclerenchyma in Ananas.
def: "The sub-epidermal layer or layers of cells of the root similar in structure and cytochemical characteristics of the endodermis, the outermost layer or layers of cells of the cortex." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0005772.name: exodermis

comment: Secondary xylem develops as part of secondary growth (GO:0080117). Secondary xylem is the wood of gymnosperm and dicot angiosperm trees, shrubs, and lianas. May be organized into axial (PO:0025410) and ray (PO:0025411) systems. Secondary xylem is often part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) or a root (PO:0009005) but may occur in other organs. Some monocots have a primary thickening meristem (PO:0005039), located near the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148), that gives the appearance of secondary growth and may produce lignified tissue that appears woody but is not composed of secondary xylem. Tracheary elements in secondary xylem (PO:0000290) have lignified cell walls with secondary thickening and are dead at maturity.
def: "A portion of xylem (PO:0005352) tissue that develops from a vascular cambium (PO:0005598)." [ISBN:0471245194]
PO:0005848.name: secondary xylem

comment: Primary xylem develops as part of primary growth (request for primary growth has been made to GO) and is not differentiated into axial (PO:0025410) and ray (PO:0025411) systems. Tracheary elements (PO:0000290) have lignified cell walls with secondary thickening and are dead at maturity.
def: "A portion of xylem (PO:0005352) tissue that develops from the procambium (PO:0025275)." [ISBN:0122151704, ISBN:0471245194]
PO:0005849.name: primary xylem

def: "A collective phyllome structure that encloses a fruit of the Poaceae (caryopsis) and develops from a dried lemma and palea." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006000.name: caryopsis hull

def: "A lateral plant organ (PO:0009008) produced by a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148)." [POC:curators]
PO:0006001.name: phyllome

def: "A glume that is the proximal/basal of the two glumes subtending a pair of florets." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006002.name: lower glume

comment: May be photosynthetic or non-photosynthetic. Some species have vascular leaves that are scale-like (such as Juniperus, Thuja, and Chamaecyparis). Annotations for scale-like leaves should go under vascular leaf (PO:0009025), not scale leaf.
def: "A phyllome that is reduced in size relative to a vascular leaf on the same plant and is often associated with a perennating or dormant bud or a vegetatively propagating organ such as a rhizome." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006003.name: scale leaf

def: "A glume that is the apical/distal of the two glumes subtending a pair of florets." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006004.name: upper glume

def: "A phyllome anlagen (PO:0025430) that will give rise to a carpel primordium (PO:0004703) and is part of a peripheral zone (PO:000225) of a flower meristem (PO:0000229)." [PMID:14729915, POC:curators]
PO:0006005.name: carpel anlagen

def: "A portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) that is part of an anther wall (PO:0000002) and has as parts a primary parietal cell (PO:0006010) and adjacent plant cells." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:9780003686647, PMID:2476454]
PO:0006006.name: anther wall primary parietal cell layer
synonym: "capa primaria de c&#233lulas parietales (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]
"pollen sac primary parietal cell layer" EXACT []

comment: In many angiosperms, the cells of the anther wall primary parietal cell layer undergo a periclinal division, resulting in the formation of two anther wall secondary parietal layers.
def: "A portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) that is part of an anther wall (PO:0000002) and develops from an anther wall primary parietal cell layer (PO:0006006)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:9780003686647, PMID:2476454]
PO:0006007.name: anther wall secondary parietal cell layer
relationship: develops_from PO:0006006 ! anther wall primary parietal cell layer
synonym: "capa secundaria de c&#233lulas parietales (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]
"pollen sac secondary parietal cell layer" EXACT []

comment: In many angiosperms, including Arabidopsis, it divides periclinally to form an anther wall middle layer externally and an anther wall tapetum internally. Alternatively, it may differentiate into a tapetum.
def: "An anther wall secondary parietal cell layer (PO:0006007) that is formed towards the inside, after the cells of an anther wall primary parietal cell layer (PO:0006006) undergo a periclinal division." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:9780003686647, PMID:2476454]
is_a: PO:0006007 ! anther wall secondary parietal cell layer
PO:0006008.name: anther wall inner secondary parietal cell layer
synonym: "capa interna secundaria de c&#233lulas parietales (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]
"pollen sac inner secondary parietal cell layer" EXACT []

comment: In many angiosperms, including Arabidopsis, it differentiates into the anther wall endothecium. Alternatively, it may divide periclinally to form an anther wall endothecium externally and an anther wall middle layer internally.
def: "An anther wall secondary parietal cell layer (PO:0006007) formed towards the outside, after an anther wall primary parietal cell layer (An anther wall secondary parietal cell layer (PO:0006006) undergoes a periclinal division." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:9780003686647, PMID:2476454]
is_a: PO:0006007 ! anther wall secondary parietal cell layer
PO:0006009.name: anther wall outer secondary parietal cell layer
synonym: "capa externa secundaria de c&#233lulas parietales (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]
"pollen sac outer secondary parietal cell layer" EXACT []

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) which is formed by the division of a male archesporial cell (PO:0006014), and is part of the anther wall primary parietal cell layer (PO:0006006)." [PMID:2476454, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006010.name: primary parietal cell
relationship: part_of PO:0006006 ! anther wall primary parietal cell layer

comment: Found in the leaf lamina of some monocots, particularly in Poaceae.
def: "An unbranched second order leaf vein (PO:0020140) that runs between two adjacent primary leaf veins (PO:0025413)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006011.name: lateral leaf vein

def: "A thin band of intercalary meristematic tissue at the junction of a leaf blade (lamina) and a leaf sheath found in grasses." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006012.name: leaf collar

def: "As found in citrus the mature juice sac is a swollen sac with a slender stalk and a sac wall lined with layers of tightly arranged cells. It develops from a single cell of the endocarp. Endocarp develops from the carpellary inner epidermis." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, web:http\://www.chineseplantscience.com/earticle_read.asp?id=12171]
PO:0006013.name: juice sac

comment: Found in heterosporous ferns and seed plants. May also give rise to sterile cells. In seed plants, a male archesporial cell undergoes periclinal division, giving rise to an inner primary sporogenous cell layer and an outer primary parietal cell.
def: "An archesporial cell (PO:0030056) that is part of a microsporangium (PO:0025202) and divides to gives rise to a microsporocyte (PO:0020047)." [PMID:10465788, POC:curators]
PO:0006014.name: male archesporial cell

comment: Found in heterosporous ferns and seed plants. May also give rise to sterile cells. In the majority of flowering plants, including Arabidopsis, the female archesporial cell elongates and polarizes longitudinally, and directly differentiates into the megasporocyte or megaspore mother cell. In some flowering plants, it undergoes a periclinal division, and subsequently the inner cell differentiates into the megasporocyte.
def: "An archesporial cell (PO:0030056) that is part of a megasporangium (PO:0025201) and divides to give rise to a megasporocyte (PO:0000431)." [PMID:10465788, POC:curators]
PO:0006015.name: female archesporial cell

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of phyllome epidermis (PO:0025157) that is part of a leaf." [POC:curators]
PO:0006016.name: leaf epidermis

def: "An endosperm in which the first karyokinetic event is accompanied by the formation of a horizontal wall which divides the central cell into unequal regions. The larger one is the micropylar chamber in which cytokinesis does not occur and the smaller one is the chalazal chamber." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006017.name: helobial endosperm

comment: Used to refer to an adaxial epidermis of an entire leaf. More specific terms exist for leaf lamina adaxial epidermis and petiole adaxial epidermis. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of leaf epidermis (PO:0006016) that covers the adaxial/upper surface of a leaf." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006018.name: leaf adaxial epidermis
synonym: "epidermis adaxial de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Used to refer to an abaxial epidermis of an entire leaf. More specific terms exist for leaf lamina abaxial epidermis and petiole abaxial epidermis. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of leaf epidermis (PO:0006016) that covers the abaxial/lower surface of a leaf." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006019.name: leaf abaxial epidermis
synonym: "epidermis abaxial de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This is different from root lateral meristem.
def: "A root apical meristem (PO:0020147) that gives rise to a lateral root (PO:0020121)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006020.name: lateral root apical meristem
synonym: "meristema apical de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root apical meristem (PO:0020147) that gives rise to a shoot-borne root (PO:0000042)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006021.name: shoot-borne root apical meristem
synonym: "meristema de la ra&#237z adventicia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A strip of ground tissue present along the leaf veins and extending from the bundle sheath to the epidermis. It may be present on one or both sides of the vein and may consist of parenchyma or sclerenchyma." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006022.name: bundle sheath extension
synonym: "extensi&#243n de la vaina vascular (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A layer or layers of cells surrounding the vascular bundles of leaves. It may consist of parenchyma or sclerenchyma." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006023.name: bundle sheath

comment: Homologous to the endodermis.
def: "A single layered, parenchymatous bundle sheath characterized by presence of large quantity of starch." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006024.name: parenchyma sheath

def: "The inner endodermal sheath of a two layered bundle sheath. The cells are smaller in diameter compared to those in outer wall (starch sheath). The cell walls are thick and contain suberized lamellae. They are analogous to endodermis." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006025.name: mestome sheath

def: "An awn that is part of a lemma." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006032.name: lemma awn

def: "A short, abrupt, flexible point present at the apex of the palea." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006033.name: paleal apiculus

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "The margin of the leaflet." [POC:curators]
PO:0006034.name: leaflet margin

comment: Often interrupted by stomatal complexes (PO:0002000) and other structures. The shoot system epidermis is different from the root epidermis (PO:0006036) in its origin, function and structure.
def: "A portion of epidermis (PO:0005679) that is part of a shoot system (PO:0009006) and arises from the meristem L1 layer (PO:0009020)." [ISBN:047124529, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006035.name: shoot system epidermis

comment: The root epidermis is different from the shoot epidermis in its origin, function and structure.
def: "A portion of epidermis that is part of a root system." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006036.name: root epidermis

def: "A portion of root epidermis (PO:0006036) that is part of a shoot-borne root (PO:0000042)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006039.name: shoot-borne root epidermis
synonym: "epidermis de la ra&#237z adventicia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of phyllome epidermis that is part of a sepal." [POC:curators]
PO:0006040.name: sepal epidermis

def: "A portion of phyllome epidermis (PO:0025157) that is part of a petal (PO:0009032)." [POC:curators]
PO:0006041.name: petal epidermis

def: "A multiseriate epidermis found in aerial roots of some monocots. Most of its cells are dead and store water like a sponge." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006042.name: velamen

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A portion epidermis that is part of an integument." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006043.name: integument epidermis

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "The epidermis of the inner integument in an ovule." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006044.name: inner integument epidermis

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "The epidermis of the outer integument in an ovule." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006045.name: outer integument epidermis

def: "A portion of epidermis that is part of a seed coat." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006048.name: seed coat epidermis
synonym: "epidermis de la cubierta de la semilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of shoot epidermis that is part of the scutellum." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue
PO:0006049.name: scutellum epidermis

def: "That part of the seed coat that develops from the outer surface of the outer integument." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006050.name: exotesta

def: "That part of the seed coat that develops from the inner epidermis of the outer integument." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006051.name: endotesta

def: "A portion of petal epidermis that covers the abaxial/lower surface of a petal." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006052.name: petal abaxial epidermis

def: "A portion of petal epidermis that covers the adaxial/upper surface of a petal." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006053.name: petal adaxial epidermis

def: "A portion of sepal epidermis that covers the abaxial/lower surface of a sepal." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006054.name: sepal abaxial epidermis

def: "A portion of sepal epidermis that covers the adaxial/upper surface of a sepal." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006055.name: sepal adaxial epidermis

def: "A leaf epidermis that is part of a cotyledon." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006056.name: cotyledon epidermis

def: "The abaxial/lower epidermal cell layer of the cotyledon." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006057.name: cotyledon abaxial epidermis

def: "The adaxial/upper epidermal cell layer of the cotyledon." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006058.name: cotyledon adaxial epidermis

def: "A portion of stamen epidermis that is part of a filament." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006060.name: filament epidermis

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A portion of carpel epidermis that is part of a stigma." [PMID:11951033, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006061.name: stigma epidermis

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A portion of carpel epidermis that is part of a style." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006062.name: style epidermis

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A portion of epidermis that is part of an ovary." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006063.name: ovary epidermis

def: "A portion of endodermis (PO:0000252) that is part of a hypocotyl (PO:0020100)." [POC:curators]
PO:0006065.name: hypocotyl endodermis

def: "A portion of parenchyma tissue that is part of a petiole." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006066.name: petiole parenchyma

comment: If found, this zone is a temporary feature mostly in Gymnosperms.
def: "OBSOLETE. A cup-shaped region in the shoot apical meristem found between the central mother cell and the rib and peripheral zone. The cells of this zone are derived from the corpus intials, but in some cases they arise also from tunica initials." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006067.name: cambium-like transitional zone
synonym: "zona transicional semejante al cambium (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of parenchyma tissue that is part of a sepal." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006068.name: sepal parenchyma

def: "A portion of parenchyma (PO:0005421) tissue that is part of a petal (PO:0009032)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006069.name: petal parenchyma

def: "The chloroplast-containing, photosynthetic parenchymatous tissue situated between the two epidermal layers of the leaf or leaf like organs." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006070.name: mesophyll

def: "The chloroplast-containing, photosynthetic parenchymatous tissue situated between the two epidermal layers of the petal." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006071.name: petal mesophyll

def: "The chloroplast-containing, photosynthetic parenchymatous tissue situated between the two epidermal layers of the sepal." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006072.name: sepal mesophyll

comment: See subtypes: leaf intercalary meristem (PO:0006346) and stem intercalary meristem (PO:0006347). Not known to occur in roots. Term for primary growth has been requested in GO.
def: "A shoot system meristem (PO:0006079) that is intercalated between two portions of non-meristematic tissue and results in an increase in length as part of primary growth." [ISBN:0080374913, ISBN:0122151704, POC:curators]
PO:0006073.name: intercalary meristem

comment: This term was made obsolete because the parentage and definition changed slightly. It is replaced by PO:0025275.
def: "OBSOLETE. A portion of primary cambium that undergoes differentiation to form the primary vascular tissue." [ISBN:0471244554]
PO:0006074.name: obsolete procambium

comment: In stem or root it is differentiated behind the apical meristem. Primary phloem develops as part of primary growth (GO term for primary growth has been requested).
def: "A portion of phloem (PO:0005417) tissue that develops from the procambium (PO:0025275)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0006075.name: primary phloem

comment: Metaphloem develops after a portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015) has stopped elongating, in the same location as the protophloem, replacing the protophloem. Sieve elements in the metaphloem are larger than in the protophloem. Develops before the secondary phloem, if any is formed.
def: "A portion of primary phloem (PO:0006075) tissue that has as parts companion cells (PO:0000071, in angiosperms) or albuminous cells (PO:0025412, in gymnosperms) associated with the sieve elements (PO:0025406) and that develops after the protophloem (PO:0006077)." [ISBN:0471245194, POC:curators]
PO:0006076.name: metaphloem

comment: Protophloem is the first primary phloem to develop in any particular location in a portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015). Sieve elements in the protophloem are smaller than in the metaphloem (PO:0006076). The protophloem usually only lasts a short time before it is replaced by metaphloem.
def: "A portion of primary phloem (PO:0006075) tissue has as parts the first-formed sieve elements (PO:0025406) at a particular location and does not have companion cells (PO:0000071, in angiosperms) or albuminous cells (PO:0025412, in gymnosperms) associated with the sieve elements." [ISBN:0471245194, POC:curators]
PO:0006077.name: protophloem

comment: Redundant to sec ...
def: "OBSOLETE. The vascular tissue of the primary plant body at the embryonic stage." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006078.name: primary vascular tissue

def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is part of a shoot system (PO:0009006)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006079.name: shoot system meristem

comment: Redundant sec phloem and xylem
def: "OBSOLETE. The vascular tissue derived from the vascular cambium because of the secondary growth." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006080.name: secondary vascular tissue

def: "A root apical meristem (PO:0020147) that gives rise to a primary root (PO:0020127)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006081.name: primary root apical meristem
synonym: "meristema apical de la ra&#237z primaria (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of protoderm (PO:0006210) tissue that is the outermost layer of the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148), and gives rise to the leaf abaxial epidermis (PO:0006019)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006082.name: abaxial protoderm

def: "A portion of protoderm (PO:0006210) tissue that is the outermost layer of the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148), and gives rise to the leaf adaxial epidermis (PO:0006018)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006083.name: adaxial protoderm

comment: Found generally in gymnosperm leaves.
def: "Tissue consisting of tracheids and parenchyma cells, associated with the vascular bundle." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006084.name: portion of transfusion tissue
synonym: "porci&#243n del tejido de transfusi&#243n (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that gives rise to a root (PO:0009005)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006085.name: root meristem

comment: Not in current literature.
def: "OBSOLETE. The accessory tissue extending laterally into the mesophyll rather than remaining associated with the vascular bundles." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006086.name: accessory transfusion tissue

comment: check the definition.
def: "OBSOLETE. Tissue that develops from phloem parenchyma in the outer portion of the inner bark accommodating the expansion in circumference." [ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006087.name: proliferation tissue

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) is formed by the division of the male archesporial initial. After several mitotic divisions these cells differentiate into pollen mother cells." [PMID:12897248, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006088.name: primary sporogenous cell

def: "A floral structure primordium (PO:0025477) that is committed to the development of an anther (PO:0009066)." [POC:curators]
PO:0006089.name: anther primordium

comment: Plant organs may be formed after the cultured plant callus is treated with plant growth regulators.
def: "A cultured plant callus that is capable of forming plant organs." [POC:curators]
PO:0006090.name: organogenic callus

comment: Somatic embryos may be formed after the cultured plant callus is treated with plant growth regulators.
def: "A cultured plant callus (PO:0000009) that is capable of forming somatic embryos." [POC:curators]
PO:0006091.name: embryogenic callus

def: "A maximal portion of parenchyma (PO:0005421) in the center of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) or root (PO:0009005)." [ISBN:0080280307]
PO:0006109.name: pith

comment: Found in shoot axes (PO:0025029) and vascular leaves (PO:0009025). Portions of fascicular cambium may merge with interfascular cambium (PO:0006201) or the fascicular cambium from adjacent vascular bundles to form a cylinder, or they may remain isolated.
def: "A portion of vascular cambium (PO:0005598) that develops from a procambium (PO:0025275) in a vascular bundle (PO:0005020) that is part of a shoot system (PO:0009006)." [ISBN:047124529, PO_REF:00014, POC:curators]
PO:0006200.name: fascicular cambium

comment: Portions of interfascicular cambium may merge with fascicular cambium (PO:0006200) to form a cylinder of cambium or they may remain isolated. May develop from meristematic cells (PO:0004010) that have never differentiated into another cell type or from parenchyma cells (PO:0000074) that retain some meristematic ability.
def: "A portion of vascular cambium (PO:00055980) that develops from cells in an interfascicular region (PO:0006202) that is part of a shoot system (PO:0009006)." [ISBN:047124529, PO_REF:00014, POC:curators]
PO:0006201.name: interfascicular cambium

comment: Inapplicable for nearly all monocots.
def: "A portion of ground tissue located between vascular bundles in a shoot axis." [ISBN:0471244554, ISBN:0716710072]
PO:0006202.name: interfascicular region

def: "A portion of ground tissue that is part of a root stele located between the phloem and endodermis." [ISBN:047124529]
PO:0006203.name: pericycle

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) which is diploid (2n), and undergoes meiosis (GO:0007126) to produce four haploid (1n) plant spores (PO:0025017)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006204.name: sporocyte

comment: Usually found in the abaxial/lower part of the leaf mesophyll as in a dorsiventral leaf, but between two palisade parenchyma layers in an isobilateral leaf. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "Irregularly-shaped, chlorenchymatous cell, separated by large air spaces." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006205.name: spongy mesophyll cell

comment: Usually found in the adaxil/upper part of the leaf mesophyll. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "Elongated chlorenchymatous cell oriented perpendicular to the leaf surface and which is active in photosynthesis." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006206.name: palisade mesophyll cell
synonym: "c&#233lula del mes&#243filo en empalizada (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A short cell in the dimorphic type of exodermis with cell wall that remains non-thickened." [PMID:11709575, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0006207.name: exodermal passage cell

def: "Cell in the endodermal layer of the root with cell wall that remains non-thickened." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0006208.name: endodermal passage cell

def: "OBSOLETE. The outer most cell layer of the lateral roots." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006209.name: lateral root epidermis
synonym: "epidermis de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A protoderm may or may not arise from independent initial cells (PO:0004011). Some researchers also refer to it as an epidermis in a  meristematic state.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is the outer layer of an apical meristem (PO:0020144), or the outer layer of a plant embryo proper (PO:0000001), and gives rise to a portion of epidermis (PO:0005679)." [ISBN:047124529, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006210.name: protoderm

comment: Directly involved in the weakening process of abscission.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is part of an abscission zone (PO:0000146) and contains cells that develop an abnormal wall chemistry and swelling resulting in their easily being pulled apart along the pectin-rich middle lamella (GO:0009519)." [ISBN:0122151704]
PO:0006211.name: separation layer

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) composed of a layer of cells that is part of the abscission zone (PO:0000146) that have lignin and suberin depositions and are found on the axial side of the break or exposed surface of abscission." [ISBN:0122151704]
PO:0006212.name: protective layer

def: "Parenchyma tissue containing particularly large intercellular spaces in the tissue of roots." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006213.name: root aerenchyma

def: "A portion of aerenchyma that is part of a stem." [POC:curators]
PO:0006214.name: stem aerenchyma

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A portion of parenchyma tissue containing particularly large intercellular spaces in the leaf mesophyll." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006215.name: leaf aerenchyma

def: "A portion of primary phloem tissue positioned internal to the primary xylem." [ISBN:0122151704]
PO:0006216.name: internal phloem

def: "That part of the seed coat that develops from the outer surface of the inner integument." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006218.name: exotegmen

def: "That part of the seed coat that develops from the inner epidermis of the inner integument." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006219.name: endotegmen

comment: Also called starchy endosperm region (characteristic of some grasses).
def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the central region of an endosperm, composed of cells that are significantly larger than those at the periphery, especially the aleurone and sub-aleurone layers." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0006220.name: central endosperm

comment: The walls between contiguous cells may be perforated or may disappear completely. This terms should be used for individual cells. For multiple cells joined together, use articulated laticifer (PO:0005006).
def: "A laticifer cell (PO:0025031) that is joined longitudinally to other articulated laticifer cells to form a tube." [ISBN:0471245208, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0006221.name: articulated laticifer cell

comment: May be coenocytic (multi-nucleate) and branched and may grow intrusively between other plant cells (PO:0009002).
def: "A laticifer cell (PO:0025031) that is not joined longitudinally to other laticifer cells to form a tube." [PMID:11732189]
PO:0006222.name: non-articulated laticifer cell
synonym: "c&#233lula del latic&#237fero no articulado (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "OBSOLETE. The instances of this parent term are those anatomical terms which have become obsolete." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006300.name: obsolete plant structure

comment: The term has been made obsolete because this concept is used in a very loose sense.
def: "OBSOLETE. Group of cells located beneath anticlinally dividing peripheral layers (tunica) and dividing in many planes. In apical shoot meristem. Such division cause the increase in the volume of shoot." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0006301.name: corpus

comment: The term has been made obsolete because this concept is used in a very loose sense.
def: "OBSOLETE. The outermost layer or layers in the shoot apical meristem of the Angiosperms in which the plane of division is almost anticlinal. This layer contributes to surface growth." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:047124529]
PO:0006302.name: tunica

comment: A similar term L1 meristem (PO:0009020) occurs.
def: "OBSOLETE. The outer layer of the tunica." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006303.name: L1

comment: A similar term L2 meristem (PO:0009021) occurs.
def: "OBSOLETE. The second layer of the tunica." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006304.name: L2

comment: A similar term L3 meristem (PO:0009022) occurs.
def: "OBSOLETE. The innermost layer of the tunica." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006305.name: L3

comment: This term was made obsolete because the definition was changed. It was replaced by PO:0025276.
def: "OBSOLETE. A derivative of the apical meristem which undergoes differentiation to form the primary vascular tissue of a shoot." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006306.name: obsolete shoot procambium

comment: A derivative of the root apical meristem.
def: "A portion of procambium (PO:0025275) tissue that undergoes differentiation to form the primary vascular tissue (PO:0025408) of a root (PO:0009005)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006307.name: root procambium

comment: Not to be confused with lateral root apical meristem (PO:0006020), which is an apical meristem (PO:0020144) of a lateral root (PO:0020121).
def: "A lateral meristem (PO:0020145) that is part of a root (PO:0009005)." [POC:curators]
PO:0006308.name: root lateral meristem
synonym: "meristema lateral de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A spikelet (PO:0009051) that is part of the tassel inflorescence (PO:0020126) and bears tassel florets (PO:0006310) at maturity." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006309.name: tassel spikelet
relationship: develops_from PO:0006358 ! tassel spikelet pair meristem

comment: The tassel floret (PO:0006310) initiates both stamens (PO:0009029) and carpels (PO:0009030), but all carpels abort during development. Found in Zea spp.
def: "A small staminate flower (PO:0025600) that is part of a tassel spikelet (PO:0006309)." [PMID:12015291, POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006310.name: tassel floret

def: "Ultimate inflorescence branch of the maize tassel without a pedicel, developing from the spikelet pair meristem." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006311.name: tassel sessile spikelet

def: "Ultimate inflorescence branch of the maize tassel with a pedicel, developing from the spikelet pair meristem." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006312.name: tassel pedicellate spikelet

def: "A tassel floret that is the lower of the two florets of a pedicellate spikelet of a tassel inflorescence." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006313.name: lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel
synonym: "florete inferior de la espiguilla pedicelada (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A tassel floret that is one of the two florets placed above the lower floret on a pedicellate spikelet rachilla of a tassel inflorescence." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006314.name: upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel
synonym: "florete superior de la espiguilla pedicelada (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A tassel floret that is the lower of the two florets of a sessile spikelet of a tassel inflorescence." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006315.name: lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel
synonym: "florete inferior de la espiguilla s&#233sil (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A tassel floret that is one of the two florets placed above the lower floret on a sessile spikelet rachilla of a tassel inflorescence." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006316.name: upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel
synonym: "florete superior de la espiguilla s&#233sil (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This is not a pedicel in the strict sense, but is the ultimate naked part of the inflorescence axis.
def: "Inflorescence branch that terminates in a spikelet." [Poc:curators]
PO:0006319.name: spikelet pedicel

comment: The ear spikelet forms with two ear florets (PO:0006354), but the lower one aborts during development.
def: "A spikelet (PO:0009051) that is part of the ear inflorescence (PO:0020136) and bears a single ear floret (PO:0006354) at maturity." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:12015291, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006320.name: ear spikelet

def: "An inflorescence branch (PO:0009081) arising from a first order inflorescence axis (PO:0025104)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006321.name: primary inflorescence branch
synonym: "rama de la inflorescencia principal (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "An inflorescence branch (PO:0009081) arising from a primary inflorescence branch (PO:0006321)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006322.name: second order inflorescence branch
synonym: "rama de segundo orden de la inflorescencia  (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "An inflorescence branch (PO:0009081) arising from an axillary bud (PO:0004709) on a first order inflorescence axis (PO:0025104) or from a higher order inflorescence branch that is part of a tassel inflorescence (PO:0020126)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006323.name: tassel inflorescence branch

def: "A first order inflorescence axis (PO:0025104) that is the central axis of a tassel inflorescence (PO:0020126)." [POC:curators]
PO:0006324.name: central spike of tassel inflorescence
synonym: "espiga central del penacho (borla) de la inflorescencia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot node that is part of an inflorescence axis and where a spikelet, flower, floret or inflorescence branch is attached." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006325.name: inflorescence node

def: "A shoot axis internode (PO:0005005) that is part of an inflorescence axis (PO:0020122)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0006326.name: inflorescence axis internode

def: "An inflorescence apical meristem that gives rise to the two or more florets of a grass inflorescence." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006327.name: spikelet meristem

comment: Found in some grass inflorescences.
def: "The meristem that produces two spikelet meristems, each of which produces two floral meristems." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006328.name: spikelet pair meristem
synonym: "par de meristemas de la espiguilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A gynophore is only present when there is an elongation of the axis between the androecium and gynoecium.
def: "A shoot axis that is an elongation of the floral axis that supports the carpels." [ISBN:0521251346]
PO:0006330.name: gynophore

def: "A cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025498) that is a ridge on a seed (PO:0009010) that develops from a raphe (PO:0020027)." [ISBN:047124529, POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0025498 ! cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure
PO:0006331.name: seed raphe

def: "A cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025498) that is attached to a seed (PO:0009010) and is the remnants of a funicle (PO:0020006)." [POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0025498 ! cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure
PO:0006332.name: seed funicle

def: "A remnant of the ovular chalaza that is part of the seed." [POC:curators]
PO:0006333.name: seed chalaza

def: "A plant anatomical space that is enclosed by and forms an opening in a seed coat at the apex of a seed and is the remnant of a micropyle." [POC:curators]
PO:0006334.name: seed micropyle

def: "An outgrowth of the seed funicle, that forms a bridge between the seed micropyle and other tissues. It is also a remnant form of the obturator found in the ovular funicle." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006336.name: seed obturator

comment: This term is used to described not yet fully-developed leaves that are part of an embryo.
def: "A vascular leaf that is part of a plant embryo and is one of the first few leaves to develop from the embryonic shoot apical meristem." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0006338.name: embryo leaf

comment: Many species have juvenile leaves at the base of the stem, adult leaves at the apex, and transition leaves in between. In maize, juvenile leaves are at the tip of the stalk (stem), which differentiates first, with adult leaves at the base, while other grasses may have other arrangements. The first juvenile leaves in Poaceae are the embryonic leaves found in the grass kernel (caryopsis).
def: "A vascular leaf that is distinct from adult leaves, being characterized by particular anatomical traits namely, wax and trichome distribution, presence or absence of epidermal cell types, cell wall shape and biochemistry." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, MaizeGDB:lv]
PO:0006339.name: juvenile vascular leaf

comment: Many species have juvenile leaves at the base of the stem, adult leaves at the apex, and transition leaves in between. In maize, juvenile leaves are at the tip of the stalk (stem), which differentiates first, with adult leaves at the base, while other grasses may have other arrangements. In some plants the juvenile leaves may go on to establish as adult leaves.
def: "A vascular leaf characterized by particular anatomical traits namely, wax and trichome distribution, presence or absence of epidermal cell types, cell wall shape and biochemistry." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, MaizeGDB:lv]
PO:0006340.name: adult vascular leaf

def: "A shoot system (PO:0009006) that develops from an embryo shoot apical meristem (PO:0006362)." [POC:curators, UMSL:fz]
PO:0006341.name: primary shoot system

def: "A reproductive shoot system (PO:0025082) that develops from an inflorescence (PO:0009049) and has as parts all of the shoot axes (PO:0025029) distal to the most distal foliage leaf (PO:0009025) of a shoot axis and all of the fruits (PO:0009001) borne by those axes." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0006342.name: infructescence

def: "A shoot-borne shoot system (PO:0004545) that develops from an axillary bud (PO:0004709)." [POC:curators]
PO:0006343.name: axillary shoot system

def: "A lateral meristem (PO:0020145) that is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029)." [Poc:curators]
PO:0006344.name: shoot lateral meristem

comment: This term was made obsolete because it is a subcellular component. See GO for the term pollen tube (GO:0090406). Since a pollen tube is part_of a pollen tube cell, annotations for pollen tube may also go to the more general term pollen tube cell (PO:0025195).
def: "OBSOLETE. A tubular cell extension formed by the germinating pollen grain; carries the male gametes into the ovule." [ISBN:0471245208]

comment: Results in an increase in length of a leaf, as part of primary growth. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf. The leaf intercalary meristem does not include a leaf plate meristem (PO:0025429) .
def: "An intercalary meristem (PO:0006073) that is part of a leaf (PO:0006346) and is intercalated between two portions of non-meristematic tissue between a leaf apex (PO:0020137) and a leaf base (PO:0020040)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Ramona_Walls]

comment: Succeeds a whole plant fruit formation stage (PO:0007042). This term is to be used for a stage of development of a whole plant. For the stages of development of an individual fruit, see fruit ripening stage (PO:0025502). Although individual fruits are undergoing fruit ripening (GO:0009835), which is a type of senescence, during this stage, the whole plant is not yet undergoing multicelluar organism senescence (GO:0010259). An iteroparous species generally will have only one fruit ripening stage in its life, while a semelparous species may have multiple fruit ripening stage in its life. A whole plant fruit ripening stage may be followed by a sporophyte senescent stage, as in case (1) or by a sporophyte dormant stage (PO:0007132), as in case (2). In evergreen species and species that fruit multiple times during a growing season, a plant may have multiple fruit development stages without entering dormancy or senescence, as in case (3). In plants with continuous (i.e., indeterminate) fruit development (GO:0010154), new fruits may continue to develop after the first fruit has begun to ripen and the whole plant fruit formation stage (PO:0007042) has ended. In some plants, fruit may continue to ripen after the whole plant has entered a sporophyte dormant stage or sporophyte senescent stage and left the whole plant fruit ripening stage. Some plants may never enter a whole plant fruit ripening stage, because fruits only begin to ripen after the plant has entered a sporophyte dormant stage or sporophyte senescent stage. Although the use of synonyms like "10-dough stage in sorghum" properly refer to the development of an individual fruit, they are used as here to extrapolate to a whole plant.
def: "A whole plant fruit development stage (PO:0025500) that begins when the first fruit (PO:0009001) on a whole plant (PO:0000003) begins the process of ripening (GO:0009835) in a way which, in case there are other fruits, the majority of the other fruits start to ripen continuously therewith, and ends with earliest of the following: (1) the whole plant begins a sporophyte senescent stage (PO:0007017), (2) the whole plant begins a sporophyte dormant stage (PO:0007132), or (3) all fruits on the whole plant are finished ripening." [Poc:curators]
is_a: PO:0025500 ! whole plant fruit development stage
PO:0007010.name: whole plant fruit ripening stage
synonym: "dough stage kernels yellowish, about 55% dry matter" RELATED [ISBN:3826331524]

comment: The actual point of emergence from the seed coat (PO:0009088) may not be observed if the seed is underneath a growth medium. If the fruit is a caryopsis, the dry pericarp is fused with the seed coat, and emergence from the pericarp is simultaneous with emergence from the seed coat. This term is used only for seed plants.

comment: The sporophyte senescent stage is often preceded by the sporophyte reproductive stage, and it ends with death of the sporophyte, either as a result of senescence or some other cause. The sporophyte senescent stage may succeed the sporophyte reproductive stage in monocarpic plants that die after reproducing, such as annuals. This stage is distinct from sporophyte dormant stage, in which organs may senesce, but some parts of the plant remain alive. Multicellular organism senescence/aging (GO:0010259) includes loss of functions such as resistance to disease, homeostasis, and fertility, as well processes like cellular senescence, organ senescence, and wear and tear. The POC curators have requested to the GOC that they revise the definition of GO:0010259, to make it more appropriate for plants.
def: "A sporophyte development stage (PO:0028002) during which a sporophyte participates in multicellular organism senescence." [GO:0010259, POC:curators]
PO:0007017.name: sporophyte senescent stage

comment: This term is to be used for a stage of development of a whole plant (PO:0000003). For the stages of development of an individual fruit, see fruit development stage (PO:0001002). An iteroparous plant will only have one fruit formation stage in its life,  while a semelparous plant may have multiple whole plant fruit formation stages during its life. In plants with continuous (i.e., indeterminate) fruit development (GO:0010154), new fruits may continue to develop after the first fruit has begun to ripen and the fruit ripening stage of whole plant (PO:0007042) has begun. Although the use of synonyms like "07-milk stage in rice" properly refer to the development of an individual fruits, they are used as here to extrapolate to a whole plant.
def: "A whole plant fruit development stage (PO:0025500) that begins when a fruit (PO:0009001) on a whole plant (PO:0000003) that is not currently participating in a whole plant fruit development stage begins a fruit initiation stage (PO:0025503) and ends with the onset of a whole plant fruit ripening stage (PO:0007010)." [Poc:curators]

comment: A whole plant may continue developmental vegetative growth (GO:0080186) after it has entered the reproductive stage, and it may revert to a stage in which it is no longer producing  sporangia, but once it has initiated a single sporangium, it remains in the reproductive stage until senescence or death by some other cause.
def: "A sporophyte development stage that occurs during the interval between the initiation of a sporangium and the onset of senescence." [POC:curators]
PO:0007130.name: sporophyte reproductive stage

comment: This terms is used only for seed plants, although non-seed plants may have a comparable phase during which they produce juvenile or transition leaves.
def: "A sporophyte vegetative stage (PO:0007134) that succeeds the seed germination stage (PO:0007057) and terminates with the development of the first adult vascular leaf (PO:0006340)." [POC:curators]
PO:0007131.name: seedling development stage

comment: A dormancy process (GO:0022611) is a developmental process in which dormancy (sometimes called a dormant state) is induced, maintained or broken. Dormancy is a suspension of most physiological activity and growth that can be reactivated. This term only applies to a whole plant in the sporophyte stage, not to the dormant stage of a seed, bud, or other plant structure. Dormancy of a plant may be preceded by the senescence of its parts such as leaves in woody plants or most of the shoot system herbaceous perennials and by the formation of dormant buds. The end of dormancy in a sporophyte is marked by resumed growth of buds and/or growth of vascular cambium. The dormant stage may be a response to environmental conditions such as seasonality or extreme heat, drought, or cold. Examples of a sporophyte dormant stage are the resurrection plants Selaginella lepidophylla (a lycopod) and Craterostigma plantagineum (an angiosperm) while they are dessicated, and deciduous woody plants and herbaceous perennials or biennials that have a dormant stage in response to drought or cold.
def: "A sporophyte development stage during which a sporophyte participates in a dormancy process." [GO:0022611, PO_REF:00009, POC:curators]
PO:0007132.name: sporophyte dormant stage

comment: This stage is recommended over rosette growth or stem elongation as it is most easily observed and least ambiguous.
def: "The stage at which the leaves produced by SAM are visible above the ground in a seedling or mature plant." [Poc:curators]
PO:0007133.name: leaf production stage

comment: Succeeds a plant zygote stage (PO:0001097). A sporophyte may begin to senesce or die from other causes before producing sporangia. Developmental vegetative growth (GO:0080186) can also occur during the reproductive stage.
def: "A sporophyte development stage (PO:0028002) that occurs during the interval between the first division of a plant zygote (PO:0000423) and the formation of a sporangium (PO:0025094)." [POC:curators]
PO:0007134.name: sporophyte vegetative stage

def: "The stage involved in the directionality of expansion growth." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0007135.name: 4 growth directionality stage

comment: The number and origin of root cap initials that form the root cap varies among species. The root cap initials become independent from the more internally located root meristem cells by an increase in the thickness of the cell wall that separates them.
def: "The stage at which the root cap becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
is_a: PO:0007525 ! 3 establishment of tissue systems stage
PO:0007501.name: root cap formation stage
synonym: "root cap formation in crown root." RELATED []
"root cap formation in lateral root." RELATED []
"root cap formation in primary root." RELATED []

comment: Crown root primordia formed endogenously opposite the collateral bundles in maize.
