PO:0007504.name: crown root primordium formation stage

def: "The stage at which root primordium originates and develops at specific locations in embryonic and post embryonic roots." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007505.name: 1 root primordium formation stage

def: "The stage at which a group of cells or initials that will differentiate into the primary root become organized in the embryo ." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007506.name: primary root primordium formation stage

comment: The first identifiable region in the differentiating vascular cylinder is the pericycle. In the xylem the differentiation of the tracheary elements begins in a centrifugal direction but is completed in the centripetal direction. The first phloem elements mature before the first xylem elements.
def: "The stage at which the root vascular cylinder becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
is_a: PO:0007525 ! 3 establishment of tissue systems stage
PO:0007509.name: root vascular cylinder differentiation stage

def: "The stage at which the fully formed root emerges." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007510.name: root emergence stage

def: "This stage at which the transverse divisions in pericycle cells form the initials of the lateral root primordium." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007511.name: lateral root primordium formation stage

comment: Crown root stages are based on rice plant. This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. The root initials differentiate by cell division and cell expansion." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007512.name: A2 root initials differentiation stage

comment: Repetitive periclinal divisions and radial enlargement of cells form the cortex layers, the innermost layers become the endodermis with the differentiation of casparian strips.
def: "The stage at which the root cortex becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
is_a: PO:0007525 ! 3 establishment of tissue systems stage
PO:0007513.name: root cortex differentiation stage

def: "OBSOLETE. The stage at which the meristem of the crown root becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007514.name: B3 crown root meristem formation

comment: Root hairs come to full development beyond the region of elongation zone, approximately at the level where the xylem begins to mature.
def: "The stage at which the root epidermis becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
is_a: PO:0007525 ! 3 establishment of tissue systems stage
PO:0007516.name: root epidermal differentiation stage

comment: Starch grains can be seen in the root cap after emergence.
def: "The stage at which the lateral root emerges." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007517.name: lateral root emergence stage

comment: Crown root stages are based on rice plant.
def: "The stage at which the crown root emerges." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007518.name: crown root emergence stage

def: "The stage at which the root hairs becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007519.name: 5 root hair formation stage

comment: At present the stages are described for primary, lateral and crown roots and stages for adventitious root formed by wounding or hormone treatment is not described. Finer resolution of root stages has been kept in the obsolete node as they are not consistently used in the consulted literature. These terms will be reintroduced into the ontology when there is a specific user request.
def: "Stages of development of a root defined by characteristic morphological, structural, histological or other visible features." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007520.name: root development stage

comment: These stages are based on Arabidopsis plant. This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. Differentiation begins with the enlargement and vacuolation of the tracheary elements of the metaxylem." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007521.name: C3.1 metaxylem differentiation of root.

def: "OBSOLETE. The root initial cells are established." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007523.name: establishment of initial cells

def: "OBSOLETE. The stage at which the meristem of the primary root becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007524.name: B1 primary root meristem formation

def: "The stage at which distinct tissues become organized." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007525.name: 3 establishment of tissue systems stage
synonym: "cell differentiation stage of root development" RELATED []
"establishment of fundamental organization in adventitious root" RELATED []
"establishment of fundamental organization in primary root." RELATED []
"establishment of fundamental organization lateral root." RELATED []

def: "OBSOLETE. The stage at which the root hairs are fully elongated." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007526.name: F2 root hair elongation

comment: Characteristic differences in meristem organization have been related to taxonomic groups. Terms for developmental zones formation are available in the obsolete node, and they will be reintroduced in the ontology when there is a specific user request for them.
def: "The stage at which the root meristem becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007527.name: 2 root meristem formation stage

comment: This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. Radial expansion followed by subsequent periclinal divisions forms the pericycle-derived tissues." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007528.name: A2.2 root initials differentiation of lateral roots

def: "OBSOLETE. The stage at which the emerged root starts to elongate. " [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007529.name: E emerged root elongation

comment: This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. Radial expansion followed by subsequent periclinal divisions forms the isodiametric founder cell tissues." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007530.name: A2.3 founder cell derivatives of lateral root

def: "OBSOLETE. The stage at which the roots hairs are initiated." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007531.name: F1 root hair initiation

def: "OBSOLETE." [POC:curators]
PO:0007532.name: obsolete plant growth and development terms

comment: This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. The first protoxylem elements next to the pericycle develop secondary walls and mature." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007533.name: C3.3 maturation of protoxylem elements in root.
synonym: "maturation of protoxylem elements in crown root" RELATED []
"maturation of protoxylem elements in lateral root" RELATED []
"maturation of protoxylem elements in primary root" RELATED []

comment: Crown root stages are based on rice plant. This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. Initial cells of crown root primordium divide anticlinally and periclinally to form epidermis-endodermis initial, vascular-cylinder initial and root cap initial." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007534.name: A2.4 root initials differentiation of crown roots

comment: Endogenously formed embryonic roots are exclusive to Poaceae. This  term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. After the formation of the apical-basal axis in the young embryo, the central and basal portion give rise to the root meristem." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007535.name: A1 root initials formation stage

def: "OBSOLETE. the root primordium is visbile" [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007536.name: root primordium visible

comment: This term has been obsoleted to keep the structure simple.
def: "OBSOLETE. The first phloem elements matures." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007537.name: C3.2 maturation of phloem elements in root.
synonym: "maturation phloem elements of crown root." RELATED []
"maturation phloem elements of lateral root." RELATED []
"maturation phloem elements of primary root." RELATED []

def: "OBSOLETE. The stage at which the meristem of the lateral root becomes evident." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0007539.name: B2 lateral root meristem formation

comment: During this stage, the process of floral organ development (GO:0048437) occurs, defined as the process whose specific outcome is the progression of the floral organ over time, from its formation to the mature structure.
def: "A floral organ formation stage (PO:0025585) which begins with the differentiation of floral organs (PO:0025395) from the floral organ primordium (PO:0025477) and ends with the beginning of the flowering stage (PO:0007616)." [PMID:2152125, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0007600.name: floral organ differentiation stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0007602 ! floral organ primordium development stage

comment: During this stage, the process of floral meristem growth (GO:0010451) occurs. This process is defined as the increase in size or mass of a floral meristem, a population of undifferentiated cells in a plant that gives rise to a flower.
def: "A floral organ formation stage (PO:0025585) which begins with the development of the floral organ meristem (PO:0000229) from a portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) and ends with the beginning of the floral organ primordium development stage (PO:0007602)." [PMID:2152125, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0007601.name: floral organ meristem development stage

comment: During this stage, the process of floral meristem determinacy (GO:0010582) occurs, where a floral meristem becomes determinate (i.e. ceases to produce lateral organs and may or may not terminally differentiate). This stage may be indicated by a slight indentation to the inflorescence meristem.
def: "A floral organ formation stage (PO:0025585) which begins with the appearance of the floral organ primordium (PO:0025477) and ends with the beginning of the floral organ differentiation stage (PO:0007600)." [PMID:2152125, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0007602.name: floral organ primordium development stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0007601 ! floral organ meristem development stage

def: "A collective phyllome structure development stage (PO:0025578) that has as a primary participant a calyx (PO:0009060)." [POC:curators, POC:Laura_Moore]
is_a: PO:0025578 ! collective phyllome structure development stage
PO:0007603.name: calyx development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0007600 ! floral organ differentiation stage

def: "A collective phyllome structure development stage (PO:0025578) that has as a primary participant a corolla (PO:0009059)." [POC:curators, POC:Laura_Moore]
is_a: PO:0025578 ! collective phyllome structure development stage
PO:0007604.name: corolla development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0007600 ! floral organ differentiation stage

def: "A collective phyllome structure development stage (PO:0025578) that has as a primary participant an androecium (PO:0009061)." [POC:curators, POC:Laura_Moore]
is_a: PO:0025578 ! collective phyllome structure development stage
PO:0007605.name: androecium development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0007600 ! floral organ differentiation stage

def: "A collective phyllome structure development stage (PO:0025578) that has a primary participant a gynoecium (PO:0009062)." [POC:curators, POC:Laura_Moore]
is_a: PO:0025578 ! collective phyllome structure development stage
PO:0007606.name: gynoecium development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0007600 ! floral organ differentiation stage

def: "Stage of calyx development that begins when the sepal primordia arise." [POC:curators]
PO:0007607.name: sepal primordium visible stage

def: "Stage of corolla development that begins when the petal or petal-stamen primordia arise." [POC:curators]
PO:0007608.name: petal primordium visible stage

def: "OBSOLETE. 50% of the absolute size of the sepals." [POC:curators]
PO:0007609.name: sepals 50% of final size

def: "OBSOLETE. 100% of the absolute size of the sepals." [POC:curators]
PO:0007610.name: sepals 100% of final size

def: "Stage of corolla development defined by differentiation and expansion of petal." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0007611.name: petal differentiation and expansion stage

def: "Stage of corolla development when petal is fully expanded." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0007612.name: fully expanded petal stage

def: "Stage of androecium development that begins when the stamens or petal-stamen primordia arise." [POC:curators]
PO:0007613.name: stamen primordium visible stage

comment: This term and its sub-classes apply to an individual flower (PO:000904). During this stage, a flower undergoes the process of flower development (GO:0009908), defined as the process whose specific outcome is the progression of the flower over time, from its formation to the mature structure.  For the development stage of a whole plant (PO:0000003), use whole plant flowering stage (PO:0007016).
def: "A reproductive shoot system development stage (PO:0025530) that occurs in an individual flower (PO:000904) during the interval between the onset of a flower meristem transition stage (PO:0025588) and the end of a flowering stage (PO:0007616)." [POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0025530 ! reproductive shoot system development stage
PO:0007615.name: flower development stage

comment: In most species, flowering stage (anthesis) is when the flower is open and ends with pollination.  During this stage, the process of anther dehiscence (GO:0009901) usually occurs, defined as the dehiscence of an anther to release the pollen grains contained within it. This term applies to an individual flower (PO:000904).
def: "A flower development stage (PO:0007615) that begins when pollen (PO:0025281) is released by anther dehiscence (GO:0009901) and/or the stigma (PO:0009073) is receptive and ends with the process of pollination (GO:0009856) and/or floral organ senescence (GO:0080187)." [PMID:2152125, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0007616.name: flowering stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0025585 ! floral organ formation stage

def: "Stage of gynoecium development that begins when the carpel primordia arise." [POC:curators]
PO:0007618.name: carpel primordium visible stage

def: "Stages of development of the ovule defined by characteristic morphological, structural, histological or other visible features." [POC:curators]
PO:0007619.name: ovule development stage

def: "Stage of ovule development that begins when the ovule primordia arise." [POC:curators]
PO:0007620.name: ovule primordium visible stage

comment: Although megaspore and megagametophyte development are normally separate, one spore producing one gametophyte, in some flowering plants a single gametophyte may be produced from two or four spores.
def: "A gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) during which the megagametophyte (PO:0025279) develops." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0007621.name: megagametophyte development stage

def: "Stage of ovule development that begins when the integument primordia are visible." [POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0004504 ! ovule differentiation and expansion stage
PO:0007622.name: integument initiation stage

def: "The stage of megagametophyte development when the megaspore mother cell enlarges." [POC:curators]
PO:0007623.name: A megaspore mother cell enlarges stage

def: "The stage of megagametophyte development when the megaspore mother cell undergoes meiosis." [POC:curators]
PO:0007624.name: B meiosis of megaspore mother cell stage

def: "The product of meiosis of the megaspore mother cell." [POC:curators]
PO:0007625.name: C tetrad of megaspores stage

comment: In some plants more than one megaspore contributes to the megametophyte.
def: "The stage of megagametophyte development when non-functional megaspores degenerate." [POC:curators]
PO:0007626.name: D megaspore degeneration stage

def: "The stage of megagametophyte development when there are two nuclei." [POC:curators]
PO:0007627.name: E two nucleate megagametophyte stage

def: "The stage of megagametophyte development when there are four nuclei." [POC:curators]
PO:0007628.name: F four nucleate megagametophyte stage

comment: Some plants do not form an eight nucleate megametophyte.
def: "The stage of megagametophyte development when there are eight nuclei." [POC:curators]
PO:0007629.name: G eight nucleate megagametophyte stage

comment: The plant embryo stage generally starts after the first division of a plant zygote (PO:0000423), but in the case of a nucellar (adventitious) plant embryo (PO:0004537), somatic plant embryo (PO:0025302), microspore-derived cultured plant embryo (PO:0025305), and other embryos that arise through apogamy, it begins after the division of a single cell that is not a zygote. The end of the embryo stage varies among taxa. No plant species undergoes all of the sub-stages of plant embryo development stage listed here.
def: "A sporophyte vegetative stage (PO:0007134) that occurs during the interval between the first cell division of a plant zygote (PO:0000423) and one of the following: the beginning of the seed germination stage (PO:0007057) in seed plants, formation of the first vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in pteridophytes, the beginning of development of a sporangium (PO:0025094) in bryophytes, or the beginning of the formation of a plant organ (PO:0009008) such as a root (PO:0009005), shoot axis (PO:0025029), or vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in a cultured plant embryo (PO:0000010)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0007631.name: plant embryo development stage

def: "Stage during which the seed storage products (storage proteins, lipids and starch) are being accumulated, either in the cotyledons or in the endosperm. Also, LEA proteins are accumulated and subsequently, a desiccation tolerant state is reached at the end of this stage." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0007632.name: seed maturation stage

def: "Stages of development of the endosperm." [TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0007633.name: endosperm development stage

def: "A cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025498) that is the end of a fruit (PO:0009001) distal from a fruit pedicel (PO:0004536)." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar, SGN:Naama_Menda]
is_a: PO:0025498 ! cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure
PO:0008001.name: fruit distal end

def: "A cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025498) that is the end of a fruit (PO:0009001) proximal to a fruit pedicel (PO:0004536)." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar, SGN:Naama_Menda]
is_a: PO:0025498 ! cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure

def: "A nucellus that is part of a fruit." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]

def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the morphologically distinct portion of the nucellus overlying the vascular strands in the grass caryopsis." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0008007.name: nucellar projection

def: "A morphologically distinct aleurone layer located adjacent to the nucellar projection." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0008008.name: modified aleurone

def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the abaxial/lower portion of the nucellus overlying the vascular strands in the grass caryopsis." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0008009.name: abaxial nucellar projection

def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the adaxial/upper portion of the nucellus overlying the vascular strands in the grass caryopsis." [GR:Anuradha_Pujar]
PO:0008010.name: adaxial nucellar projection

def: "Vascular system of embryo." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue
PO:0008011.name: embryo vascular system

def: "A vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a stigma." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0008012.name: stigma vascular system

synonym: "sistema vascular de la antera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A vascular system that includes the totality of the portions of vascular tissue in their specific arrangement in a filament." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0008014.name: filament vascular system

def: "Vascular system of the hypocotyl." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue

def: "A shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) that gives rise to the apical growth of vegetative tissues and organs." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]

synonym: "meristema vegetativo apical del epiblasto (epiblastema) (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A more or less abrupt swelling, especially at the apex or base of a leaf sheath." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008017.name: leaf sheath pulvinus
synonym: "vaina del pulv&#237nulo de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Many species have juvenile leaves at the base of the stem, adult leaves at the apex, and transition leaves in between. In maize, juvenile leaves are at the tip of the stalk (stem), which differentiates first, with adult leaves at the base, while other grasses may have other arrangements. Transition leaves may have mosaics of juvenile and adult tissues, as in Brachypodium.
def: "A vascular leaf that is part of an heteroblastic series, and is characterized by anatomical features that are intermediate between juvenile and adult leaves." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008018.name: transition vascular leaf

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "The region of the leaf lamina proximal to the stem and usually connected to it by means of a petiole." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008019.name: leaf lamina base
synonym: "base de la l&#225mina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "Region that includes the widest or majority portion of leaf lamina and that does not include leaf apex and leaf lamina base." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008020.name: central zone of the leaf lamina
synonym: "zona central de la l&#225mina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Vein orders only apply to hierarchically branching vein patterns, not to dichotomously branching vein patterns, as found in some ferns and gymnosperms.
def: "A leaf lamina vein (PO:0020138) arising from a secondary leaf vein (PO:0020140)." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008021.name: tertiary leaf vein

comment: Vein orders only apply to hierarchically branching vein patterns, not to dichotomously branching vein patterns, as found in some ferns and gymnosperms.
def: "A leaf lamina vein (PO:0020138) arising from a tertiary leaf vein (PO:0008021)." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008022.name: quaternary leaf vein

comment: Vein orders only apply to hierarchically branching vein patterns, not to dichotomously branching vein patterns, as found in some ferns and gymnosperms.
def: "A leaf lamina vein (PO:0020138) arising from a quaternary (PO:0008022) or other higher order leaf vein." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008023.name: higher order leaf vein
synonym: "fifth and higher order leaf vein" RELATED []

def: "The region of the petiole proximal to its stem attachment site." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]

PO:0008025.name: central zone of the petiole

def: "The region of the petiole distal to its stem attachment site or proximal to the leaf lamina." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]

def: "A portion of petiole epidermis that covers the abaxial/lower surface of a petiole." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0008029.name: petiole abaxial epidermis

def: "A plant cell (PO:0009002) that is part of a multicellular trichome (PO:0000282)." [POC:curators]

comment: This term was made obsolete because it is a sub-cellular component. New term unicellular trichome branch (GO:0090405) has been added to GO. For cell that is a branch of a multicellular trichome, see multicellular trichome branch cell (PO:0025163).
def: "OBSOLETE. The branch on a trichome." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]

comment: This term was made obsolete, because its definition did not match the new ontology structure as a child of collective phyllome structure. Annotations for this term are now associated with the new term collective leaf structure (PO:0025022).
def: "OBSOLETE. A cluster of leaves in crowded circles or spirals arising basally from a crown." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008034.name: leaf whorl

def: "A meristem forming the core of the axis composed of the primary vascular tissues and associated ground tissue, such as pith and interfascicular regions." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0008035.name: plerome

def: "A portion of meristem tissue that forms the cortex." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0008036.name: periblem

comment: This term was made obsolete. Replaced by whole plant growth stage seedling growth (PO:0007131) and whole plant (PO:0000003).

PO:0008037.name: seedling

def: "A phyllome primordium (PO:0025128)that develops from a lodicule anlagen (PO:0025483) and is committed to the development of a lodicule (PO:0009036)." [POC:curators]

synonym: "zona de diferenciaci&#243n del internodo del tallo (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "OBSOLETE. A portion of shoot epidermis that is part of the floral organs." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008043.name: floral epidermis

comment: This term was made obsolete and replaced by the stomatal complexes of individual floral organs, such as petal stomatal complex or sepal stomatal complex.
def: "OBSOLETE. An opening pore on the epidermis of floral organs bordered by two guard cells and serving in gas exchange." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008044.name: floral stomatal complex

comment: This term was made obsolete and replaced by guard cell (PO:0000293) which can be post-composed with individual floral organs, such as petal or sepal.
def: "OBSOLETE. One of a pair of cells flanking the stomatal pore of floral organs." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0008045.name: floral guard cell

comment: This term was made obsolete and replaced by stomatal pore (PO:0008032), which can be post-composed with individual floral organs, such as petal or sepal.
def: "OBSOLETE. A stomatal pore that is part of a floral stomatal complex." [POC:curators]
PO:0008046.name: floral stomatal pore

def: "A vascular system in a scutellum." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue
PO:0008047.name: scutellar vascular system

def: "A continuous layer of cylindrical cells covering the endosperm side of the scutellum. Thought to act as a secretory and absorptive organ." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue
PO:0008048.name: scutellar epithelium

comment: Often glandular. Often involved in movement of a plant structure in response to touch, gravity or light. In panicoid grasses a swollen region in the stem above the intercalary meristem. Such a definition would also include stems of Chloranthaceae, Acanthaceae, Carpels, Amaranthaceae, etc. [source: APweb:Glossary].
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) at the apex or base of a petiole, petiolule, leaf sheath, or branch that is differentiated from the remaining organ parts by its enlarged cross section." [POC:curators]
PO:0009000.name: pulvinus

comment: A fruit may contain additional plant structures (PO:0009011) that were part of a flower (PO:0009046) and mature along with the gynoecium, such as a receptacle (PO:0009064). A fruit may develop without fertilization in cases of parthenocarpy, apomixis, or other hormone-induced conditions and may not always contain seeds. Fruits only occur in angiosperms.
def: "A multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025496) that develops from a gynoecium (PO:0009062) and may have as parts one or more seeds (PO:0009010)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009001.name: fruit

comment: Applies to cells that are living or dead at maturity (e.g., fiber cell or tracheid) and includes any external encapsulating structures (if present) such as the plasma membrane and the plant-type cell wall. Definition of cell GO:0005623: "The basic structural and functional unit of all organisms. Includes the plasma membrane and any external encapsulating structures such as the cell wall and cell envelope". GO:0009505. Definition of plant-type cell wall (GO:0009505): A more or less rigid structure lying outside the cell membrane of a cell and composed of cellulose and pectin and other organic and inorganic substances, synonym; exact: cellulose and pectin-containing cell wall.
def: "A cell which is a plant structure (PO:0009011)." [GO:0005623, POC:curators]
PO:0009002.name: plant cell

comment: Replace_by whole plant (PO: PO:0000003) in the sporophyte development phase (PO:0028003). Structures that only occur in sporophyte should have participates_in relation to sporophytic development phase.
def: "OBSOLETE. A plant structure that is a product of fertilization and produces spores through meiosis." [POC:curators]
PO:0009003.name: sporophyte

comment: Replace_by whole plant in the gametophyte phase (PO:0028002). The gametophyte arises from the product of meiosis (the spore). Structures that occur only in gametophytes should have a participates_in relation to the gametophyte phase.
def: "OBSOLETE. A plant structure that arises through meiosis and may produce gametes by mitosis." [POC:curators]
PO:0009004.name: gametophyte

comment: Roots function in the absorption of water and inorganic nutrients, anchoring the plant body to the ground, and supporting it, storage of food and nutrients, and vegetative reproduction. The roots of most vascular plant species enter into symbiosis with soil-borne microorganisms. Roots are usually found underground, although there are many exceptions, such as the aerial roots of orchids. Roots often form secondary thickening from the root lateral meristem (PO:0006308). Commonly thought of as one of the three basic parts of the plant body, along with the shoot axis (PO:0025029) and leaves (PO:0025034).
def: "A plant axis (PO:0025004) that lacks shoot axis nodes (PO:0005004), grows indeterminately, and is usually positively geotropic." [ISBN:978-0879015329, ISBN:9780964022157, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009005.name: root

comment: The shoot system is generally used to refer to the above-ground plant parts, although some plants have parts of their shoot system underground. For example, a rhizome (PO:0004542), bulb (PO:0025356), a corm (PO:0025355) or a subterranean tuber (PO:0004547), as in Solanum tuberosum (potato) or yam, are all part of the shoot system.
def: "A collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007) that produces shoot-borne portions of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) and the plant structures (PO:0009011) that arise from them." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009006.name: shoot system

comment: A portion of plant tissue may contain one or several types of cells that are organized in a specific spatial arrangement into a structural unit (which includes a mass of callus) and may include an intercellular matrix. May include other types of isolated cells, such as idioblasts.
def: "A plant structure (PO:0009011) that consists predominantly of similarly specialized plant cells (PO:0009002) of one or more types." [POC:curators, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0009007.name: portion of plant tissue
synonym: "porci&#243n de un tejido vegetal (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Examples include stem (PO:0009047), leaf (PO:0025034), and root (PO:0009005). May include individual plant cells (PO:0009002) that are not part of a portion of plant tissue (e.g., idioblasts, PO:0000283). A plant organ may have one or more different plant organs as parts, such as a sporophyll (PO:0009026) that may have as part a sporangium (PO:0025094) or a carpel (PO:0009030) that may have as part a plant ovule (PO:0020003).
def: "A multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025496) that is a functional unit, is a proper part of a whole plant (PO:0000003), and includes portions of plant tissue (PO:0009007) of at least two different types that derive from a common developmental path." [POC:curators]
PO:0009008.name: plant organ

comment: A plant embryo is generally formed after the first division of a plant zygote (PO:0000423), but in the case of a nucellar (adventitious) plant embryo (PO:0004537), somatic plant embryo (PO:0025302), microspore-derived cultured plant embryo (PO:0025305), and other embryos that arise through apogamy, it begins after the division of a single cell that is not a zygote. The end of the embryo stage varies among taxa; the beginning of a seed germination stage (PO:0007057) in seed plants, formation of the first vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in pteridophytes, the beginning of development of a sporangium (PO:0025094) in bryophytes, or the beginning of the formation of a plant organ (PO:0009008) such as a root (PO:0009005), shoot axis (PO:0025029), or vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in a cultured plant embryo (PO:0000010).
def: "A whole plant (PO:0000003) that participates in the plant embryo stage (PO:0007631)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009009.name: plant embryo

comment: A seed generally develops from an ovule (PO:0020003) after fertilization, but may develop without fertilization in the case of apogamy (e.g., adventitious embryos or somatic embryos). A seed is a reproductive unit of seed plants (gymnosperms, angiosperms, and fossil pteridosperms).
def: "A multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025496) that develops from a plant ovule (PO:0020003) and has as parts a plant embryo (PO:0009009) enclosed in a seed coat (PO:0009088)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009010.name: seed

comment: 'Part' includes both proper parts and the whole plant. CARO:0000003 anatomical structure is defined as: Material anatomical entity that has inherent 3D shape and is generated by coordinated expression of the organism's own genome.
def: "An anatomical structure that is or was part of a plant, or was derived from a part of a plant." [CARO:0000003, POC:curators]
PO:0009011.name: plant structure

comment: Refers to GO:0032502 (developmental process), including growth, differentiation, and senescence.
def: "A stage in the life of a plant structure (PO:0009011) during which the plant structure undergoes developmental processes." [POC:curators]
PO:0009012.name: plant structure development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo de estructura vegetal (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) in which plant cells (PO:0009002) have retained their embryonic characteristics, or have reverted to them secondarily, and that divide to produce new cells that can undergo differentiation to form mature tissues, i.e. they have a capacity for morphogenesis and growth." [APweb:Glossary, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009013.name: portion of meristem tissue

comment: This term is redundant with epidermis and will be obsoleted. Move annotations to epidermis.
def: "OBSOLETE. A portion of plant tissue that covers the surface of the plant." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0122151704]
PO:0009014.name: dermal tissue

comment: Functions in conduction and support. In shoot axes (PO:0025029), vascular tissue is often found as part of a shoot axis stele (PO:0025198) or as scattered vascular bundles (PO:0005020). May include other types of tissues or cells, such as parenchyma (PO:0005421) or fiber cells (PO:0025407).
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that has as part one or more tracheary elements (PO:0000290) or sieve elements (PO:0025406)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009015.name: portion of vascular tissue

comment: Replaced by portion of ground tissue (). Uninformative definition. Check it again.
def: "OBSOLETE. Tissues other than the vascular tissues, epidermis and the periderm." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009016.name: ground tissue

def: "A pulvinus (PO:0009000) of an inflorescence branch (PO:0009081)." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009017.name: inflorescence branch pulvinus
synonym: "pulv&#237nulo ramificado de una inflorescencia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Responsible for transferring nutrients to an embryo by symplastic or apoplastic methods.
def: "A transfer cell that is part of a basal endosperm transfer layer." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0009018.name: basal endosperm transfer cell
relationship: part_of PO:0025196 ! basal endosperm transfer layer
synonym: "c&#233lula de transferencia del endosperma basal (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This term was made obsolete because the definition was wrong. Replace by new term with same name but corrected definition.
def: "OBSOLETE. A cell layer found in basal endosperm transfer cell." [GR:Chih-Wei_Tung]
PO:0009019.name: obsolete basal endosperm transfer layer
synonym: "capa de transferencia del endosperma basal obsoleto (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The cells of the meristem L1 layer divide in a strictly anticlinical fashion.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is the outermost layer of a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and gives rise to a shoot system epidermis (PO:0006035)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:11283725, PMID:12221985, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009020.name: meristem L1 layer

comment: Cells in the first subepidermal layer, the L2, divide in a largely anticlinal fashion, forming a completely separate population of cells from the other cell layers. Within developing organs, the meristem L2 layer divides anticlinally and periclinally.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) directly beneath a meristem L1 layer (PO:0009020) in a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) which gives rise to ground tissue (PO:0025059)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:11283725, PMID:12221985, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009021.name: meristem L2 layer
relationship: part_of PO:0025595 ! shoot system ground meristem

comment: The meristem L3 layer cells frequently divide in various orientations.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) beneath a meristem L2 layer (PO:0009021) in a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) which gives rise to internal tissues of leaf and stem." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, PMID:11283725, PMID:12221985, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009022.name: meristem L3 layer
relationship: part_of PO:0025595 ! shoot system ground meristem

def: "An axil that is the space between a shoot axis and a leaf that branches from the shoot axis." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0009023.name: leaf axil

comment: Has vascular tissue. From APweb Glossary: In angiosperms, commonly thought of as one of the three basic parts of the seed plant body, a structure usually of determinate growth, without secondary thickening, and of superficial origin, often flattened and photosynthetic in part, and in the axil of which is found a bud. Occurs in the sporophytic phase of a plant life cycle.
def: "A leaf (PO:0025034) in a vascular plant." [POC:curators]
PO:0009025.name: vascular leaf

def: "A leaf-like organ on which one or more sporangia are borne." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009026.name: sporophyll

def: "A structure upon which (or in the axil of which) one or more megasporangia are borne; in flowering plants, a carpel." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009027.name: megasporophyll

def: "A structure on which one or more microsporangia are borne; in flowering plants, the stamen." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009028.name: microsporophyll

comment: Part of tassel floret.
def: "A microsporophyll bearing one or more microsporangia." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009029.name: stamen

comment: In some cases, a gynoecium (PO:0009062) may consist of only one carpel, in which case annotations should go on carpel (PO:0009030). The word pistil is used synonymously with gynoecium, but if a gynoecium consists of a single carpel, then pistil may be used synonymously with carpel. If carpels are fused, the gynoecium is a syncarpous gynoecium, as in Poaceae, Brassicaceae and Solanaceae. If carpels are free, the gynoecium is an apocarpous gynoecium, as in Fabaceae. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A megasporophyll, almost always at the center of a flower, its margins more or less fused together or with other carpels to enclose the ovule(s)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009030.name: carpel

comment: In some species the sepals (PO:0009031) may not be green for example many members of the Liliaceae family.
def: "A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is usually green, and is part of the calyx (PO:0009060)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009031.name: sepal

comment: In some species the petal (PO:0009032) may not be colored.
def: "A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is part of the corolla (PO:0009059), and is usually colored (not green)." [APweb:Glossary, POC:curators]
PO:0009032.name: petal

comment: There is no differentiation between the petals (PO:0009032) and the sepals (PO:0009031) in color, placement, and size (e.g. some species of Magnolia).
def: "A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is part of a perianth (PO:0009058) where it is not possible to distinguish between the petals (PO:0009032) and sepals (PO:0009031)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009033.name: tepal

def: "A bract (PO:0009055) that subtends a perianth (PO:0009058) that is part of a flower (PO:0009046)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009034.name: flower bract

def: "A multicellular glandular structure secreting a liquid containing organic substances especially sugars." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009035.name: nectary

comment: May represent a reduced floral structure. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type, if known. Choose the most specific term possible from: ear floret (PO:0006354), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006353), lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006351), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A phyllome that is part of a grass floret and is one of two or three tiny scales or flaps of tissue outside the stamens." [POC:curators]
PO:0009036.name: lodicule

comment: A lemma (PO:0009037) and palea (PO:0009038) enclose an individual spikelet floret (PO:0009082). The lemma is usually the larger of the two. Since it is not clear what the lemma and palea correspond to in conventional flowers, no assumptions of homology are made. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea species an annotation can also be made to the more specific floret type, if known. Choose the most specific term possible from: ear floret (PO:0006354), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006353), lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006351), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316). Found in  Found in Poaceae, Cyperaceae and other Poales.
def: "A flower bract (PO:0009034) that is the lower of the two bracts (PO:0009055) enclosing a (PO:0009082) spikelet floret." [APweb:Glossary, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009037.name: lemma
synonym: "lemma del florete del penacho (borla) o de la espiga (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]
"lemma of lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"lemma of lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel" NARROW []
"lemma of lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"lemma of lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel" NARROW []
"lemma of upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"lemma of upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel" NARROW []
"lemma of upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"lemma of upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel" NARROW []

comment: A lemma (PO:0009037) and palea (PO:0009038) enclose an individual spikelet floret (PO:0009082). The palea is usually the smaller of the two. Since it is not clear what the lemma and palea correspond to in conventional flowers, no assumptions of homology are made. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea species an annotation can also be made to the more specific floret type, if known. Choose the most specific term possible from: ear floret (PO:0006354), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006353), lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006351), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316). Found in  Found in Poaceae, Cyperaceae and other Poales.
def: "A flower bract (PO:0009034) that is the upper/distal of the two bracts (PO:0009055) enclosing a (PO:0009082) spikelet floret." [APweb:Glossary, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009038.name: palea
synonym: "palea of lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"palea of lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel" NARROW []
"palea of lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear" EXACT []
"palea of lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel" NARROW []
"palea of upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"palea of upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel" NARROW []
"palea of upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"palea of upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel" NARROW []

comment: Found in Poaceae and Cyperaceae. Glumes subtend the pair of florets while a lemma or palea subtend the individual florets.
def: "One of a pair of inflorescence bracts that is part of a spikelet and subtends the two florets." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0009039.name: glume

comment: An undeveloped androecium or gynoecium may or may not be detectable. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding spikelet type, if known. Choose the most specific term possible from: ear spikelet (PO:0006320), ear pedicellate spikelet (PO:0006348), ear sessile spikelet (PO:0006349), tassel spikelet (PO:0006309), tassel pedicellate spikelet (PO:0006312), tassel sessile spikelet (PO:0006311).
def: "A flower bract in the position of a lemma, but not enclosing floral organs." [UMSL:tk]
PO:0009040.name: sterile lemma

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding spikelet type, if known. Choose the most specific term possible from: ear spikelet (PO:0006320), ear pedicellate spikelet (PO:0006348), ear sessile spikelet (PO:0006349), tassel spikelet (PO:0006309), tassel pedicellate spikelet (PO:0006312), tassel sessile spikelet (PO:0006311).
def: "A lemma that encloses a functional flower, with androecium, gynoecium or both." [UMSL:tk]
PO:0009041.name: fertile lemma

comment: A prophyll is not classified as a vascular leaf, because it may not have a fully developed vascular system.
def: "A phyllome that is the first organ or one of the first two organs formed at the base of an axillary shoot, often smaller and/or in a distinctively different position from leaves formed subsequently." [POC:curators]
PO:0009042.name: prophyll

def: "A small leaf or leaves borne singly or in pairs on the pedicel, the prophyll(s) of the flower-shoot (pedicel plus flower)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009043.name: bracteole

def: "Sac-like bract subtending the pistillate flower, as in Carex." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009044.name: perigynium

def: "Equals inflorescence bract of an involucre, as in Asteraceae or Compositeae." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009045.name: involucral bract

comment: The characteristic reproductive structure of angiosperms. May have as part one or more petals, sepals or tepals. May contain one or more pistillode (PO:0009078), staminode (PO:0009077) or other aborted organs that don't show up in mature form.
def: "A determinate reproductive shoot system (PO:0025082) that has as part at least one carpel (PO:0009030) or at least one stamen (PO:0009029) and does not contain any other determinate shoot system (PO:0009006) as a part." [POC:curators]
PO:0009046.name: flower

comment: Often bears leaves and buds. It is usually above ground, more or less negatively geotropic, and exogenous in origin.
def: "A shoot axis (PO:0025029) that is the primary axis of a plant." [POC:curators]
PO:0009047.name: stem

comment: Some plants have only solitary flowers, e.g. Magnolia.
def: "A reproductive shoot system (PO:0025082) that has as parts all of the shoot axes (PO:0025029) distal to the most distal foliage leaf (PO:0009025) of a shoot axis and all of the flowers (PO:0009046) borne by those axes. Must have two or more flowers as parts." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0009049.name: inflorescence

comment: It consists of one to many closely-packed flowers and associated glumes etc.
def: "A reproductive shoot system (PO:0025082) that is the ultimate and congested inflorescence branch (PO:0009081) of the grasses." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009051.name: spikelet

comment: The bracteoles are borne on the pedicel, which terminates in a flower. A pedicel is the ultimate branch in an inflorescence.
def: "An inflorescence branch (PO:0009081) that supports an individual flower (PO:0009046) in an inflorescence (PO:0009049)." [ISBN:0716710072, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009052.name: flower pedicel

comment: In plants with single flowers, the peduncle ends with a flower. In plants with inflorescences, the peduncle is the basal end of the primary inflorescence axis, and it ends where the inflorescence begins to branch. The peduncle marks the axial transition from vegetative to reproductive growth. In branching inflorescences, the second order inflorescence axis from the point at which it leaves the main axis up to the point at which it branches again may be called the second order peduncle. Higher order peduncles are also possible.
def: "A shoot axis that extends from the last foliage leaf on a stem or branch until the next distal node." [ISBN:9781842464229, POC:curators]
PO:0009053.name: peduncle

comment: Includes the leaf subtending and acting as outer envelope of an ear in Zea mays.
def: "A bract (PO:0009055) subtending a branch of the inflorescence (PO:0009049) or borne on the inflorescence axis (PO:0020122) below any branch (PO:0025073) or flower (PO:0009046)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009054.name: inflorescence bract

comment: Usually different from leaves. Often used to refer to a floral bract, but includes other kinds of bracts.
def: "A phyllome that subtends a reproductive structure." [POC:curators]
PO:0009055.name: bract

def: "A multicellular glandular structure found in the flower secreting a liquid containing organic substances especially sugars." [ISBN:047124529]
PO:0009056.name: flower nectary

def: "A multicellular glandular structure found in places other than flower secreting a liquid containing organic substances especially sugar." [ISBN:047124529]
PO:0009057.name: extrafloral nectary

comment: The perianth can consist of only the corolla (PO:0009059), only the calyx (PO:0009060) or it may have both structures in a complete flower.  If the petals (PO:0009032) and sepals (PO:0009031) are indistinguishable from one another, the perianth consists of just a collective tepal structure  (PO:0025021), composed of one or more tepals (PO:0009033), for example in tulip or lily flowers.
def: "A collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) that includes as parts the corolla (PO:0009059) and/or the calyx (PO:0009060); or one or more tepals (PO:0009033)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009058.name: perianth

comment: The corolla (PO:0009059) is part of the perianth (PO:0009058). This  definition is based on the complete flower, which has all four whorls. In many species, and in mutants one or more of the whorls may be missing. The corolla (PO:0009059) often functions to attract pollinators.
def: "A collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) that is composed of one or more petals (PO:0009032), comprising the inner whorl of non-reproductive floral organs (PO:0025395) and surrounds the androecium (PO:0009061) and the gynoecium (PO:0009062)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009059.name: corolla

comment: The calyx is part of the perianth (PO:0009058). This definition is based on the perfect flower, which has all four whorls. In many species, and in mutants one or more of the whorls are missing.
def: "A collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) that is composed of one or more sepals (PO:0009031), and comprises the outer whorl of non-reproductive floral organs (PO:0025395)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0009060.name: calyx

comment: The androecium also has as parts any staminodes (PO:0009077) that may be present in a flower. If annotating gene expression to an androecium with a single stamen (PO:0009029), the annotation should go on stamen. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006353), lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006351), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316). The development of an androecium in an ear floret of a normal maize plant is aborted and is present in a rudimentary state, while the development of an androecium in a tassel floret leads to a functional androecium.
def: "A collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) composed all of the stamens (PO:0009029) in a flower (PO:0009046)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009061.name: androecium

"androecium of lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"androecium of lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel" NARROW []

"androecium of upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel" EXACT []
"androecium of upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"androecium of upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel" NARROW []

comment: If annotating gene expression to a gynoecium with a single carpel (PO:0009030), the annotation should go on carpel. A gynoecium with two or more carpels may be either syncarpous (carpels fused) or apopcarpous (carpels free) or the carpels may be partially fused. The word pistil is used synonymously with gynoecium for a synocarpous gynoecium, and synonymously with carpel for an apocarpous gynoecium, whether it has one or more carpels. In Zea mays, gynoecia of tassel florets and of the lower florets of ear spikelets usually do not develop fully, and they are present in a rudimentary state. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006353), lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006351), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) composed all of the carpels (PO:0009030) in a flower (PO:0009046)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009062.name: gynoecium
synonym: "gynoecium of lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"gynoecium of lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel" NARROW []

"gynoecium of upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel" NARROW []

def: "A collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) composed of two or more phyllomes immediately outside the calyx (PO:0009060)." [POC:curators]
PO:0009063.name: epicalyx

comment: The fleshy part of a strawberry develops from a receptacle.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is the region at the distal end of either a peduncle or a pedicel where the floral appendages (e.g.: sepals, petals, stamens and pistils) are attached." [POC:curators]
PO:0009064.name: receptacle

comment: Only bears stamens or perianth segments if they are present in the flower (e.g., no stamens in a carpellate flower).
def: "A cup- or tube-shaped cardinal organ part, bearing perianth and stamens on its rim, so these arise above the base, and often above the top, of the ovary." [ISBN:0521251346]
PO:0009065.name: hypanthium

comment: Generally consists of four pollen sacs (microsporangia) in two anther thecas. If you are annotating to anther or one of its parts for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007) that is the pollen-bearing part of a stamen (PO:0009029)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009066.name: anther

comment: Supports the anthers. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A stalk that is part of a stamen." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, MaizeGDB:lv]
PO:0009067.name: filament

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "The part of the stamen that connects the microsporangia/pollen sacs." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009068.name: connective

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007) that is part of an anther (PO:0009066) and consists of a pair of sporangia (PO:0025094) that dehisce down a common slit." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0009069.name: anther theca

comment: This term was made obsolete because the definition was incorrect. Replaced by PO:0025277.
def: "OBSOLETE. A microsporangium in an angiosperm that is a cavity in an anther that contains pollen grains." [ISBN:0716710072]
PO:0009070.name: obsolete pollen sac

comment: Develops from a primary or secondary parietal cell layer. Innermost part of the anther wall, involved in the nutrition of the pollen. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A microsporangium tapetum (PO:0025314) that is part of an anther wall (PO:0000002)." [ISBN:0471244554, ISBN:9780003686647]
PO:0009071.name: anther wall tapetum
synonym: "portion of anther wall tapetal tissue" EXACT []

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A plant structure (PO:0009011) that is the basal portion of a carpel (PO:0009030) or group of fused carpels and encloses the plant ovule(s) (PO:0020003)." [APweb:Glossary, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0009072.name: plant ovary

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A cardinal organ part that is part of a carpel or group of fused carpels on which the pollen germinates, usually apical." [APweb:Glossary, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0009073.name: stigma

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352), tassel floret (PO:0006310), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).

def: "A sterile pistil, often rudimentary." [APweb:Glossary]

comment: A spikelet floret (PO:0009082) is enclosed by one or both the flower bracts (PO:0009034);  lemma (PO:0009037) and palea (PO:0009038) and also includes a lodicule (PO:0009036).  To describe a floret of the Asteraceae, use ray flower (PO:0025331) or disk flower (PO:0025332).  Found in Poaceae, Cyperaceae and other Poales.
def: "A small flower (PO:0009046) that is part of a spikelet (PO:0009051)." [PMID:20197291, POC:curators]
PO:0009082.name: spikelet floret

def: "OBSOLETE. Aggregation of gamete producing structures." [Poc:curators]
PO:0009083.name: reproductive structures

comment: May be fleshy in fruits such as grape.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is the outer layer (wall) of a fruit (PO:0009001), and develops from a plant ovary (PO:0009072) or a carpel (PO:0009030) wall." [APweb:Glossary, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0009084.name: pericarp

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is the outer layer of a pericarp (PO:0009084)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009085.name: exocarp

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is the innermost differentiated layer of a pericarp (PO:0009084)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009086.name: endocarp

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is the middle layer of a pericarp (PO:0009084)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009087.name: mesocarp

comment: Used only when not specified more precisely; see testa, tegmen.
def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the covering of a seed derived from ovular - mainly integumentary - tissue." [APweb:Glossary, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, TAIR:Leonore_Reiser]
PO:0009088.name: seed coat

comment: In angiosperms endosperm is usually triploid and formed after fertilization by the fusion of one gamete with the polar nucleus; sometimes diploid or polyploid.
def: "A maximal portion of nutritive plant tissue in a seed." [APweb:Glossary, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0009089.name: endosperm

comment: Usually envelopes most of the seed and is fleshy. If the ovule is pressed against the funicle to form a raphe, it may appear that the aril is growing from the raphe.
def: "An arilloid that is an outgrowth of a seed from a seed funicle." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0009090.name: aril

def: "OBSOLETE. provisional term" [Poc:curators]
PO:0009091.name: mature dispersal unit

comment: The burs or bristles in Cenchrus and Pennisetum are not involucres because the fused structures are branches and not bracts.
def: "A collective phyllome structure composed of two or more involucral bracts at the base of a cluster of flowers, as found in Asteraceae or Compositae." [POC:curators]
PO:0009100.name: involucre

def: "The long branch that arise from the central spike of tassel in maize." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, MaizeGDB:lv]

def: "A plant axis (PO:0025004) that is the axial part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0019018.name: plant embryo axis

comment: Often conspicuous and found on seeds with a hard testa that are dispersed by animals. There is some variation in how different sources define the subtypes of arilloids.
