PO:0020012.name: sexine

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043676,
def: "OBSOLETE. The layer of sexine, which forms a roof over the columellae, granules or other infratectal elements." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020013.name: tectum

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043674.
def: "OBSOLETE. A rod-like element of the sexine/ectexine, either supporting the tectum or a caput." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020014.name: columella

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043675.
def: "OBSOLETE. Third layer of sexine." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020015.name: sculpture elements

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043670.
def: "OBSOLETE. The inner layer of the ectexine." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020016.name: foot layer
synonym: "capa basal del grano de polen (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043678.
def: "OBSOLETE. The innermost of the major layers of the pollen grain wall, underlies the exine and borders the cytoplasm, not acetolysis resistant and is therefore absent in conventionally prepared palynological material." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020017.name: intine

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043677.
def: "OBSOLETE. Area through which the pollen imports the nutrition during its development, at the time of pollen germination, the pollen tube emerges through it." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0020018.name: germination pore

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "The larger, in general, of the two kinds of spores produced after meiosis in the life cycle of a heterosporous plant, and on germination giving rise to the female gametophyte (embryo sac)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020019.name: megaspore

comment: In seed plants, the megaspores and megagametophyte are retained within the nucellus. If you are annotating to this structure for an angiosperm, please add an additional annotation to plant ovary ovule (PO:0025490). If you are annotating to this structure for an gymnosperm, please add an additional annotation to ovuliferous scale ovule (PO:0025491). If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A megasporangium (PO:0025201) in a seed plant, composed of fleshy subepidermal tissue that is part of a plant ovule (PO:0020003) and surrounds a megasporocyte (PO:0000431)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020020.name: nucellus

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for an angiosperm, please add an additional annotation to plant ovary ovule (PO:0025490). If you are annotating to this structure for an gymnosperm, please add an additional annotation to ovuliferous scale ovule (PO:0025491). If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that usually covers a plant ovule (PO:0020003), enveloping a nucellus (PO:0020020) and forming a micropyle (PO:0020025) at the apex." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020021.name: integument

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "The innermost of the two layers of tissue that usually cover the ovule, contiguous to the nucellus and usually contributing to the formation of the micropyle at the apex." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020022.name: inner integument

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "One of the two layers of tissue that usually cover the ovule, contiguous to the inner integument and usually involved in forming the micropyle at the apex." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020023.name: outer integument

def: "A portion of plant tissue composed of cells of the inner epidermis of the inner (or only) integument of the ovule that are radially elongated and metabolically very active." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020024.name: endothelium

comment: The micropyle originates as an opening in the integuments of an ovule through which the pollen tube usually enters the embryo sac. In a mature seed the micropyle may remain visible as an occluded pore or may be obliterated. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A plant anatomical space (PO:0025117) that is enclosed by and forms an opening in an integument at the apex of a plant ovule (PO:0020003)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020025.name: plant ovule micropyle

comment: The chalaza is recognized as the region which initiates the two integuments at its flank. If you are annotating to this structure for an angiosperm, please add an additional annotation to plant ovary ovule (PO:0025490). If you are annotating to this structure for an gymnosperm, please add an additional annotation to ovuliferous scale ovule (PO:0025491). If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is the region in a plant ovule (PO:0020003) where the integuments (PO:0020021) and the nucellus (PO:0020020) join with the funicule (PO:0020006)." [ISBN:047124529]
PO:0020026.name: chalaza

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for an angiosperm, please add an additional annotation to plant ovary ovule (PO:0025490). If you are annotating to this structure for an gymnosperm, please add an additional annotation to ovuliferous scale ovule (PO:0025491).
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is a ridge on a plant ovule (PO:0020003) where a funicle (PO:0020006) is or was fused to the ovule." [ISBN:047124529, POC:curators]
PO:0020027.name: raphe

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for an angiosperm, please add an additional annotation to plant ovary ovule (PO:0025490). If you are annotating to this structure for an gymnosperm, please add an additional annotation to ovuliferous scale ovule (PO:0025491).
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is the part of a plant ovule (PO:0020003) on the opposite side from a raphe (PO:0020027)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020028.name: antiraphe

comment: Most commonly arising from the funicle, also developing from placenta, integument, etc.
def: "An outgrowth of the funicle, that forms a bridge between the micropyle and other tissues." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020029.name: obturator

def: "A vascular leaf (PO:0009025) formed at the first shoot node (PO:0005004) of a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or a seedling (PO:0000003)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:9780879015329, POC:curators]
PO:0020030.name: cotyledon

comment: May develop into the primary root (PO:0020127) and eventually the root system (PO:0025025) of an adult plant. Sometimes abortive.
def: "An embryo root (PO:0000045) that is the basal continuation of a hypocotyl (PO:0020100) in a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or a seedling (PO:0000003)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0020031.name: radicle

comment: Occurs in several embryo types.
def: "The shoot apex (PO:0000037) of the plant embryo (PO:0009009), above the cotyledonary node (PO:0025321)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020032.name: plumule

comment: The coleoptile is an outgrowth or part of the scutellum (PO:0020110) (which is a modified, haustorial cotyledon (PO:0020030)).  Develops separate from the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148).  Found in Poaceae and other monocotyledons such as Zingiberaceae. Protects the emerging shoot system (PO:0009006) as it grows through the soil.
def: "A sheath-like plant organ (PO:0009008) that surrounds the plumule (PO:0020032) of a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or the emerging shoot apex (PO:0000037) of a seedling." [ISBN:0471244554, ISBN:9781842464229]
PO:0020033.name: coleoptile

comment: Found in Poaceae and some other monocots as well as some gymnosperms. Protects the emerging radicle in a plant embryo or seedling. The parenchyma cells of both the coleorhiza and epiblast may function in storage.
def: "A sheath-like plant organ (PO:0009008) that surrounds the radicle (PO:0020031) of a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or the emerging root (PO:0009005) of a seedling (PO:0000003)." [ISBN:0471244554, PMID:19386806, PO_REF:00003]
PO:0020034.name: coleorhiza

def: "The first stem internode (PO:0020142) above the cotyledonary node (PO:0025321) of a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or a seedling (PO:0000003)." [ISBN:0471244554]
PO:0020035.name: epicotyl

comment: The parenchyma cells of both the coleorhiza and epiblast may function in storage. Some researchers consider the epiblast and coleorhiza independent structures that differentiate from the same proembryonic tissue.
def: "A portion of plant tissue that is a flap-like projection of the coleorhiza, inserted opposite the scutellum." [ISBN:0471244554]
PO:0020036.name: epiblast

comment: Occurs in grasses. In grasses, the hypocotyl and cotyledon may not be visible and may be represented by the scutellar node and scutellum, making the mesocotyl similar to the epicotyl in other taxa. Elongation of the mesocotyl during seedling growth pushes the coleoptile above the soil surface.
def: "A stem internode (PO:0020142) that is the part of a plant embryo axis (PO:0019018) or a seedling stem (PO:0009047) above the scutellum (PO:0020110) and below the coleoptile (PO:0020033)." [ISBN:0471244554, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0020037.name: mesocotyl

def: "A stalk of a leaf." [APweb:Glossary, GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0020038.name: petiole

comment: A leaf lamina is usually dorsiventrally flattened, but may be flattened in a median plant (perpendicular to the axis) in the case of phyllodes (PO:0025335) or other ensiform leaves (PO:0025333). This term should not be used for leaves that are not laminar (flat), like round leaves in Allium or needle-like leaves in Pinus or some Proteaceae. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A phyllome lamina (PO:0025396) that is the part of a leaf (PO:0025034) exclusive of the petiole (PO:0020038) or leaf sheath (PO:0020104), if either is present." [POC:curators]
PO:0020039.name: leaf lamina

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A phyllome base (PO:0025140) that is part of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0020040.name: leaf base

comment: Usually one of a pair of appendages. May take the form of a spine (PO:0025174) or may be bristled or brush-like. Stipules may occur on the opposite side of the shoot axis from the leaf they are associated with, but they are still thought to arise from part of the leaf.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is an appendage at the base of a vascular leaf." [POC:curators]
PO:0020041.name: stipule

def: "A leaf in which the lamina is undivided." [Poc:curators]
PO:0020042.name: simple leaf

def: "A leaf having two or more distinct leaflets that are evident as such from early in development." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020043.name: compound leaf

def: "The unifacial terete apical portion of a monocot cotyledon, sometimes also visible on other leaves." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020044.name: hyperphyll

comment: The total number of leaflets may be even or odd, in which case the leaf is called even-pinnate or odd-pinnate respectively.
def: "A once-compound leaf with leaflets borne along a rachis." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020045.name: pinnate leaf

def: "A once-compound leaf divided into several leaflets which arise at the same point, there being no rachis." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020046.name: palmate leaf

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A sporocyte (PO:0006204) that produces four haploid (1n) microspores (PO:0020048)." [ISBN:0878934030, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0020047.name: microsporocyte

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "The smaller, in general, of the two kinds of spores produced after meiosis in the life cycle of a heterosporous plant, and on germination giving rise to the male gametophyte." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020048.name: microspore

def: "One of the ultimate segments of a compound leaf." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020049.name: leaflet

def: "A stalk of a leaflet." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020050.name: petiolule

def: "Stipule-like appendage(s) at the base of a leaflet (in unifoliolate or simple leaves, found at the top of the petiole)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020051.name: stipel

def: "OBSOLETE. Literally a large leaf, a leaf of any size whose vascular supply leaves one or more gaps as it departs from the stem vascular tissue." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020052.name: megaphyll

def: "OBSOLETE. Literally a small leaf, a leaf of any size in which any vascular trace supplying it does not interrupt the central vascular cylinder when it departs, i.e. there are no leaf gaps." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020053.name: microphyll

def: "A scale leaf that surrounds a dormant or perennating bud." [UMSL:tk]
PO:0020054.name: bud scale leaf

def: "A stalk that is the main axis of a pinnate or more highly compound leaf, that bears leaflets or divisions of the axis." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020055.name: leaf rachis

def: "That part of the seed coat that develops from the inner integument." [APweb:Glossary, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0020056.name: tegmen
synonym: "Ã¥ÂÂÃ§Â¨Â®Ã¥Â­Â(internal seed coat, inner seed coat, secundine) (Japanese)" EXACT Japanese [NIG:Yukiko_Yamazaki]

def: "That part of the seed coat that develops from the outer integument, or from the single integument when there is only one." [APweb:Glossary, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0020057.name: testa

def: "Diploid nutritive tissue in an angiosperm seed derived from nucellar tissue." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020058.name: perisperm

comment: This term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology, GO:0043667.
def: "OBSOLETE. Complex wall surrounding the micrsopore." [UMSL:fz]
PO:0020059.name: pollen wall
synonym: "pared del grano de polen (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Often hard and generally smaller and less elaborate than a arillode.
def: "An arilloid that is an outgrowth of a seed next to the micropyle." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0020060.name: caruncle

def: "A portion of seed coat epidermis that consists of multiple seed trichomes at the micropyle." [POC:curators]
PO:0020061.name: coma

comment: May be a modified arilloid (a type of strophiole or caruncle) or may be an outgrowth of a fruit. May be attractive to ants and aid in dispersal.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is an oil-secreting outgrowth of a seed or fruit." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0020062.name: elaiosome

def: "A cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure (PO:0025498) that is a scar on a seed (PO:0009010) at the place where it was attached to a funicle (PO:0020006)." [POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0025498 ! cardinal part of multi-tissue plant structure
PO:0020063.name: hilum

def: "OBSOLETE. Fruit that breaks open at maturity to release the contents." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020064.name: dehiscent fruit

def: "OBSOLETE. Fruit that does not open at maturity." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020065.name: indehiscent fruit

def: "OBSOLETE. The fruit may be derived from monocarpellate or multicarpellate gynoecia. Their walls may consist of the pericarp or of pericarp fused with extracarpellary tissue. The outer part of the fruit wall or the entire fruit wall may become fleshy by differentiating into soft, succulent parenchyma. Parts other than the wall such as placentae and partitions in multilocular ovaries may become fleshy." [ISBN:047124529]
PO:0020066.name: fleshy fruit

def: "OBSOLETE. One segment of a fruit of a schizocarp consisting of pericarp plus seed(s)." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020075.name: mericarp

def: "OBSOLETE." [Poc:curators]
PO:0020081.name: seed as dispersal unit

def: "OBSOLETE. The 'stone' or 'pit' (endocarp plus seed) of a succulent fruit." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020084.name: pyrene

def: "OBSOLETE." [Poc:curators]
PO:0020085.name: seed and fruit wall as dispersal unit
synonym: "pared de la semilla y fruto como unidad dispersante (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "OBSOLETE. Fruit on a common axis derived from the ovaries of several flowers." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020086.name: multiple fruit

comment: In most angiosperms, the embryo sac central cell contains two polar nuclei, and, after double fertilization, develops into an endosperm. In some angiosperms, such as Illicium, the embryo sac central cell contains a single polar nucleus. Embryo sac central cell is distinct from archegonium central cell (PO:0025509).
def: "An embryo sac cell (PO:0025026) that is largest cell in a mature embryo sac (PO:0025074)." [PMID:17041880, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0020090.name: embryo sac central cell

comment: This term was made obsolete because it only applied to angiosperms. Consider new term microgametophyte (PO:0025280) that can apply to all plants. Also consider pollen (PO:0025281) or antheridial microgametophyte (PO:0025283).
def: "OBSOLETE. A gametophyte that produces pollen sperm cells." [POC:curators]
PO:0020091.name: obsolete microgametophyte

comment: This term was made obsolete because it only applied to angiosperms. Consider new term megagametophyte (PO:0025280) that can apply to all plants. Also consider embryo sac (PO:0025074) or archegonial megagametophyte (PO:0025282).
def: "OBSOLETE. A gametophyte that produces female gametes." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020092.name: obsolete megagametophyte

comment: More or less persistent, multiplicative or not.
def: "Cell, commonly three in number as in the eight-nucleate embryo sac, located at the other end of the embryo sac from the egg cell." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020093.name: antipodal cell

comment: The plant egg cell (megagamete) is usually larger than the plant sperm cell (PO:0000084; microgamete).
def: "A gamete (PO:0025006) produced by an archegonium (PO:0025126) or an embryo sac (PO:0025074)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020094.name: plant egg cell

comment: Comment: this term is now available in the cellular_component aspect of the Gene Ontology (GO:0043078).
def: "OBSOLETE. Usually two nuclei in the center of the eight-nucleate embryo sac that fuse, and subsequently fuse with one of the male gametes to produce the endosperm." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020095.name: polar nucleus

comment: Found in angiosperms.
def: "A cardinal organ part that has as parts an egg cell and two synergids and is located at the micropylar end of the embryo sac." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0020096.name: egg apparatus

comment: Occurs in angiosperms.
def: "A spermatogenous cell (PO:0025525) of the microgametophyte (PO:0025280) that divides to produce two pollen sperm cells (PO:0025121)." [APweb:Glossary, ISBN:1572590416, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0020097.name: generative cell

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is the larger cell of a microgametophyte (PO:0025280) in seed plants. It does not divide further and develops into a pollen tube cell (PO:0025195)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0020099.name: microgametophyte vegetative cell

def: "A stem internode (PO:0020142) below the cotyledonary node (PO:0025321) and transitional to a root (PO:0009005) of a plant embryo (PO:0009009) or a seedling (PO:0000003)." [APweb:Glossary, POC:curators]
PO:0020100.name: hypocotyl

comment: Pollen may be released through the stomium. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A plant anatomical space that is a slit in an anther lobe formed from when a dehiscence zone dehisces." [POC:curators]
PO:0020101.name: stomium

comment: If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352).
def: "A portion of ground tissue in the style of a carpel through which a pollen tube grows; it connects a stigma and the inside of an ovary." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, ISBN:0080374913]
PO:0020102.name: portion of transmitting tissue
synonym: "porci&#243n del tejido de transmisi&#243n (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "The last mature leaf before the inflorescence in a cereal crop plant." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0020103.name: flag leaf

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A tubular portion of the leaf surrounding the stem, as in the Poaceae." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0020104.name: leaf sheath

def: "A membranous or hairy appendage on the adaxial/upper surface of a leaf, at the junction between sheath and blade, especially in grasses." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020105.name: ligule

comment: May wrap around the stem (PO:0009047) or branch (PO:0025073) to which the vascular leaf (PO:0009025) it is part of is attached. Found in some Poaceae.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is an ear-shaped outgrowth of the distal part of a leaf sheath (PO:0020104)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:curators]
PO:0020106.name: leaf sheath auricle
synonym: "aur&#237cula de la vaina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The suspensor often allows the embryo to penetrate deep into the endosperm. Across plant species, suspensors are morphologically diverse and may be single- or multicellular, undifferentiated or highly differentiated, and variously shaped.
def: "An embryonic plant structure at the base of a plant embryo that develops from an embryonic basal cell and connects an embryo proper to the wall of a megagametophyte." [PMID:12271036]
PO:0020108.name: suspensor

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is the uppermost cell of a suspensor (PO:0020108) and from which part of the root (PO:0009005) and root cap (PO:0020123) in a plant embryo (PO:0009009) of angiosperms are derived." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0020109.name: embryo hypophysis

comment: May be a modified cotyledon.
def: "An embryonic plant structure that is a more or less shield-shaped and absorptive portion of a plant embryo of Poaceae." [APweb:Glossary, ISBN:0471244554]
PO:0020110.name: scutellum

comment: A lateral root primordium may develops on any root, including a primary root (PO:0020127), on an existing lateral root (PO:0020121), or a shoot-borne root (PO:0000042). In seed plants, a lateral root primordium generally develops from pericycle cells (PO:0025261), but cells of an endodermis (PO:0000252) may also participate in its formation in some species. In ferns, lateral root primordia develop from the endodermis.
def: "A root (PO:0009005) that develops from a lateral root primordium (PO:0000016) that is part of another root on the same plant." [ISBN:0521288959, ISRR:Richard_Zobel, POC:curators]
PO:0020121.name: lateral root

def: "A shoot axis (PO:0025029) that is part of an inflorescence (PO:0009049)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020122.name: inflorescence axis

comment: Often composed of living and dead parenchyma cells. Protects the root apical meristem.
def: "A portion of root parenchyma (PO:0025095) tissue that is part of the root tip (PO:0000025) and covers the root apical meristem (PO:0020147)." [ISBN:0716710072, POC:curators]
PO:0020123.name: root cap

comment: Includes the pericycle as the outermost layer of the stele.
def: "A stele (PO:0025197) that is part of a root (PO:0009005)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0020124.name: root stele

comment: This term was made obsolete because the definition was not correct. A new term, root elongation zone (PO:0025181), was created instead.
def: "OBSOLETE. The portion of the root that includes small, densely cytoplasmic cells that are dividing and expanding in size." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0020125.name: elongation zone

comment: Branched inflorescence with a central axis and about 10-50 lateral branches.
def: "A staminate inflorescence (PO:0025601) in Zea species that bears the tassel spikelet (PO:0006309) on a terminal inflorescence axis (PO:0020122)." [MaizeGDB:lv, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0020126.name: tassel inflorescence

comment: The first root of a plant.  In dicots and gymnosperms  it becomes the tap root, the central axis of a root system (PO:0025025).
def: "A root (PO:0009005) that develops directly from an seedling radicle (PO:0020127)." [ISBN:0122151704, POC:curators]
PO:0020127.name: primary root

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A phyllome margin (PO:0025018) of any flattened part of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020128.name: leaf margin

def: "A portion of root parenchyma tissue that is the central part of a root cap in which the cells are arranged in longitudinal files." [ISBN:0878938567, POC:curators]
PO:0020130.name: central root cap
synonym: "caliptra de la ra&#237z central (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This is the general term for the lateral portion of any root cap and not the term for a root cap of lateral root (PO:0003018) or lateral root cap of lateral root (PO:0003020).
def: "A portion of root parenchyma tissue that is part of a root cap and is parallel to the sides of a root axis." [ISBN:0878938567, POC:curators]
PO:0020131.name: lateral root cap
synonym: "caliptra lateral de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

relationship: develops_from PO:0020133 ! columella root cap initial cell

def: "A root initial cell that produces columella cells in the root cap. In direct contact with quiescent center." [ISBN:0471245208, TAIR:Katica_Ilic]
PO:0020133.name: columella root cap initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula inicial de la columela del caliptra de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: This is sub-cellular term

PO:0020134.name: statolith

comment: Most of the primary tissues of a root mature in the differentiation zone. This zone is where root hairs are produced.
def: "A plant axis differentiation zone that is the part of a root and is located behind a root elongation zone." [POC:curators]

PO:0020136.name: ear inflorescence

comment: It is not precisely defined how far toward the base from the tip a leaf apex extends. For the apical most portion of a leaf, use the term leaf tip. If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.
def: "A phyllome apex (PO:0025139) that is part of a leaf (PO:0025034)." [POC:Ramona_Walls, UMSL:fz]

def: "A primary leaf vein (PO:0025413) that is the central vein of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025)." [POC:curators]
PO:0020139.name: leaf midvein

comment: Vein orders only apply to hierarchically branching vein patterns, not to dichotomously branching vein patterns, as found in some ferns and gymnosperms.
def: "A leaf lamina vein (PO:0020138) arising from a primary leaf vein (PO:0025413)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal]
PO:0020140.name: secondary leaf vein

def: "A shoot node that is part of a stem." [APweb:Glossary]
PO:0020141.name: stem node

comment: See node.
def: "A shoot axis internode (PO:0005005) that is part of a stem (PO:0009047)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]

def: "A maximal portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) located at a shoot apex (PO:0000037) or root tip (PO:0000025)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0020144.name: apical meristem

comment: A term for lateral growth has been requested in GO. Lateral meristems contribute to an increase in the cross-sectional area of a shoot axis or root. Examples of lateral meristems are: cambium (PO:0005597) (includes cork cambium (PO:0005599) and vascular cambium (PO:0005598)), shoot lateral meristem (PO:0006344) (includes primary thickening meristem (PO:0005039)), root lateral meristem (PO:0006308), and secondary thickening meristem (PO:0025414). Contrasts with apical meristem (PO:0020144), phyllome marginal meristem (PO:0025404), or intercalary meristem (PO:0006073).
def: "A portion of meristem (PO:0009013) tissue located parallel to the sides of a shoot axis (PO:0025029) or root (PO:0009005) that participates in lateral growth." [ISBN:047125208]
PO:0020145.name: lateral meristem

comment: In most cases, it is involved in root elongation.
def: "A root meristem (PO:0006085) located at the root tip (PO:0000025), behind the root cap (PO:0020123)." [GR:Pankaj_Jaiswal, POC:Laurel_Cooper, UMSL:fz]
PO:0020147.name: root apical meristem
synonym: "meristema apical de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A shoot system meristem (PO:0006079) formed at the apex of the shoot axis (PO:0025029), including those originating from an axillary bud meristem (PO:0000232)." [POC:Cooperl, UMSL:fz]
PO:0020148.name: shoot apical meristem

comment: If a root cap is present, the quiescent center is behind the root cap.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is part of a root apical meristem (PO:0020147) and consists of mitotically and metabolically inactive cells and is located behind the protoderm (PO:0006210) of the root (PO:0009005)." [ISBN:0122151704, POC:curators]

synonym: "centro de division de c&#233lulas del meristema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "OBSOLETE. The proportion of the absolute size reached by the calyx" [POC:curators]

PO:0021003.name: calyx relationship

def: "Stage of inflorescence development marked by the formation of the inflorescence meristem on a vegetative branch." [POC:Felipe_Zapata]
PO:0021004.name: inflorescence initiation stage

comment: Cardinal refers to the fact that these are biologically meaningful and not arbitrary parts. Examples include petiole (PO:0020038), lamina (PO:0025060), and leaflet (PO:0020049). See also collective organ part structure (PO:0025269), for plant structures composed of parts of multiple organs.

See also collective organ part structure (PO:0025269), for plant structures composed of parts of multiple organs, but no complete plant organs. This was formerly named collective plant structure.

def: "A phyllome margin (PO:0025018) of a petal (PO:0009032)." [POC:curators]

All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.

comment: Hydroids are water and mineral conducting cells found in bryophytes in axes and leaves in the gametophytic phase and in the seta in the sporophytic phase.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is dead at maturity, lacks specialized wall thickenings or lignin, and has tapered ends that are thin and partially hydrolyzed." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:376821110, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025032.name: hydroid

comment: A carbohydrate and amino acid conducting cell found in bryophytes in axes and leaves in the gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) and in the seta in the sporophytic phase. Leptoids have no nucleus at maturity. Carbohydrate and amino acid conducting cells in bryophytes range from conducting parenchyma cells that are indistinguishable from other parenchyma cells to 'leptoids sensu strictu' that are structurally comparable to sieve elements in vascular plants, as well as many intermediate forms. The term leptoid is used for cells that are distinguishable from other parenchyma cells, whether they be intermediate or leptoids sensu strictu.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that resembles in structure the sieve elements (PO:0025406) of vascular plants." [ISBN:376821110, ISBN:962073342, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025033.name: leptoid

def: "A phyllome (PO:0006001) that is not associated with a reproductive structure." [POC:curators]

Scale that the breeders use to rate the buds/sprouts of tubers: 1. none, 2. swollen eye, 3. sprout ca. 1/4", 4. sprout ca. 1/2", 5. sprout ca. 1", 6. sprout ca. 2", 7. sprout ca. 3", 8. new top growth, 9. chain tubers.

comment: May be simple or compound. Found in lycophytes such as Selaginella and Lycopodium, sphenophytes such as Equisetum, gymnosperms such as cycad, conifers, gnetophytes and the pollen producing structures of Gingko. The term cone is often used for strobili that are woody. Flowers are sometimes considered bisexual strobili. Some flowering plants such as Alnus have inflorescences called catkins that resemble strobili, but are not.

comment: Common in monocots, including species of Poaceae such as Zea mays. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), ear floret (PO:0006354), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006353), lower floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006351), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear (PO:0006350), upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear (PO:0006352). In Zea mays, development of the gynoecium ridge of the upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear occurs via continued overgrowth of the shoot apex (which becomes the ovule primordium) by a ring of gynoecial tissue, leading to the formation of a stylar canal that is detected as a slight protuberance on the mature ovary. Early development of the gynoecium ridge of the lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear is very similar to that of the upper floret of the pedicellate spikelet of ear, except the development does not proceed beyond the early ridge stage.
def: "A gynoecium in the early stages of development, characterized as a ridge on the abaxial surface of the floral meristem that develops from a gynoecium primordium." [PMID:10077498, POC:curators]
PO:0025088.name: gynoecium ridge
synonym: "gynoecium ridge of lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear" NARROW []

"gynoecium ridge of upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of ear" NARROW []
"gynoecium ridge of upper floret of sessile spikelet of ear" NARROW []

comment: Antheridial sperm cells are motile and lack a cell wall.
def: "A plant sperm cell (PO:0000084) which develops from a spermatogenous cell (PO:0025525) and is located in an antheridium (PO:0025125)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025120.name: antheridium sperm cell

comment: Pollen sperm cells are structurally simple, usually non-motile cells that may contain a normal complement of cellular organelles, including heritable cytoplasmic organelles such as mitochondria and, in some plants, plastids, but lack a cell wall. In seed plants, pollen sperm cells are usually two in number. In angiosperms, during double fertilization, one fuses with the plant egg cell (PO:0020094) to produce a plant zygote (PO:0000423) while another fuses with the two polar nuclei of the embryo sac central cell (PO:0020090) to give rise to endosperm (PO:0009089).  In angiosperms, the pollen sperm cell arises from the generative cell (PO:0020097). In gymnosperms, the pollen sperm cell arises from the body cell (PO:0025525).
def: "A plant sperm cell (PO:0000084) that is part of the pollen (PO:0025281)." [PMID:20298228, POC:curators]
PO:0025121.name: pollen sperm cell

comment: The archegonium egg cell has a common origin with the ventral canal cell.

PO:0025122.name: archegonium egg cell

comment: The multicellular plant gametangium; an archegonium (PO:0025126) and/or an antheridium (PO:0025125), occurs in bryophytes, pteridophytes and gymnosperms, but never in angiosperms.
def: "A plant organ (PO:0009008) that produces one or more gametes (PO:0025006) and participates in the gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025124.name: multicellular plant gametangium

comment: The antheridium (PO:0025125) occurs in bryophytes and pteridophytes, but never in gymnosperms or angiosperms, where male gametes are produced in the pollen (PO:0025281), a specialized (reduced) gametangium.
def: "A multicellular plant gametangium (PO:0025124) that produces antheridium sperm cells (PO:0025120) and has as parts an antheridium jacket layer (PO:0030053) and an antheridium stalk (PO:0030035)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025125.name: antheridium

comment: At maturity, the archegonium produces an archegonium egg cell (PO:0025122).  In mosses, the archegonium also has part an archegonium stalk (PO:0030036). The archegonium (PO:0025126) occurs in bryophytes and pteridophytes, but never in angiosperms, where the female gamete (plant egg cell; PO:0020094) is produced by the embryo sac (PO:0025074), a specialized (reduced) gametangium.
def: "A multicellular plant gametangium (PO:0025124) that develops from an archegonium initial cell (PO:0025510) and has as parts a venter (PO:0030038) and an archegonium neck (PO:0030039)." [ISBN:0521794331, POC:curators]
PO:0025126.name: archegonium

comment: A primordium appears as a protrusion and is the first distinct form of a plant organ (PO:0009008), cardinal organ part (PO:0025001), or collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007). The transition from a primordium to the plant structure it develops into is marked by the development of non-meristematic cells, although meristematic cells may be present after the transition.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that has as parts protoderm (PO:0006210) and sub-epidermal meristematic tissue and is committed to the development of a particular plant structure (PO:0009011)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025127.name: primordium

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.

PO:0025249.name: leaf sheath epidermis
synonym: "epidermis de la vaina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.

PO:0025250.name: leaf sheath abaxial epidermis
synonym: "epidermis abaxial de la vaina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: If you are annotating to this term, please add an additional annotation to vascular leaf (PO:0009025) or non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075), depending on the species. All annotations for angiosperms, gymnosperms, and pteridophytes should go to vascular leaf and all annotations for bryophytes should go to non-vascular leaf.

PO:0025251.name: leaf sheath adaxial epidermis
synonym: "epidermis adaxial de la vaina de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "An infructescence branch (PO:0025243) arising from a fifth order infructescence branch (PO:0025116)." [POC:Laura_Moore, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025252.name: sixth order infructescence branch
synonym: "ramificacion de sexto orden de la infructescencia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "An infructescence branch (PO:0025243) arising from a sixth order infructescence branch (PO:0025252)." [POC:Laura_Moore, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025253.name: seventh order infructescence branch
synonym: "ramificacion de s&#233ptimo orden de la infructescencia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:curators]

def: "An infructescence branch (PO:0025243) arising from a seventh order infructescence branch (PO:0025253)." [POC:Laura_Moore, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025254.name: eighth order infructescence branch
synonym: "ramificacion de octava orden de la infructescencia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:curators]
