PO:0025255.name: ninth or higher order infructescence branch
synonym: "ramificacion de noveno o superior orden de la infructescencia (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:curators]

def: "A root elongation zone that is part of a lateral root tip." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025256.name: lateral root elongation zone
synonym: "zona de elongaci&#243n de la ra&#237z lateral (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A root elongation zone that is part of a primary root tip." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025257.name: primary root elongation zone
synonym: "zona de elongaci&#243n de la ra&#237z primaria (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A meristematic cell (PO:0004010) that is part of a portion of procambium (PO:0025275)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025258.name: procambial cell

def: "A portion of shoot procambium (PO:0025276) tissue that is part of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025259.name: leaf procambium

def: "A portion of shoot procambium that is part of a shoot apical meristem and gives rise to the primary vascular tissue of a shoot axis." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025260.name: shoot axis procambium
synonym: "procambio del eje del epiblasto (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A ground tissue cell that is part of a portion of pericycle." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025261.name: pericycle cell

comment: Found in species with syncarpous gynoecia (fused carpels). An ovary septum is derived from the fused walls of two adjacent carpels, while a replum (PO:0005016) develops from early contact of placental tissue from opposite sides of the ovary. Annotations for Arabidopsis should go under replum, not under ovary septum.
def: "A septum that divides a multilocular ovary." [POC:curators]
PO:0025262.name: ovary septum

comment: May be a cavity in a sporophyll, within several fused sporophylls, or within a sporangium. In many instances, the locules are filled with seeds or other plant structures.
def: "A plant anatomical space that is a cavity a reproductive structure." [POC:curators]
PO:0025263.name: locule

def: "A sporangium locule that is part of an anther and is a cavity within a single pollen sac or two or more fused pollen sacs." [POC:curators]
PO:0025264.name: anther locule

comment: May be filled with spores.
def: "A locule that is a cavity in a sporangium or several fused sporangia." [POC:curators]
PO:0025265.name: sporangium locule

comment: Generally contains at least one ovule. An ovary locule may be part of a single carpel, in the case of unicarpellate flowers. An ovary that is part of a syncarpous gynoecium may have multiple locules, or the anatomical spaces of multiple carpels may be fused to form a single locule.
def: "A locule that is a cavity in an ovary." [POC:curators]
PO:0025266.name: ovary locule

comment: A fruit replum develops from the ovary replum and has no suture line in its center, while a fruit septum (PO:0025262) develops from an ovary septum via the fusion of two adjacent ovary walls. Common in Brassicaceae. Annotations for Arabidopsis fruit should go here, and not under fruit septum.
def: "A portion of fruit placenta tissue that divides a fruit into two or more chambers and develops from a replum." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025267.name: fruit replum

comment: Annotations for Arabidopsis should go under fruit replum (PO:0025267), not under fruit septum. The partition between two sections of an orange is a fruit septum.
def: "A septum that divides a cavity or mass of tissue in a fruit and develops from an ovary septum." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025268.name: fruit septum

comment: A collective organ part structure is composed of parts of multiple organs, but no complete organs. The organ parts are often of the same type but may be of different types. Includes plant structures like a septum (PO:0000030) that consists of the walls of two fused carpels (PO:0009030) or a pseudostem (PO:0025248) that consist of multiple, overlapping leaf sheaths (PO:0020104). Unlike a collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007), a collective organ part structure does not contain any complete plant organs.
def: "A collective plant structure (PO:0025497) composed of two or more cardinal organ parts (PO:0025001) that are part of adjacent plant organs (PO:0009008) and any associated portions of plant tissue (PO:0009007)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025269.name: collective organ part structure
synonym: "&#243rgano colectivo de una parte de la estructura (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A locule that is a cavity in a fruit and develops from an ovary locule." [POC:curators]
PO:0025270.name: fruit locule

comment: An ovary replum develops along with the ovary and has no suture line in its center, while a true ovary septum (PO:0025262) is derived from the fusion two adjacent ovary walls. Common in Brassicaceae. Annotations for Arabidopsis should go here, and not under ovary septum.
def: "A portion of ovary placenta tissue that divides an ovary into two or more chambers and develops from contact of the placental tissue from opposite sides of the ovary early in gynoecium development." [ISBN:0387940898, POC:curators]
PO:0025272.name: ovary replum

def: "A portion of shoot axis procambium gives rise to the primary vascular tissue of a stem." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025273.name: stem procambium

def: "A portion of shoot axis procambium gives rise to the primary vascular tissue of a branch." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025274.name: branch procambium

comment: May occur in an apical meristem or in a developing phyllome. Gives rise to the primary xylem and primary phloem. This term replaces PO:0006074.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that undergoes differentiation to form the primary vascular tissue (PO:0025408)." [ISBN:0471244554]
PO:0025275.name: procambium

def: "A portion of procambium (PO:0025275) tissue that is part of a shoot system (PO:0009006)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025276.name: shoot procambium

comment: A pollen sac is a microsporangium in seed plants. In angiosperms, a single, unfused pollen sac may contain an anther locule or several pollen sacs may fuse so they contain a single anther locule. If you are annotating to this structure for Zea mays or other grasses, please also add an annotation to the corresponding floret type. Choose the most specific term possible from: spikelet floret (PO:0009082), tassel floret (PO:0006310), lower floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006313), lower floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006315), upper floret of pedicellate spikelet of tassel (PO:0006314), upper floret of sessile spikelet of tassel (PO:0006316).
def: "A microsporangium that is part of a sporophyll and where the pollen grains develop and are located after they develop." [POC:curators]
PO:0025277.name: pollen sac

def: "A scale leaf that grows from a rhizome." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025278.name: rhizome scale leaf

comment: Megagametophytes in bryophytes only produce egg cells, but do not develop from megaspores, because there is no heterospory in bryophytes. In some pteridophytes, megagametophytes develop from megaspores. In angiosperms, Gnetum, and Weltwischia, the megagametophyte is greatly reduced. The megagametophyte in angiosperms is an embryo sac.
def: "A whole plant in the gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) that produces only plant egg cells (PO:0020094)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025279.name: megagametophyte

comment: The microgametophyte in bryophytes only produce sperm cells, but do not develop from microspores, because there is no heterospory in bryophytes. In seed plants the male gametophyte is reduced to a pollen grain.
def: "A whole plant (PO:0000003) in the gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) that produces plant sperm cells (PO:0000084)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025280.name: microgametophyte

def: "A microgametophyte (PO:0025280) that develops from a microspore (PO:0020048) is located in a pollen sac (PO:0025277)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025281.name: pollen

comment: Megagametophytes in bryophytes only produce egg cells, but do not develop from megaspores, because there is no heterospory in bryophytes. In some pteridophytes, megagametophytes develop from megaspores.
def: "A megagametophyte (PO:0025279) that has as parts one or more archegonia (PO:0025126)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025282.name: archegonium megagametophyte

comment: Microgametophytes in bryophytes only produce sperm cells, but do not develop from microspores, because there is no heterospory in bryophytes. In some pteridophytes, microgametophytes develop from microspores.
def: "A microgametophyte (PO:0025280) that has as parts one or more antheridia (PO:0025125)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025283.name: antheridium microgametophyte

comment: The zygote divides to form an embryo apical cell and an embryo basal cell.
def: "A sporophyte meristematic apical cell that is part of a plant embryo and is the uppermost cell formed after the first division of a zygote." [ISBN:0471245208, ISBN:9780070588493]
PO:0025284.name: embryo apical cell

def: "A parenchyma cell that is part of a plant callus." [POC:curators]
PO:0025285.name: callus parenchyma cell

def: "A coleoptile (PO:0020033) that is part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025286.name: plant embryo coleoptile

comment: A seedling coleoptile  develops from an embryo coleoptile (PO:0025286).
def: "A coleoptile (PO:0020033) that is part of a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the seedling development stage (PO:0007131)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025287.name: seedling coleoptile

def: "A coleorhiza (PO:0020034) that is part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025288.name: embryo coleorhiza

comment: Develops from an embryo coleorhiza (PO:0025288).
def: "A coleorhiza (PO:0020034) that is part of a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the seedling development stage (PO:0007131)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025289.name: seedling coleorhiza

def: "A hypocotyl (PO:0020100) that is part of a plant embryo axis (PO:0019018)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025290.name: embryo hypocotyl

comment: Develops from an embryo hypocotyl (PO:0025290). This term should only be used for seed plants.
def: "A hypocotyl (PO:0020100) that is part of a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the seedling development stage (PO:0007131)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025291.name: seedling hypocotyl

def: "An epicotyl (PO:0020035) that is part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025292.name: embryo epicotyl

comment: Develops from an embryo epicotyl (PO:0025292).
def: "An epicotyl (PO:0020035) that is part of a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the seedling development stage (PO:0007131)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025293.name: seedling epicotyl

def: "A mesocotyl (PO:0020037) that is part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025294.name: embryo mesocotyl

comment: A seedling mesocotyl is an elongation of an embryo mesocotyl (PO:0025294) and is part of a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the seedling development stage (PO:0007131).
def: "A mesocotyl (PO:0020037) that develops from an embryo mesocotyl (PO:0025294)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025295.name: seedling mesocotyl

comment: May eventually develop into the root system (PO:0025025)  of an adult plant. Sometimes is abortive.
def: "A radicle (PO:0020031) that is part of a plant embryo (PO:0009009)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025296.name: plant embryo radicle

comment: Develops from an embryo radicle (PO:0025296). May develop into the root system (PO:0025025)  of an adult plant. Sometimes is abortive.
def: "A radicle (PO:0020031) that is part of a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the seedling development stage (PO:0007131)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025297.name: seedling radicle

comment: Develops from the apical portion of a gynoecium. Found in Eucalyptus and other Myrtaceae.
def: "A collective organ part structure that is the apical part of a circumsessile capsular fruit that separates from the rest of the capsule during dehiscence." [POC:curators]
PO:0025298.name: fruit operculum

comment: Found in Eucalyptus and other Myrtaceae. This term was made obsolete and replaced by the more specific terms calyptra calyx (PO:0025329) and calyptra corolla (PO:0025330).
def: "OBSOLETE. A fused perianth that is composed of fused sepals or petals and located on top of a gynoecium that contains an inferior ovary." [POC:curators]
PO:0025299.name: calyptra perianth

def: "A hypocotyl-root junction (PO:0004724) that is part of an plant embryo axis (PO:0019018)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper, POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025300.name: embryo hypocotyl-root junction
synonym: "conjunci&#243n del hipoc&#243tile-ra&#237z en el embri&#243n (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Part of a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the seedling development stage (PO:0007131).
def: "A hypocotyl-root junction (PO:0004724) that develops from an embryo hypocotyl-root junction (PO:0025300) ." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025301.name: seedling hypocotyl-root junction
synonym: "conjunci&#243n del hipoc&#243tile-ra&#237z en la pl&#225ntula (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Somatic plant embryos may arise where embryos normally would not arise as a product of apomixis. They may occur on the edges of leaves on some species of Kalanchoe or some ferns.
def: "A plant embryo (PO:0009009) that arises from previously differentiated somatic cells, rather than from fused gametes, i.e. the plant zygote (PO:0000423)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025302.name: somatic plant embryo

def: "A plant embryo (PO:0009009) that forms as a result of the fusion of gametes." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025303.name: zygotic plant embryo

def: "A zygotic plant embryo that is grown or maintained in vitro." [POC:curators]
PO:0025304.name: cultured zygote-derived plant embryo
synonym: "embri&#243n cultivado derivado del cigoto vegetal (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A cultured somatic plant embryo that develops from isolated microspores." [POC:curators]
PO:0025305.name: microspore-derived cultured plant embryo
synonym: "embri&#243n cultivado derivado de la microspora vegetal (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: May have multiple layers such as exothecium, endothecium and tapetum. Early in development, the sporangium wall bounds the archesporium. Later, after spores develop from the archesporium, it bounds the spore or spores.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is composed of the outer layers of a sporangium (PO:0025094) and bounds the archesporium (PO:0030074) or plant spores (PO:0025017)." [ISBN:9780070588493]
PO:0025306.name: sporangium wall

def: "A sporangium wall (PO:0025306) that is part of a microsporangium (PO:0025202)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025307.name: microsporangium wall

def: "A sporangium wall that is part of a megasporangium." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025308.name: megasporangium wall

def: "A sporangium wall endothecium (PO:0030049) that is part of a microsporangium wall (PO:0025307)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025309.name: microsporangium endothecium

def: "An endothecium that is part of a megasporangium wall." [POC:curators]
PO:0025310.name: megasporangium endothecium

def: "An exothecium that is part of a microsporangium wall." [POC:curators]
PO:0025311.name: microsporangium exothecium

def: "An exothecium that is part of a megasporangium wall." [POC:curators]
PO:0025312.name: megasporangium exothecium

comment: May function in providing nutrition to developing sporocytes or pollen. May have one or more layers of cells. May break down as spores mature. A tapetum does not develop in some plants, such as Psilotum. In angiosperms, the tapetum develops from one of the parietal layers. In non-seed plants, the tapetum may develop from the outer cells of archesporium or from the inner-most layer of the sporangium wall. The tapetum may be one of two types ameboid or secretory/glandular.
def: "A portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) that is the inner-most layer of a sporangium wall (PO:0025306)." [ISBN:0471244554, ISBN:9780003686647, ISBN:9780070588493]
PO:0025313.name: tapetum

def: "An tapetum (PO:0025313) that is part of a microsporangium wall (PO:0025307)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025314.name: microsporangium tapetum

def: "A tapetum (PO:0025313) that is part of a megasporangium wall (PO:0025308)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025315.name: megasporangium tapetum

comment: Found in monocots and mosses. The basal stalk may contain one or more cells.
def: "A multicellular trichome (PO:0025162) that has as parts a long terminal cell atop a basal stalk and grows in a leaf axil (PO:0009023)." [ISBN:9780473067304, POC:curators]
PO:0025316.name: axillary hair

def: "A trichome cell (PO:0008030) that is the long terminal cell of an axillary hair (PO:0008030)." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0025317.name: axillary hair terminal cell
synonym: "c&#233lula terminal del pelo axilar (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Consists of two or more cells.
def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the basal part of an axillary hair, below the axillary hair terminal cell." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0025318.name: axillary hair base

def: "A trichome cell (PO:0008030) that is part of a base of an axillary hair (PO:0025316)." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0025319.name: axillary hair basal cell
synonym: "c&#233lula basal del pelo axilar (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Found in some monocots.
def: "An epidermal rhizoid that grows form a cotyledonary node." [ISBN:3540640606, PMID:17933843]
PO:0025320.name: cotyledonary node rhizoid
synonym: "rizoide del nodo del cotiled&#243n (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A stem node from which one or more cotyledons grow." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025321.name: cotyledonary node

comment: Similar to a stomatal pore, but lacks the ability to open and close. Involved in the release water or xylem sap through guttation or secretion.
def: "A plant anatomical space that is an opening in a hydathode." [PMID:18450784, POC:curators]
PO:0025322.name: hydathode pore

comment: A fascicle appears to be a cluster of flowers in an axil of a single bract of the main inflorescence. Fascicles are common in some sections of the Fabaceae, where they are second order inflorescences.
def: "A reproductive shoot system that is a second or higher order inflorescence in which the second or higher order inflorescence branch bears two or more flowers but is not elongated." [PMID:12644644]
PO:0025323.name: flower fascicle

comment: Usually larger than the adjacent wing petals. Found in the flowers of some Fabaceae.
def: "A petal (PO:0009032) that is the top-most petal of a papilionaceous corolla (PO:0009059)." [ISBN:9780023681905]
PO:0025324.name: banner petal

comment: The wing petals are usually much smaller than the banner petal and the corolla keel. Found in the flowers of some Fabaceae.
def: "One of two lateral petals (PO:0009032) that is adjacent to the banner petal of a papilionaceous corolla (PO:0009059)." [ISBN:9780023681905]
PO:0025325.name: wing petal

comment: The keel petals are usually larger than the adjacent wing petals. They are often partially fused to each other. Each petal is shaped like half a boat and projects toward the front of the flower.
def: "A petal (PO:0009032) that is one of the two lowest petals of a papilionaceous corolla (PO:0025324)." [ISBN:9780023681905]
PO:0025326.name: keel petal

comment: The two petals of the keel are often fused at the apex and free at the base. The keel projects toward the front of the flower. Found in the flowers of some Fabaceae.
def: "A boat-shaped collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023) that consists of the two lowest petals (PO:0009032) of a papilionaceous corolla (PO:0009059)." [ISBN:9780023681905]
PO:0025327.name: keel

comment: A unifacial leaf may be round in cross-section (terete) or it may be laminar (ensiform), in which case lamina development is in a median plane (perpendicular to the axis), rather than a transverse plane (tangent to the axis). Unifacial leaves may be bifacial at the leaf base. Many unifacial leaves develop by reduced (or absent) activity of the marginal meristems and increased activity of the adaxial meristem early in development, leading to mature leaves with only an adaxial surface (e.g., Acacia phyllodes). However, some develop by increased activity of the abaxial meristem early in development, leading to mature leaves with only an abaxial surface. Note that unifacial leaves may have two sides, as in ensiform leaves, but both sides arise from the same surface of the leaf meristem (abaxial or adaxial).
def: "A vascular leaf that has increased activity of either the adaxial or abaxial meristem early in development, leading to absence of the opposite surface on the mature leaf." [ISBN:9780023681905, PO_REF:00005, PO_REF:00006]
PO:0025328.name: unifacial vascular leaf

comment: Sometimes found in Eucalyptus and other Myrtaceae, covering an inner operculum or calyptra corolla. The sepals are generally completely fused. Species of the subgenus Monocalyptrus have only a calyptra corolla (inner operculum) while in most other species, a calyptra calyx is also present, at least early in flower development. Not the same structure as a spore capsule calyptra or fruit operculum. Sometimes erroneously referred to as part of a fruit.
def: "A fused calyx (PO:0025582) that is composed of fused sepals (PO:0025584)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025329.name: calyptra calyx

comment: Often found in Eucalyptus and other Myrtaceae. The petals are generally completely fused. If an outer operculum (calyptra calyx) is present, it covers the inner operculum (calyptra corolla). Species of the subgenus Monocalyptrus have only a calyptra corolla (inner operculum) while in most other species, a calyptra calyx is also present, at least early in flower development. Not the same structure as a spore capsule calyptra or fruit operculum. Sometimes erroneously referred to as part of a fruit.
def: "A fused corolla (PO:0025581) that is composed of fused petals (PO:0025583)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025330.name: calyptra corolla

comment: Found in the Asteraceae, surrounding the disk flowers (PO:0025332). Usually zygomorphic, and different in form from disk flowers. Usually pistillate but sterile.
def: "A small pistillate flower (PO:0025599) on the margin of a head-type (capitulum) inflorescence  (PO:0009049)." [ISBN:9781842464229, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025331.name: ray flower

comment: Found in the Asteraceae. May be actinomorphic or bilabiate, often bisexual. Usually surrounded by and different in form from ray flowers (PO:0025331).
def: "A small flower (PO:0009046) in the center of a head-type (capitulum) inflorescence (PO:0009049)." [ISBN:9781842464229]
PO:0025332.name: disk flower

comment: Common in many monocots and some dicots. Note that ensiform leaves have two sides, but both sides arise from the same surface of the leaf meristem (abaxial or adaxial). In some leaves, the petiole may twist, giving the appearance that the lamina is ensiform, but it is not.
def: "A unifacial leaf that is flat in cross section due to a lamina that develops in a median plane (perpendicular to the axis), rather a transverse plane (tangent to the axis) throughout all of part of the length of the leaf." [ISBN:9780023681905, PO_REF:00005]
PO:0025333.name: ensiform vascular leaf

comment: The surface of a terete leaf corresponds to either the adaxial or abaxial surface of a normal leaf.
def: "A unifacial leaf that is round in cross section throughout all of part of the length of the leaf." [ISBN:9780023681905]
PO:0025334.name: terete vascular leaf

comment: Common in legumes of the genus Acacia. Similar development occurs in other ensiform leaves in some monocots, but they are not called phyllodes. Transitional leaves also occur, in which the basal portion of the leaf develops similar to a phyllode, but the apical portion of the leaf develops normal leaflets (see PO:0025336, transition phyllode leaf). Phyllodes are generally xeromorphic.
def: "An adult ensiform leaf with a lamina that develops in a median plane, rather a transverse plane, throughout the length of the leaf and is a result of increased activity of the adaxial meristem early in development." [PMID:18978364, PO_REF:00006, PO_REF:00007]
PO:0025335.name: phyllode leaf

comment: Common in seedlings of legumes of the genus Acacia. May also occur later, after the plant has begun to produce phyllodes.
def: "A transition vascular leaf in which the basal portion of the leaf has unifacial lamina development in a median plane, similar to a phyllode, and the apical portion of the leaf develops leaflets similar to a juvenile leaf." [PMID:18978364, PO_REF:00006, PO_REF:00007]
PO:0025336.name: transition phyllode leaf

comment: There are only two types of life of whole plant. Every life of a whole plant is either a maximal gametophyte stage or a maximal sporophyte stage.
def: "A maximal whole plant development stage." [POC:curators]
PO:0025337.name: life of whole plant stage
synonym: "vida de la planta entera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Includes flower development stage (PO:0007615), corolla development stage (PO:0007604), and inflorescence development stage (PO:0001083).
def: "A plant structure development stage (PO:0009012) that has as primary participant a collective plant structure (PO:0025497)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025338.name: collective plant organ structure development stage
relationship: has_participant PO:0025007 ! collective plant organ structure
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo de una estructura colectiva de la planta (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Includes development stages for leaves and roots.
def: "A multi-tissue plant structure development stage (PO:0025571) that has as primary participant a plant organ (PO:0009008) ." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
is_a: PO:0025571 ! multi-tissue plant structure development stage
PO:0025339.name: plant organ development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo de un &#243rgano (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A gametophyte may begin to senesce or die from other causes before producing gametangia. Some plants, such as the fern Vittaria appalachiana, may never produce gametangia, and remain in the vegetative stage indefinitely. Developmental vegetative growth (GO:0080186) can also occur during the reproductive stage.
def: "A gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) that occurs during the interval between spore germination and the formation of a gametangium." [POC:curators]
PO:0025340.name: gametophyte vegetative stage

comment: A whole plant (PO:0000003) may continue developmental vegetative growth (GO:0080186) after it has entered the reproductive stage, and it may revert to a stage in which it is no longer producing gametantia, but once it has initiated a single gametangium, it remains in the reproductive stage until senescence or death by some other cause.
def: "A gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) that occurs during the interval between the initiation of either a multicellular plant gametangium (PO:0025124) or a unicellular plant gametangium (PO:0025521) and the onset of senescence." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025341.name: gametophyte reproductive stage

comment: A dormancy process (GO:0022611) is a developmental process in which dormancy (sometimes called a dormant state) is induced, maintained or broken. Dormancy is a suspension of most physiological activity and growth that can be reactivated. This term only applies to a whole plant (PO:0000003) in the gametophyte stage, not to the dormant stage of other plant structures. The dormant stage may be a response to environmental conditions such as seasonality or extreme heat, drought, or cold. Examples of a gametophyte dormant stage are the moss Polytrichum commune after it has undergone dessication (a type of resurrection plant), the boreal moss Polytrichum alpestre, whose shoot systems have annual growth segments due to a period of dormancy during the winter, the female gametophyte of Ginkgo biloba, which is dormant before fertilization, and dormancy of plant spores.
def: "A gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) during which a gametophyte participates in a dormancy process." [GO:0022611, PO_REF:00009, POC:curators]
PO:0025342.name: gametophyte dormant stage

comment: The gametophyte senescent stage is often preceded by the gametophyte reproductive stage, and it ends with death of the gametophyte, either as a result of senescence or some other cause. This stage is distinct from gametophyte dormant stage, in which organs may senesce, but some parts of the plant remain alive. Multicellular organism senescence/aging (GO:0010259) includes loss of functions such as resistance to disease, homeostasis, and fertility, as well processes like cellular senescence, organ senescence, and wear and tear. The POC curators have requested to the GOC that they revise the definition of GO:0010259, to make it more appropriate for plants.
def: "A gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) during which a gametophyte participates in multicellular organism senescence." [GO:0010259, POC:curators]
PO:0025343.name: gametophyte senescent stage
synonym: "etapa de senescencia del gametofito (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A gametophyte reproductive stage (PO:0025341) in which a gametophore (PO:0030018) and gametangium is being produced." [POC:curators]
PO:0025344.name: gametophore reproductive whole plant development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del gamet&#243foro reproductivo de la planta entera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Succeeds a protonema stage.
def: "A gametophyte vegetative whole plant development stage during which a gametophore is being produced but no gametangia are being produced." [POC:curators]
PO:0025345.name: gametophore vegetative whole plant development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del gamet&#243foro vegetativo de la planta entera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A gametophyte reproductive development stage in which a thallus and gametangium is being produced." [POC:curators]
PO:0025346.name: thallus reproductive whole plant development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del talo reproductivo de la planta entera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: May succeed a protonema whole plant development stage or may directly succeed spore germination.
def: "A gametophyte vegetative whole plant development stage during which a thallus is being produced but no gametangia are being produced." [POC:curators]
PO:0025347.name: thallus vegetative whole plant development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del talo vegetativo de la plant entera (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A vascular bundle (PO:0005020) that is part of a phyllome lamina (PO:0025396)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025348.name: phyllome lamina vein

comment: Found in a spikelet of Poaceae. Sometimes the awn is a continuation of the bearing structure's central primary vein.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is a slender, more or less straight and stiff, fine-pointed, terminal or subterminal appendage of a glume, lemma, or palea." [FNA:glossary]
PO:0025349.name: awn

def: "An awn that is part of a palea." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025350.name: palea awn

def: "An awn that is part of a glume." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025351.name: glume awn

comment: Found in cacti and other succulents. The upper part of a leaf from which a tubercle develops is usually shed early in development. Tubercles are often conical, but they may merge with those directly above and below to form ribs, as in saguaro (Carnegiea), or they may elongate, as in species of pincushion cacti (Mammillaria). In species with tubercles, the areole bud (PO:0025353) is often found at the distal end of the tubercle. The areole bud originates in the leaf axil (PO:0009023) of the leaf that becomes the tubercle, but is displaced to the tip through elongation of the tubercle.
def: "An enlarged leaf base (PO:0020040) that is fused with adjacent shoot axis (PO:0025029) tissue." [ISBN:9780881928501, JSTOR:3093870]
PO:0025352.name: tubercle

comment: Found in Cactaceae. Appears as a cluster of spine leaves (PO:0025173). May be covered in trichomes (PO:0000282). In species with tubercles (PO:0025352), the areole bud is often found at the distal end of the tubercle. The areole bud originates in a leaf axil (PO:0009023) of a leaf that becomes a tubercle but is displaced to the tip of a tubercle through elongation of the tubercle.
def: "An axillary vegetative bud (PO:0004712) that is not elongated, in which the vascular leaves (PO:0009025) develop as spine leaves (PO:0025173)." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025353.name: areole bud

comment: Has an increased surface area for photosynthesis and may function similar to leaves in plants that have no or small leaves, such as cacti. Consists of one to several internodes and nodes. Cladodes bear scale leaves (or leaf scars where temporary leaves have fallen off) that subtend axillary buds.
def: "A shoot axis that is flattened and expanded." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025354.name: cladode

comment: May serve as a storage or perennating organ. Usually underground. A corm differs from a bulb (PO:0025356) in that it does not have fleshy leaves or leaf bases but usually has scale leaves or remnants of dry leaf sheaths that form a protective covering around it. May bear remnants or scars of detached leaves. Adventitious roots may develop from the base of a corm, and these may be contractile, pulling the corm into the soil. Examples include Gladiolus and Crocus. The pseudobulb of an orchid is equivalent to a corm. A corm is very similar to a rhizome (PO:0004542) with very short sympodial units, although not all corms have sympodial growth.
def: "A shoot system (PO:0009006) that has as parts a short, enlarged stem (PO:0009047) in which the shoot internodes (PO:0005005) do not elongate, and one or more buds (PO:0000055)." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025355.name: corm

comment: May serve as a storage and/or perennating organ. Usually underground. A bulb differs from a corm (PO:0025355) by having fleshy leaves or leaf bases. The outer leaves of a bulb are often dry and membranous, rather than fleshy. May bear adventitious roots. Examples include Alium and Tulipa. Not the same structure as a bulbil.
def: "A short, enlarged shoot system (PO:0009006) that has as parts a short stem (PO:0009047) in which the shoot internodes (PO:0005005) do not elongate, and one or more buds (PO:0000055) enclosed by fleshy leaves (PO:0009025) or leaf bases (PO:0020040)." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025356.name: bulb

comment: Pneumatophores are found in trees that live in flooded habitats such as mangroves and often have many lenticels. May provide oxygen to below ground roots growing in flooded soils. Sometime prop roots (PO:0000044) may act as breathing roots. In that case, the annotation should go to PO:0000044, whereas this term should be used for breathing roots arising at or below the soil or water surface. Knee roots are a type of pneumatophore in which the lateral root first grows upward, then turns and grows back down into the substrate, forming a knee-like bend.
def: "A lateral root that is erect and protrudes above the soil or water." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025357.name: pneumatophore

comment: Found in some palms and other species growing in flooded habitats. Pneumatorhiza appear as small outgrowths on the surface of a prop root. Similar, but distinct from, pneumatophores.
def: "A small lateral root that grows from a prop root and has a mealy surface texture." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025358.name: pneumatorhiza

def: "A collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007) on the surface of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025) that has as part a cluster of two or more adjacent sporangia PO:0025094)." [PO_REF:00001]
PO:0025359.name: sorus

def: "A collective plant organ structure (PO:0025007) on the surface of a vascular leaf that has as parts two or more fused sori (PO:0025359)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025360.name: ceonosorus

comment: Aids plant in climbing. A leaf tendril will usually have a bud or shoot axis in its axil. See also leaflet tendril (PO:0025362), leaf apex tendril (PO:0025363), branch tendril (PO:0025364), stem apex tendril (PO:0025365), leaf rachis tendril (PO:0025366), and prophyll tendril (PO:0025367). Careful observation is required to correctly classify some tendrils.
def: "A vascular leaf that is slender and coiling and lacks a lamina." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025361.name: leaf tendril

comment: Aids plant in climbing. If the tendril is derived from the terminal leaflet, use this term instead of leaf apex tendril (PO:xxxx). See also leaf tendril (PO:0025361), leaf apex tendril (PO:0025363), branch tendril (PO:0025364), stem apex tendril (PO:0025365), leaf rachis tendril (PO:0025366), and prophyll tendril (PO:0025367).  Careful observation is required to correctly classify some tendrils.
def: "A leaflet that is slender and coiling and lacks a lamina." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025362.name: leaflet tendril

comment: Aids plant in climbing. Found at the apex of a leaf lamina, but the leaf apex tendril is not laminar or it may be a narrow lamina. If the tendril is derived from the terminal leaflet, use the term leaflet tendril (PO:0025362). See also leaf tendril (PO:0025361), leaflet tendril (PO:0025362), branch tendril (PO:0025364), stem apex tendril (PO:0025365), leaf rachis tendril (PO:0025366), and prophyll tendril (PO:0025367). Careful observation is required to correctly classify some tendrils.
def: "A leaf apex of a laminar vascular leaf that is slender and coiling." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025363.name: leaf apex tendril
synonym: "&#225pice en zarzillo de la hoja   (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Aids plant in climbing. A branch tendril will usually be subtended by a leaf or leaf scar. May be branched, may have adhesive disks at its distal end, may be woody, and may bear small leaves. See also leaf tendril (PO:0025361), leaflet tendril (PO:0025362), leaf apex tendril (PO:0025363), stem apex tendril (PO:0025365), leaf rachis tendril (PO:0025366), and prophyll tendril (PO:0025367). Careful observation is required to correctly classify some\ntendrils.
def: "A branch that is slender and coiling." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025364.name: branch tendril

comment: Aids plant in climbing. May be branched, may have adhesive disks at its distal end, may be woody, and may bear small leaves. A stem apex tendril differs from a branch tendril in that it arises from the shoot apical meristem, rather than in an axil. However, a shoot apex tendril may arise either from the apex itself, in which case it is terminal, or from the side of an apical meristem, in which case it is a lateral structure. In the latter case, the main stem of the plant undergoes sympodial growth. A stem apex tendril is often located on the opposite side of a stem from a leaf at the same node, as in Vitaceae. See also leaf tendril (PO:0025361), leaflet tendril (PO:0025362), leaf apex tendril (PO:0025363), branch tendril (PO:0025364),  leaf rachis tendril (PO:0025366), and prophyll tendril (PO:0025365). Careful observation is required to correctly classify some tendrils.
def: "A shoot axis that arises from the apical part of a stem and is slender and coiling." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025365.name: stem apex tendril
synonym: "&#225pice en zarzillo del tallo (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Aids plant in climbing. Differs from a leaf tendril, in that a leaf rachis tendril bear leaflets. See also leaf tendril (PO:0025361), leaflet tendril (PO:0025362), leaf apex tendril (PO:0025363), branch tendril (PO:0025364), stem apex tendril (PO:0025365), and prophyll tendril (PO:0025366). Careful observation is required to correctly classify some tendrils.
def: "A leaf rachis that is slender and coiling and lacks a lamina." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025366.name: leaf rachis tendril
synonym: "raquis en zarzillo de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Aids plant in climbing. A prophyll may be difficult to distinguish from a branch tendril, because it may be found in the axil of a leaf, but it develops from a prophyll of the axillary bud, rather than a branch. Found in Curburitaceae. See also leaf tendril (PO:0025361), leaflet tendril (PO:0025362), leaf apex tendril (PO:0025363), branch tendril (PO:0025364), stem apex tendril (PO:0025365), and leaf rachis tendril (PO:0025366). Careful observation is required to correctly classify some tendrils.
def: "A prophyll that is slender and coiling and lacks a lamina." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025367.name: prophyll tendril

def: "A plant structure development stage (PO:0009012) that has as primary participant a trichome (PO:0000282)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025368.name: trichome development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del tricoma (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Seed trichome development stage consists of the following sub stages: seed trichome initiation stage (PO:0025370), seed trichome elongation stage (PO:0025371), seed trichome secondary wall biosynthesis stage(PO:0025372) and seed trichome maturation stage (PO:0025373).
def: "A trichome development stage that has as primary participant a seed trichome." [POC:curators]
PO:0025369.name: seed trichome development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del tricoma de la semilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Refers to the GO Biological Process terms seed trichome initiation (GO:0090377) and seed trichome elongation (GO:0090378).
def: "A seed trichome development stage which occurs during the interval between the onset of seed trichome initiation and the onset of seed trichome elongation." [POC:curators]
PO:0025370.name: seed trichome initiation stage
synonym: "etapa de iniciaci&#243n del tricoma de la semilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Refers to the GO Biological Process terms: seed trichome elongation (GO:0090378) and secondary cell wall biogenesis involved in seed trichome differentiation (GO:0090379).
def: "A seed trichome development stage which occurs during the interval between the onset of seed trichome elongation and the onset of seed trichome secondary wall biosynthesis." [POC:curators]
PO:0025371.name: seed trichome elongation stage
synonym: "etapa de elongaci&#243n del tricoma de la semilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Refers to the GO Biological Process terms: secondary cell wall biogenesis involved in seed trichome differentiation (GO:0090379) and seed trichome maturation (GO:0090380).
def: "A seed trichome development stage which occurs during the interval between the onset of seed trichome secondary wall biosynthesis and the onset of seed trichome maturation." [POC:curators]
PO:0025372.name: seed trichome secondary wall biosynthesis stage
synonym: "etapa de bios&#237ntesis de la pared secundaria del tricoma de la semilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]
"seed hair secondary wall biosynthesis stage" EXACT []

comment: Refers to the GO Biological Process term: seed trichome maturation (GO:0090380).
def: "A seed trichome development stage which encompasses the process of seed trichome maturation." [POC:curators]
PO:0025373.name: seed trichome maturation stage
synonym: "etapa de maduraci&#n del tricoma de la semilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A seed dormancy process (GO:0010162) is a dormancy process in which dormancy (sometimes called a dormant state) is induced, maintained or broken in a seed. Seed dormancy is a suspension of most physiological activity and growth in a seed, including the embryo contained therein, that can be reactivated. It often requires special conditions for reactivation, such as specific temperature, scarification, or leaching of inhibitors. Seed dormancy includes dormancy of the embryo and the seed coat, although\nthese may not begin or end simultaneously. Not all seeds go through a seed dormant stage. Most seeds that go through a dormant stage do so only one time.
def: "A seed development stage (PO:0001170) during which a seed (PO:0009010) participates in a seed dormancy process (GO:0010162)." [GO:0010162, POC:curators]
PO:0025374.name: seed dormant stage
relationship: has_part PO:0025377 ! plant embryo dormant stage
synonym: "etapa latente de la semilla (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Includes the stage when a megaspore is present before it develops into a megagametophyte or embryo sac and the stage when a microspore is present before it develops into a microgametophyte or pollen. There may be cell division in a spore before it germinates.
def: "A gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) that occurs during the interval between meiosis and the germination of a spore." [POC:curators]
PO:0025375.name: plant spore stage
synonym: "etapa esporof&#237tica de la planta (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A dormancy process (GO:0022611) is a developmental process in which dormancy (sometimes called a dormant state) is induced, maintained or broken. Dormancy is a suspension of most physiological activity and growth that can be reactivated.
def: "A gametophyte dormant stage during which a spore participates in a dormancy process." [GO:0022611, POC:curators]
PO:0025376.name: plant spore dormant stage
synonym: "etapa latente esporof&#237tica de la planta (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: During a plant embryo dormant stage, a plant embryo participates in a dormancy process, but not all plant embryos have a dormant stage. A dormancy process (GO:0022611) is a developmental process in which dormancy (sometimes called a dormant state) is induced, maintained or broken. Dormancy is a suspension of most physiological activity and growth that can be reactivated. In seed plants, a plant embryo dormant stage may be part of a seed dormant stage.
def: "A mature plant embryo stage (PO:0001081) during the interval between when a plant embryo (PO:0009009) begins a dormancy process (GO:0022611) and one of the following: the beginning of the seed germination stage (PO:0007057) in seed plants, formation of the first vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in pteridophytes, the beginning of development of a sporangium (PO:0025094) in bryophytes, or the beginning of the formation of a plant organ (PO:0009008) such as a root (PO:0009005), shoot axis (PO:0025029), or vascular leaf (PO:0009025) in a cultured plant embryo (PO:0000010)." [GO:0022611, POC:curators]
PO:0025377.name: plant embryo dormant stage

comment: Generally larger than a caruncle and not hard.
def: "An arilloid that is an elaborate outgrowth of a seed at the micropylar end." [ISBN:9780881928501]
PO:0025378.name: arillode

comment: Often part of a mesophyll (PO:0006070). This term does not include spaces on the surface of a plant structure, like a stomatal pore (PO:0008032), stomium (PO:0020101), or micropyle (PO:0020025), nor larger cavities or canals that are surrounded by tissue, such as an archegonium neck canal (PO:0030066). May be filled with air or fluid.
def: "A plant anatomical space that is part of a portion of plant tissue between two or more cells." [POC:curators]
PO:0025379.name: intercellular space
relationship: part_of PO:0009007 ! portion of plant tissue

comment: Includes the air spaces in the spongy mesophyll (PO:0005647), the palisade mesophyll (PO:0005648) and substomatal cavity (PO:0025382).
def: "An intercellular space that is part of a leaf mesophyll." [POC:curators]
PO:0025380.name: leaf mesophyll intercellular space
synonym: "espacio intercelular en el mes&#243filo de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A leaf mesophyll intercellular space that is part of a spongy mesophyll." [POC:curators]
PO:0025381.name: spongy mesophyll intercellular space
synonym: "espacio intercelular en el mes&#243filo esponjoso de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "An intercellular space that is located directly below and contiguous with a stomatal pore." [POC:curators]
PO:0025382.name: substomatal cavity

comment: Can be angular or rounded.
def: "A plant anatomical space that is a phyllome marginal embayment, incision or indentation between marginal projections of any sort, typically lobes, teeth, or the base of cordate phyllomes." [ISBN:978080144, POC:curators]
PO:0025383.name: phyllome sinus

comment: Can be angular or rounded.
def: "A phyllome sinus that is a marginal embayment, incision or indentation between marginal projections of any sort, typically lobes, teeth, or the base of cordate leaves." [ISBN:978080144, POC:curators]
PO:0025384.name: leaf sinus

comment: Cutin is the insoluble, covalently cross-linked polymer that forms an electron dense layer over the epidermal cells (PO:0004013) of an aerial plant structure.
def: "A portion of plant substance (PO:0025161) that is the inner layer of a plant cuticle (PO:0000022), and is composed of a polyester matrix of hydroxy- and hydroxy epoxy fatty acid C16 and C18 chains." [PMID:12467640, POC:curators]
PO:0025385.name: cutin

comment: Also includes triterpenoids and minor secondary metabolites, such as sterols and flavonoids. May be embedded within or external to the layer of cutin of the cuticle proper.  Phenotypically, wax is distinguished as the glaucous or whitish bloom on a part of a plant shoot system that corresponds to crystalloid epicuticular wax with light scattering capacity.
def: "A portion of plant substance (PO:0025161) comprised predominantly of very long chain aliphatic lipids and is part of a plant cuticle (PO:0000022)." [PMID:12467640, PO_Ref:00010]
PO:0025386.name: cuticular wax

def: "A portion of plant substance (PO:0025161) that is the inner layer of a plant cuticle (PO:0000022), composed primarily of cutin (PO:0025385), embedded and overlayed with cuticular wax (PO:0025386)." [PMID:12467640, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025387.name: plant cuticle proper
synonym: "cut&#237cula propia de la planta (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Epicuticular waxes may take a variety of forms, such as plates, ribbons, tubes, and rods.
def: "A portion of cuticular wax (PO:0025386) that forms crystalloids or a smooth film on the exterior of a plant cuticle (PO:0000022)." [PMID:12467640, PO_REF:00010, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025388.name: epicuticular wax

comment: The intercuticular wax is located adjacent to the cell wall.
def: "A portion of cuticular wax (PO:0025386) that is an amorphous mixture of lipids embedded in the cutin (PO:0025385) of a plant cuticle proper (PO:0025387)." [PMID:12467640, PO_REF:00010, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025389.name: intercuticular wax

comment: May be branched or simple. May be found inside a lamina areole. Usually used with third order or higher veins. If vein order is known, an additional annotation should be place on secondary vein (PO:0020140), tertiary vein (PO:0008021), quaternary vein (PO:0008022), or higher order vein (PO:0008023).
def: "A leaf lamina vein (PO:0020138) above the first order that is connected to another vein only at one end." [ISBN:9780801475184]
PO:0025390.name: free ending veinlet

comment: Any order of phyllome lamina vein can form the sides of a phyllome lamina areole. Taken together, the phyllome lamina areoles form a contiguous field of polygons over the area of a phyllome lamina.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is part of a phyllome lamina (PO:0025396) and is completely surrounded by phyllome lamina veins (PO:0025348) and cannot be divided into any smaller parts that are completely surrounded by phyllome lamina veins." [ISBN:9780801475184]
PO:0025391.name: phyllome lamina areole

comment: Any order of leaf lamina vein can form the sides of a leaf lamina areole. Taken together, the leaf lamina areoles form a contiguous field of polygons over the area of a leaf lamina. Free ending veinlets (PO:0025390) may be found within a leaf lamina areole.
def: "A phyllome lamina areole (PO:0025391) that is part of a leaf lamina (PO:0020039) and is completely surrounded by leaf lamina veins (PO:0020138) and cannot be divided into any smaller parts that are completely surrounded by leaf lamina veins." [ISBN:9780801475184]
PO:0025392.name: leaf lamina areole
synonym: "areola de la l&#225mina foliar (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Found in flowers and fruits (cypsela) of the Asteraceae. May aid in dispersal by wind or animals. Considered by some to be an evolutionarily modified upper calyx portion, the lower portion having been incorporated into the floral tube casing adnate to the ovary wall; considered by others to be an outgrowth from the ovary wall.
def: "A collective organ part structure that has a parts one or more pappus elements (scales, awns, or bristles) at the apex of an inferior ovary just beneath or outside the corolla." [FNA:glossary, ISBN:0964022168]
PO:0025393.name: pappus

comment: May be awn-, scale-, or bristle-shaped.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is a segment of a pappus." [FNA:glossary, ISBN:0964022168]
PO:0025394.name: pappus element

comment: Includes phyllomes such as anthers and petals, as well as shoot axes such as androphores and gynophores.
def: "A plant organ (PO:0009008) that is part of a flower (PO:0009046)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025395.name: floral organ

def: "An organ lamina (PO:0025513) that is part of a phyllome (PO:0006001)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025396.name: phyllome lamina

def: "A leaf mesophyll intercellular space that is part of a palisade mesophyll." [POC:curators]
PO:0025397.name: palisade mesophyll intercellular space
synonym: "espacio intercelular del mes&#243filo en palisada (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A substomatal cavity that is part of a phyllome." [POC:curators]
PO:0025398.name: phyllome substomatal cavity
synonym: "Ã£ÂÂÃ£ÂÂ£Ã£ÂÂ­Ã£ÂÂ Ã¦Â°ÂÃ¥Â­ÂÃ¤Â¸ÂÃ¨ÂÂÃ£ÂÂÃ£ÂÂÃ£ÂÂ£Ã£ÂÂ­Ã£ÂÂ Ã¥ÂÂ¼Ã¥ÂÂ¸Ã¨ÂÂ (Japanese)" EXACT Japanese [NIG:Yukiko_Yamazaki]

def: "A phyllome substomatal cavity that is part of a leaf mesophyll." [POC:curators]
PO:0025399.name: leaf substomatal cavity
synonym: "cavidad subestom&#225tica de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Contributes to the thickness of a phyllome (PO:0006001). There are two types of adaxial meristems. In phyllomes with a petiole (PO:0020038) and lamina (PO:0025060), an adaxial rounding meristem occurs later in development, is separated from the apical meristem (PO:0020144), and contributes to the thickness of the petiole and midrib. In unifacial phyllomes, the an adaxial meristem occurs earlier in development, is close to but separate from the apical meristem, and contributes to the thickness and cross-sectional shape of the entire phyllome. If annotating to a leaf, use the more specific term leaf adaxial meristem (PO:0025401).
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is found on the adaxial side of a developing phyllome (PO:0006001)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025400.name: phyllome adaxial meristem

comment: Contributes to the thickness of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025). There are two types of adaxial meristems. In leaves with a petiole (PO:0020038) and lamina (PO:0025060), such as Arabidopsis thaliana, an adaxial rounding meristem occurs later in development, is separated from the apical meristem (PO:0020144), and contributes to the thickness of the petiole and midrib. In unifacial leaves, the an adaxial unifacial meristem occurs earlier in development, is close to but separate from the apical meristem, and contributes to the thickness and cross-sectional shape of the entire leaf.
def: "A portion of phyllome adaxial meristem (PO:0025400) tissue that is found on the adaxial side of a developing vascular leaf (PO:0009025)." [ISBN:0521288959, POC:curators]
PO:0025401.name: vascular leaf adaxial meristem

comment: Contributes to the thickness of a phyllome (PO:0006001). There are two types of adaxial meristems. In phyllomes with a petiole (PO:0020038) and lamina (PO:0025060), an adaxial rounding meristem occurs later in development, is separated from the apical meristem (PO:0020144), and contributes to the thickness of the petiole and midrib. In unifacial phyllomes, the an adaxial meristem occurs earlier in development, is close to but separate from the apical meristem, and contributes to the thickness and cross-sectional shape of the entire phyllome. If annotating to a leaf, use the more specific term leaf abaxial meristem (PO:0025403).
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is found on the abaxial side of a developing phyllome (PO:0006001)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025402.name: phyllome abaxial meristem

comment: Contributes to the thickness of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025). There are two types of abaxial meristems. In leaves with a petiole (PO:0020038) and lamina (PO:0025060), such as Arabidopsis thaliana, an abaxial rounding meristem occurs later in development, is separated from the apical meristem (PO:0020144), and contributes to the thickness of the petiole and midrib. In unifacial leaves, the abaxial unifacial meristem occurs earlier in development, is close to but separate from the apical meristem, and contributes to the thickness and cross-sectional shape of the entire leaf.
def: "A portion of phyllome abaxial meristem (PO:0025402) tissue that is found on the abaxial side of a developing vascular leaf (PO:0009025)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025403.name: vascular leaf abaxial meristem

comment: Phyllome marginal meristems may develop on the lateral margins of a phyllome after the transition from a phyllome primordium (PO:0025128) and may contribute to expansion of the phyllome lamina (PO:0025396). Marginal growth can occur in a phyllome primordium, but it is not considered part of a phyllome marginal meristem. Phyllome marginal initials may give rise to phyllome epidermis (PO:0025157) while phyllome submarginal initials may give rise to the mesophyll (PO:0006070). May be of limited duration.
def: "A portion of meristem (PO:0009013) tissue that is part of a phyllome margin (PO:0025018) of an expanding phyllome (PO:0006001) and has as parts marginal and submarginal initials." [POC:curators]
PO:0025404.name: phyllome marginal meristem

comment: Leaf marginal meristems develop on the lateral margins of a vascular leaf after the transition from a vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017) and may contribute to expansion of the leaf lamina (PO:0020039). Marginal growth can occur in a vascular leaf primordium, but it is not considered part of a leaf marginal meristem. Leaf marginal initials (add) may give rise to leaf epidermis (PO:0006016) while leaf submarginal initials (add) may give rise to the leaf mesophyll (PO:0005645). May be of limited duration.
def: "A portion of phyllome marginal meristem (PO:0025404) tissue that is part of a leaf margin (PO:0025009) of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025) during a leaf expansion stage (PO:0001052) and has parts marginal and submarginal initials." [ISBN:0521288959, POC:curators]
PO:0025405.name: leaf marginal meristem
relationship: participates_in PO:0001052 ! vascular leaf expansion stage

comment: Sieve elements function mainly in longitudinal conduction of organic solutes. Classified into sieve cells (PO:0025415) and sieve tube elements (PO:0000289) based on the presence of sieve plates and specialization of sieve areas in different parts of the cell. Develops from either a cambial initial (PO:0000295), a phloem mother cell (PO:0000400), or a cell of the procambium (PO:0025275).
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is part of a portion of phloem tissue (PO:0005417), has sieve areas in its walls, and lacks a nucleus in its mature protoplast." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025406.name: sieve element

comment: May or may not have lignin in the secondary cell wall (GO:0009531) or a living protoplast at maturity. It may be difficult to distinguish fiber cells from tracheary elements (PO:0000290). Compare with sclerid cells (PO:0025418), which are usually not elongated.
def: "A sclerenchyma cell (PO:0000077) that is elongated and tapering." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025407.name: plant fiber cell

comment: Forms as part of primary growth (GO term for primary growth has been requested).
def: "A portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015) that develops from a procambium (PO:0025275)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025408.name: primary vascular tissue

comment: Forms as part of secondary growth (GO:0080117) in vascular plants. Often differentiated into the axial system (PO:0025410) and ray system (PO:0025411).
def: "A portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015) that develops from a vascular cambium (PO:0005598)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025409.name: secondary vascular tissue

comment: Includes portions of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) and axial wood parenchyma (PO:0004533).
def: "A portion of secondary vascular tissue (PO:0025409) that has as parts cells derived from fusiform initials (PO:0000079) and oriented with their longest diameter parallel to a plant axis (PO:0025004)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025410.name: axial system

comment: May include ray tracheids, as in Pinaceae and some Cupressaceae.
def: "A portion of secondary vascular tissue (PO:0025409) that has as part ray wood parenchyma (PO:0004534) and extends radially in the secondary xylem (PO:0005848) and secondary phloem (PO:0005848) of a plant axis (PO:0025004)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025411.name: ray system

comment: May be found in the ray system (PO:0025411) and sometimes the axial system (PO:0025410) of gymnosperms. Compare to companion cells (PO:0000071), which are found in angiosperms.
def: "A parenchyma cell (PO:0000074) that is morphologically and physiologically associated with a sieve cell (PO:0025415) but does is not derived from the same initial cell (PO:0004011) as the sieve cell." [ISBN:0471245208, POC:curators]
PO:0025412.name: albuminous cell

comment: Generally the largest and most prominent of the leaf veins. A leaf may have more than one primary vein. The central primary vein is the midvein (PO:0020139). Vein orders only apply to hierarchically branching vein patterns, not to dichotomously branching vein patterns, as found in some ferns and gymnosperms.
def: "A leaf lamina vein (PO:0020138) that connects directly to a petiole vascular system (PO:0000052) or a shoot axis vascular system (PO:0000039)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025413.name: primary leaf vein
synonym: "vena primaria de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Contributes mainly to formation of the body of a stem (PO:0009047), but may also produce adventitious (shoot-borne) roots (PO:0000042) and may also be found in the roots (PO:0009005) of some species. May be continuous or discontinuous with the primary thickening meristem (PO:0005039). Found in some monocot species of the Liliales and Asperigales.
def: "A lateral meristem (PO:0020145) that is not contiguous with an apical meristem (PO:0020144) and has a parts multiple layers of meristematic cells (PO:0004010)." [ISBN:0080374903, JSTOR:2471543, JSTOR:4354165]
PO:0025414.name: secondary thickening meristem

comment: Sieve areas in sieve cells generally have narrow pores and thin connecting strands, and they are not highly specialized, but instead are fairly uniform throughout the cell wall. Typical of gymnosperms and non-seed vascular plants such as ferns. Differ from sieve tube elements, which have sieve plates and more pronounced specialization of sieve areas.
def: "A sieve element (PO:0025406) in which the sieve areas are not aggregated into sieve plates (GO:0097218)." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025415.name: sieve cell

comment: A sieve plate is part of a sieve tube member.
def: "A portion of phloem tissue (PO:0005417) that has as parts a series of sieve tube elements (PO:0000289) arranged end to end and interconnected through sieve plates." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025416.name: sieve tube

def: "A portion of xylem (PO:0005352) tissue that has as parts a tube-like series of vessel members (PO:0002003), the common walls of which have perforations." [ISBN:0471245194]
PO:0025417.name: xylem vessel

comment: Usually not very elongated. The lumen of a sclerid cell is occluded by the secondary cell wall.
def: "A sclerenchyma cell (PO:0000077) with many pits in the secondary cell wall." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025418.name: sclerid cell

comment: A septate fiber tracheid septum is composed of the adjacent primary cell walls of two internal cells that arise from mitosis within the septate fiber tracheid after it has formed a secondary cell wall (GO:0009531).
def: "A fiber tracheid (PO:0000355) that has as parts one or more thin internal partitions or septa." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025419.name: septate fiber tracheid

comment: A septate libriform fiber cell septum is composed of the adjacent primary cell walls of two internal cells that arise from mitosis within the septate libriform fiber cell after it has formed a secondary cell wall (GO:0009531).
def: "A libriform fiber cell (PO:0004520) that has as parts one or more thin internal partitions or septa." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025420.name: septate libriform fiber cell

comment: A septatephloem fiber cell septum is composed of the adjacent primary cell walls of two internal cells that arise from mitosis within the septate phloem fiber cell after it has formed a secondary cell wall (GO:0009531).
def: "A phloem fiber cell (PO:0004519) that has as parts one or more thin internal partitions or septa." [ISBN:0471245208]
PO:0025421.name: septate phloem fiber cell

comment: Often found in reaction wood in dicots and in some phloem fiber cells (PO:0004519), as in Linum usitatissimum. In gelatinous fiber cells, the inner layer of the cell wall is a cellulosic gelatinous-layer or G-layer, which may be relatively porous and less compact than the outer layers of the cell wall and may absorb water and swell.
def: "A xylem fiber cell (PO:0000274) in which the inner-most layer of the secondary cell wall (GO:0009531) contains abundant cellulose and is poor in lignin." [ISBN:0080374903, PMID:21596948]
PO:0025422.name: gelatinous fiber cell

def: "A plant structure development stage (PO:0009012) that has as primary participant a portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025423.name: plant tissue development stage
relationship: has_participant PO:0009007 ! portion of plant tissue
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo de tejido vegetal (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A plant tissue development stage (PO:0025423) that has as primary participant a portion of vascular tissue (PO:0009015)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025424.name: vascular tissue development stage
relationship: has_participant PO:0009015 ! portion of vascular tissue
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del tejido vascular (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A vascular tissue development stage (PO:0025424) that has as primary participant a portion of xylem (PO:0005352) tissue." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025425.name: xylem development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del xilema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A vascular tissue development stage (PO:0025424) that has as primary participant a portion of phloem (PO:0005417) tissue." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025426.name: phloem development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del floema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: During a secondary xylem development stage (also called a wood development stage), the cells of secondary xylem (PO:0005848), including tracheary elements (PO:0000290), xylem fiber cells (PO:0000274), and wood parenchyma cells (PO:0004525) undergo cellular developmental processes (GO:0048869) such as cell division (GO:0051301), cell growth (GO:0016049), cell differentiation (GO:0030154), or cell death (GO:0008219). The transition from sapwood to heartwood marks the end of the secondary xylem development stage.
def: "A xylem development stage (PO:0025425) that has as primary participant a portion of secondary xylem (PO:0005848) tissue during the interval between the beginning of a cell division stage of secondary xylem (PO:0025463) and the death of the last living cell in the secondary xylem." [POC:wood_curators]
PO:0025427.name: secondary xylem development stage
synonym: "etapa de desarrollo del xilema secundario (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The activity of a phyllome plate meristem results in increase in the surface area, but not thickness of a phyllome.
def: "A portion of meristem (PO:0009013) tissue in which the planes of cell division in each layer are anticlinal to the surface of the phyllome (PO:0006001)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025428.name: phyllome plate meristem
synonym: "meristema en placa del filoma (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The activity of a leaf plate meristem results in increase in the surface area, but not thickness of a vascular leaf (PO:0009025).
def: "A phyllome plate meristem (PO:0025428) in the vascular leaf (PO:0009025)." [ISBN:0521288959, POC:curators]
PO:0025429.name: leaf plate meristem
relationship: participates_in PO:0001052 ! vascular leaf expansion stage
synonym: "meristema en placa de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The phyllome anlagen is only detectable by gene expression, not morphology.
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is part of a peripheral zone (PO:0000225) of a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and will give rise to a phyllome primordium (PO:0025128)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025430.name: phyllome anlagen

comment: This is the region where you have the maximum concentration of auxin in the SAM (at least in a few species that have been studied).
def: "A phyllome anlagen (PO:0025430) that will give rise to a vascular leaf primordium (PO:0000017) and is part of a peripheral zone (PO:0000225) of a shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148)." [PMID:14732442, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025431.name: vascular leaf anlagen
relationship: part_of PO:0008016 ! vegetative shoot apical meristem

def: "A phyllome anlagen (PO:0025430) that will give rise to a cotyledon primordium (PO:0000015) and is part of a peripheral zone (PO:000225) of an embryo shoot apical meristem (PO:0006362)." [POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0025233 ! portion of embryo plant tissue
PO:0025432.name: cotyledon anlagen

comment: Only detectable by gene expression, not morphology. May arise in a pericycle (PO:0006203), as for lateral roots in most seed plants, an endodermis (PO:0000252), as for lateral roots in ferns, or from parenchyma cells (PO:0000074) that are part a shoot axis (PO:0025029), in the case of a basal root (PO:0025002) or shoot-borne root (PO:0000042).
def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that is committed to the development of a root primordium (PO:0005029)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025433.name: root anlagen

def: "A vascular bundle (PO:0005020) that is part of a petiole vascular system (PO:0000052)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025434.name: petiole vascular bundle

def: "A cork cambium (PO:0005599) that is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025435.name: shoot axis cork cambium

PO:0025436.name: root cork cambium
synonym: "cambium suber&#237geno de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A vascular cambium (PO:0005598) that is part of a shoot axis (PO:0025029)." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0025437.name: shoot axis vascular cambium
synonym: "cambium vascular del eje del epiblasto (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

PO:0025438.name: root vascular cambium
synonym: "cambium vascular de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The cambial zone generally consists of the initial cells of the cambium and their immediate derivatives, arranged in radial files. This term is used for the cambium (PO:0005597) and surrounding area, especially when the borders of the cambium are not clear.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is part of a plant axis (PO:0025004) and has as parts a cambium (PO:0005597) and adjacent cells." [POC:curators]

comment: Includes a cambium (PO:0005597) and adjacent cells. This term is used when the borders of the cambium are not clear.

synonym: "zona cambial de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

PO:0025443.name: root secondary thickening meristem
