comment: In a given portion of primary xylem (PO:0005849), metaxylem tracheary elements are generally larger in size, greater in number, are pitted and have more secondary wall material than protoxylem tracheary elements (PO:0025575).
def: "A primary xylem tracheary element (PO:0025444) that may have helical, scalariform, reticulate and/or pitted secondary wall thickening." [ISBN:0471738433, POC:Laura_Moore]
PO:0025576.name: metaxylem tracheary element
synonym: "elemento de traqueida del metaxilema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A flower bract (PO:0009034) that is part of the epicalyx (PO:0009063)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025577.name: epicalyx bract

def: "A collective plant organ stucture development stage (PO:0025338) that has as primary participant collective phyllome structure (PO:0025023)." [POC:Laura_Moore]
is_a: PO:0025338 ! collective plant organ structure development stage
PO:0025578.name: collective phyllome structure development stage
synonym: "estado de desarrollo de la estructura colectiva del filoma (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A plant organ development stage (PO:0025339) that has a primary participant a phyllome (PO:0025023)." [POC:Laura_Moore, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025579.name: phyllome development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0025527 ! shoot system development stage
synonym: "estado de desarrollo del filoma (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The petals (PO:0009032), sepals (PO:0009031) and tepals (PO:0009033) may be fused anywhere along the phyllome margin (PO:0025018). In some cases where the calyx (PO:0009060) and corolla (PO:0009060) are fused at the base it is referred to as a perianth tube.
def: "A perianth (PO:0009058) in which one or more of the petals (PO:0009032), sepals (PO:0009031), and/or tepals (PO:0009033) are fused (PATO:0000642)." [ISBN:9781842464229, PATO:0000642, POC:curators]
PO:0025580.name: fused perianth

def: "A corolla (PO:0009059) that is composed of fused petals (PO:0025583)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025581.name: fused corolla

def: "A calyx (PO:0009060) that is composed of fused sepals (PO:0025584)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025582.name: fused calyx

comment: In fused perianth (PO:0025580), the fused petal (PO:0025583) may be joined to a fused sepal (PO:002569) or another fused petal.
def: "A petal (PO:0009032) that is part of a fused corolla (PO:0025581) or a fused perianth (PO:0025580)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025583.name: fused petal

def: "A sepal (PO:0009031) that is part of the fused calyx (PO:0025582) or a fused perianth (PO:0025580)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025584.name: fused sepal

comment: During this stage, the process of floral organ development (GO:0048437) occurs. Floral organ development is defined as the process whose specific outcome is the progression of the floral organ over time, from its formation to the mature structure.
def: "A flower development stage (PO:0007615) that occurs in an individual flower (PO:000904) during the interval between the onset of a floral organ meristem development stage (PO:0007601) and the onset of a flowering stage (PO:0007616)." [POC:curators]
PO:0025585.name: floral organ formation stage
relationship: preceded_by PO:0025588 ! flower meristem transition stage

comment: As a group, the phyllome founder cells encompass several layers of the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and form a phyllome anlagen (PO:0025430). Founder cells do not function as stem cells but rather have a determinate fate and can be defined by histological, clonal and molecular criteria.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is part of the phyllome anlagen (PO:0025430)." [PMID:12610522, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025586.name: phyllome founder cell

comment: A free sepal (PO:0025587) only occurs in a perianth (PO:0009058) that contains fused sepals (PO:0025584) and/or fused petals (PO:0025583). If you are describing a sepal (PO:0009031) that is part of a perianth (PO:0009058) where none of the sepals (PO:0009031) and/or petals (PO:0009032) are fused, you should use sepal.
def: "A sepal (PO:0009031) that is part of a perianth (PO:0009058) that contains fused sepals (PO:0025584) and/or fused petals (PO:0025583), but is separate from the other sepals (PO:0009031) and petals (PO:0009032)." [POC:curators_test]
PO:0025587.name: free sepal

comment: During this stage, a process occurs involving a vegetative to reproductive phase transition of meristem (GO:0010228), defined as the process involved in transforming a meristem that produces vegetative structures, such as leaves, into a meristem that produces reproductive structures, such as a flower or an inflorescence.
def: "A flower development stage (PO:0007615) which begins with the transition of a portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) to a flower meristem (PO:0000229) and ends with the onset of the floral organ formation stage (PO:0025585)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025588.name: flower meristem transition stage

comment: This is the portion of the leaf lamina (PO:0020039) that is furthest away from the stem (PO:0009047).
def: "A leaf tip (PO:0025142) that is the distal portion of the leaf lamina (PO:0020039)." [POC:Brian_Atkinson]
PO:0025589.name: leaf lamina tip

def: "A portion of pith (PO:0006109) that is part of a receptacle (PO:0009064)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025590.name: receptacle pith

def: "A portion of cortex (PO:0005708) that is part of a receptacle (PO:0009064)." [POC:Laurel_Copoer]
PO:0025591.name: receptacle cortex

comment: As a group, the vascular leaf founder cells encompass several layers of the shoot apical meristem (PO:0020148) and form a vascular leaf anlagen (PO:0025431). Founder cells do not function as stem cells but rather have a determinate fate and can be defined by histological, clonal and molecular criteria. The analagen may consist of one or more founder cells.
def: "A phyllome founder cell (PO:0025586) that is part of a vascular leaf anlagen (PO:0025431)." [PMID:12610522, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025592.name: vascular leaf founder cell

def: "A shoot-borne root (PO:0000042) that arises from a shoot axis internode (PO:0005005)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025593.name: shoot-borne internode root

def: "A portion of meristem tissue (PO:0009013) that gives rise to a portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059)." [POC:curators, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025594.name: ground meristem

comment: The meristem L2 layer (PO:0009021) and meristem L3 layer (PO:0009021) of the are part of the shoot system ground meristem (PO:0025595).
def: "A ground meristem (PO:0025594) that gives rise to a portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) in the shoot system (PO:0009006)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025595.name: shoot system ground meristem

def: "A ground meristem (PO:0025594) that gives rise to a portion of ground tissue (PO:0025059) in the root system (PO:0025025)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025596.name: root system ground meristem

def: "An infructescence (PO:0006342) in Zea species that bears kernels (i.e. fruit; PO:0009001) on a compact infructescence axis (PO:0025242) and develops from the ear inflorescence (PO:0020136)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025597.name: ear infructescence

def: "An inflorescence (PO:0009049) that includes as part only pistillate flowers (PO:0025599)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025598.name: pistillate inflorescence

def: "A flower (PO:0009046) that includes as part a single carpel (PO:0009030) or a gynoecium (PO:0009062), but the androecium (PO:0009061) is absent or has aborted during development." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025599.name: pistillate flower

def: "A flower (PO:0009046) that includes as part an androecium (PO:0009061), and the gynoecium (PO:0009062) is absent or has aborted during development." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025600.name: staminate flower

def: "An inflorescence (PO:0009049) that includes as part only staminate flowers (PO:0025600)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025601.name: staminate inflorescence

def: "A gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) during which a microgametophyte (PO:0025280) develops." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025602.name: microgametophyte development stage

comment: Plant resins are often produced by Gymnosperms but not restricted to those plants. In the conifers, plant resins are constitutively and inducibly produced through the secretory activity of resin cells (PO:0025604), and can be exuded through a resin canal (PO:0005665) to a site of injury or predator attack.
def: "A portion of plant substance (PO:0025161) that consists of a complex mixture of organic aromatic compounds such as mono-, sesqui-, and diterpenoids." [PMID:11337413, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025603.name: plant resin

def: "An epidermal cell (PO:0004013) that secretes plant resin (PO:0025603), and may line resin canals (PO:0005665) and/or be associated with resin blisters (or cysts)." [PMID:11337413, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025604.name: resin cell

def: "An abscission zone (PO:0000146) that forms as a swelling or joint on the fruit pedicel (PO:0004536)." [PMID:22106095, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025605.name: fruit pedicel abscission zone
relationship: develops_from PO:0025608 ! flower pedicel abscission zone

comment: A native plant cell is one that is not grown or maintained in vitro, nor part of an in vitro plant structure (PO:0000004).
def: "A plant cell (PO:0009002) that is either part of a multicellular whole plant (PO:0000003) 'in vivo' or a unicellular organism 'in natura' (i.e. part of a natural environment)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025606.name: native plant cell

def: "A shoot system (PO:0009006) that has as parts only vegetative tissues and organs." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025607.name: vegetative shoot system

def: "An abscission zone (PO:0000146) that forms as a swelling or joint on the flower pedicel (PO:009052)." [PMID:24744429, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025608.name: flower pedicel abscission zone

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that forms a tough, protective outer layer on a shoot axis and includes as parts a shoot axis hypodermis (PO:0005057) and a shoot axis epidermis (PO:0000112)." [PMID:xyz, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025609.name: shoot axis tegument layer

def: "A portion of hypodermis (PO:0005051) that is part of a stem cortex (PO:0025612)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025610.name: stem hypodermis

def: "A portion of shoot axis tegument layer (PO:0025609) that a tough, protective outer layer on a stem (PO:0009047) and includes as parts a stem hypodermis (PO:0025610) and a stem epidermis (PO:0025178)." [POC:Cooperl]
PO:0025611.name: stem tegument layer

def: "A portion of shoot axis cortex (PO:0000223) that is part of a stem (PO:0009047)." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025612.name: stem cortex

comment: The petiole (PO:0020038) abcisses longitudinally and the leaf lamina (PO:0020039) withers.
def: "A petiole (PO:0020038) that is sclerified and persistent." [POC:austin_meier]
PO:0025613.name: spine petiole

def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) which is a small ball of cells born on a thallus (PO:0030027) and is involved in asexual reproduction." [ISBN:1133170323, POC:curators]
PO:0025614.name: gemma

def: "A collective leaf structure (PO:0025022) consisting of a group of rosette leaves (PO:0000014), generally borne at the base of the plant, that are separated by very short stem internodes (PO:0020142)." [POC:austin_meier, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0025615.name: rosette

comment: The life cycle of all plants is characterized by the alternation of phases (or generations). The sporophytic phase has twice the chromosome complement of the gametophytic phase.
def: "OBSOLETE. A plant growth and development phase that begins with either meiosis or fertilization." [POC:curators]
PO:0028001.name: plant life cycle phase
synonym: "fase del ciclo de vida de la plant (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A whole plant (PO:0000003) in the sporophyte development stage usually has twice the chromosome complement of a plant in the gametophytic phase, but may not in the case of apogamy. Examples of apogamy include both naturally occurring instances (such as sporophytes arising form haploid cells as in bryophytes or ferns) as well as in vitro instances (such as haploid embryo culture or in vitro fusion of non-gamete cells or protoplasts). During the sporophyte development stage, a plant may produce meiospores by meiosis.
def: "A whole plant development stage (PO:0007033) that has as primary participant a whole plant (PO:0000003) during the interval between fertilization (or apogamy) and death." [POC:curators]
PO:0028002.name: sporophyte development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0025337 ! life of whole plant stage

comment: In bryophytes and pteridophytes, a gametophytic phase may begin without meiosis by apospory. This usually occurs when damage to a plant in the sporophytic phase leads directly to the growth of a plant that is in the gametophyte development stage but bears the chromosome complement that would normally be found in the sporophyte development stage (PO:0028002). A whole plant in the gametophyte development stage usually has half the chromosome complement of a plant in the sporophyte development stage, but not in the case of apospory. A whole plant in the gametophyte development stage may cease to exist by death at any point in its development. In seed plants, the whole plant in the gametophyte development stage may cease to exists through transformation, such as when pollen (PO:0025281) releases its pollen sperm cells (PO:0025121) or when a plant embryo (PO:0009009) begins to develop within an embryo sac (PO:0025074) of an angiosperm. During the gametophytic phase, a plant may produce gametes (PO:0025006) by mitosis.
def: "A whole plant development stage (PO:0007033) that has as primary participant a whole plant (PO:0000003) during the interval between meiosis or apospory and the time that the whole plant ceases to exist." [POC:curators]
PO:0028003.name: gametophyte development stage
relationship: part_of PO:0025337 ! life of whole plant stage

comment: A chloronema cell contains many well-developed chloroplasts.
def: "A chlorenchyma cell that is part of a chloronema and has cross walls of adjacent cells that are perpendicular to the protonema axis." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030001.name: chloronema cell

comment: A caulonema cell contains fewer, less well-developed chloroplasts than a chloronema cell.
def: "A chlorenchyma cell that is part of a caulonema and has cross walls of adjacent cells that are oblique to the protonema axis." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030002.name: caulonema cell

comment: The protonema is the first structure that develops in the gametophytic phase of mosses, some other bryophytes, and leptosporangiate ferns. The term protonema is also used to refer to the phase of development in which protonemal tissue is produced (see PO:0030006 protonema phase). In some species of moss, the protonema is perennial. A protonema may develop from sporophytic tissue during apospory.
def: "A portion of chlorenchyma tissue that develops directly from a spore and grows by division of an apical cell to form filaments that are one cell wide and dichotomously branching." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030003.name: protonema

comment: Generally, the development of chloronema precedes the development of caulonema. Only the caulonema, and not the chloronema, initiates gametophore buds.
def: "A portion of protonema tissue that consists of only chloronema cells." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030004.name: chloronema

comment: Generally, the development of caulonema follows the development of chloronema. Only the caulonema, and not the chloronema, initiates gametophore buds.
def: "A portion of protonema tissue that consists of only caulonema cells." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030005.name: caulonema

comment: The protonema phase ends with the development of gametophores in mosses, some other bryophytes, and leptosporangiate ferns and with the development of a thallus in other bryophytes, although protonema tissue may persist of continue to develop after this.
def: "A gametophyte development stage during which a gametophyte undergoes filamentous growth and that succeeds spore germination and precedes a thalloid development stage (planar growth) or gametophore development stage." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030006.name: protonema whole plant development stage

comment: Apical cells occur only at the tip of a shoot axis apex, leaf apex, root apex, thallus apex, or protonema in bryophytes and some pteridophytes. Apical growth results from division of a single meristematic cell located at the tip of an apical meristem or plant organ, rather than from a population of meristematic cells located at the tip of an apical meristem. The apical cell may be tetrahedral shaped, with three (in shoots) or four (in roots) cutting faces, or wedge-shaped (lenticular) with two cutting faces (in non-vascular leaves or thalli). An apical cell may be established upon germination of a spore or upon the first cell division of an embryo, or later.
def: "A single meristematic cell (PO:0004010) at the tip of a plant structure where apical growth occurs." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030007.name: meristematic apical cell

comment: Occurs in the sporophytic phase of pteridophytes.
def: "A sporophyte meristematic apical cell that is part of a root tip." [PO_REF:00001, POC:curators]
PO:0030008.name: root meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical de la ra&#237z (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: May occur in shoot axes or leaves of bryophytes or ferns.
def: "A meristematic apical cell that is part of a shoot system." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030009.name: shoot meristematic apical cell

comment: Divides to produces leaf initial cells (if leaves are present) and other stem or branch tissues.
def: "A shoot meristematic apical cell that is part of a shoot apex." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030010.name: shoot axis meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical del eje del epiblasto (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Occurs in the non-vascular leaves of bryophytes and the vascular leaves of some ferns. Only in plants where leaf growth is apical.
def: "A shoot meristematic apical cell that is part of a leaf apex." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:curators]
PO:0030011.name: leaf meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical de la hoja (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Occurs in vascular leaves of some ferns in their sporophytic phase.
def: "A leaf meristematic apical cell that is part of the leaf apex of a vascular leaf." [PO_REF:00001, POC:curators]
PO:0030012.name: vascular leaf meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical de la hoja vascular (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Occurs in the non-vascular leaves of bryophytes, which grow by division of a single, wedge-shaped apical cell with two cutting faces.
def: "A leaf meristematic apical cell (PO:0030011) that is part of a leaf apex of a non-vascular leaf." [ISBN:0962073342, PMID:19303301]
PO:0030013.name: non-vascular leaf meristematic apical cell
relationship: develops_from PO:0030087 ! non-vascular leaf initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical de la hoja no vascular (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Occurs bryophytes and pteridophytes.
def: "An apical cell that is part of a whole plant in the gametophytic phase." [POC:curators]
PO:0030014.name: gametophyte meristematic apical cell

comment: Occurs in pteridophytes and the sporophyte of bryophytes.
def: "A meristematic apical cell that is part of a whole plant in the sporophytic phase." [POC:curators]
PO:0030015.name: sporophyte meristematic apical cell

comment: Ceases being an apical cell when the sporangium begins to develop.
def: "A shoot axis meristematic apical cell at the tip of a seta." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0030010 ! shoot axis meristematic apical cell
PO:0030016.name: seta meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical de la seta (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: May be covered by a peristome.
def: "A plant anatomical space that is the opening on the apical end of a spore capsule." [POC:curators]
PO:0030017.name: spore capsule mouth
synonym: "boca de la c&#225psula productora de esporas (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A gametophore is the leafy part of the gametophyte of mosses and leafy liverworts, excluding the protonema. Develop from buds that form on the protonema. Antheridia and archegonia arise on the gametophore.
def: "A shoot system (PO:0009006) that consists of the shoot axes (PO:0025029) and non-vascular leaves (PO:0025075) of a plant in the gametophyte development stage (PO:0028003) ." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:curators]
PO:0030018.name: gametophore

comment: Occurs in the non-vascular shoot system of the gametophyte of mosses and leafy liverworts.
def: "A shoot meristematic apical cell that is part of a gametophore." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:curators]
PO:0030019.name: gametophore meristematic apical cell

comment: Found in mosses and leafy liverworts. A stem or branch of the leafy part of a bryophyte.
def: "A shoot axis (PO:0025029) that is part of a gametophore (PO:0030018)." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:curators]
PO:0030020.name: gametophore axis

comment: A branch of the leafy part of a bryophyte shoot system.
def: "A branch that is part of a gametophore." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030021.name: gametophore branch

comment: A stem (the primary axis) of the leafy part of a bryophyte shoot system.
def: "A stem that is part of a gametophore." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030022.name: gametophore stem

comment: Occurs at the tips of the stems and branches of bryophytes.
def: "A shoot axis meristematic apical cell at the tip of a gametophore axis." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304]
is_a: PO:0030010 ! shoot axis meristematic apical cell
PO:0030023.name: gametophore axis meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical del eje del gamet&#243foro (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Occurs in some ferns in their sporophytic phase.
def: "A shoot axis meristematic apical cell at the tip of a shoot apex in a shoot system that has as part vascular tissue." [PO_REF:00001, POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0030010 ! shoot axis meristematic apical cell
PO:0030024.name: vascular shoot axis meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical del eje del epiblasto vascualr (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A gametophyte apical cell that is part of a thallus." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030025.name: thallus meristematic apical cell

comment: Occurs in mosses and leafy liverworts. Develops from a caulonema cell in mosses.
def: "A vegetative bud that develops into a gametophore." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030026.name: gametophore bud
relationship: develops_from PO:0030083 ! gametophore bud initial cell

comment: A thallus is a gametophyte of liverworts and pteridophytes and develops from a short-lived protonema. Roughly two dimensional growth results from division of a single apical cell. Thalli may be ribbon or heart shaped or almost filamentous. Although there are no distinct organs, there may be tissue differentiation and dichotomous branching.
def: "A whole plant in the gametophytic phase that has a flat growth form and no distinct organs." [PO_REF:00001]
PO:0030027.name: thallus

comment: When an antheridium occurs on a specialized lateral branch of the gametophore, all of the phyllomes on that branch are usually perigonial bracts. If an antheridium occurs on a main axis of the gametophore, usually only the terminal phyllomes are perigonial bracts.
def: "A bract (PO:0009055) that subtends an antheridium (PO:0025125)." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030028.name: perigonial bract

comment: Found in bryophytes and some pteridophytes. In mosses, the foot is located below the seta. In ferns, the foot is formed from the upper hypobasal quandrant of the embryo. The sporophyte foot serves for both attachment and absorption. The outer portion of the foot is composed of absorptive transfer cells.
def: "A plant organ that is the base of a whole plant in the sporophytic phase and attaches it to the gametophore." [ISBN:0029496608, ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030029.name: sporophyte foot

comment: When an archegonium occurs on a specialized lateral branch of the gametophore, all of the phyllomes on that branch are usually perichaetal bracts. If an archegonium occurs on a main axis of the gametophore, only the terminal phyllomes are usually perichaetal bracts. The two or three terminal-most perichaetal bracts may fuse to form a gametophytic perianth.
def: "A bract (PO:0009055) that subtends an archegonium (PO:0025126)." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030030.name: perichaetal bract

comment: The perichaetal bracts may fuse laterally in the gametophytic perianth. The gametophytic perianth is not the same structure as a perianth (PO:0009058) in angiosperms.
def: "A collective phyllome structure that consists of two or more of the most distal perichaetal bracts on a gametophore axis and surround a capsule." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030031.name: gametophyte perianth

comment: Found in some bryophytes, especially mosses and liverworts.
def: "A stalk (PO:0025066) that supports a spore capsule, the sporangium (PO:0025094)." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:curators]
PO:0030032.name: seta

comment: Found in mosses and other bryophytes such as the liverwort Marchantiales.
def: "A stalk (PO:0025066) that supports an antheridium head (PO:0030075)." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030033.name: antheridiophore

comment: Found in Marchantiales.
def: "A stalk (PO:0025066) that supports an archegonium head (PO:0030034)." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030034.name: archegoniophore

comment: The antheridium stalk raises the antheridium (PO:0025125) from the antheridium head (PO:0030075).
def: "A stalk (PO:0025066) that is the basal part of an antheridium (PO:0025125)." [ISBN:9780070588493]
PO:0030035.name: antheridium stalk

comment: Raises the venter above the rest of the gametophyte.
def: "A stalk that the basal part of an archegonium." [ISBN:9780070588493]
PO:0030036.name: archegonium stalk

comment: Found in bryophytes. The spore capsule calyptra is a membranous or hairy cap or hood, composed of gametophytic tissue (venter; PO:0030038) that protects the embryonic sporophyte within the archegonium (PO:0025126). In some species, it may persist after the sporophyte develops and gets carried upward as the seta (PO:0030032) elongates. The spore capsule calyptra is usually lost before the spores are released, and its shape can be used for identification purposes.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that develops from an archegonium (PO:0025126) and is a cap or hood enclosing the sporangium (syn: spore capsule; PO:0025094)." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030037.name: spore capsule calyptra
synonym: "caliptra de la c&#225psula productora de esporas (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: After fertilization, the venter develops into the spore capsule calyptra (PO:0030037), which protects the sporangium (syn: spore capsule; PO:0025094) containing the developing sporophyte.
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is the enlarged basal part of an archegonium (PO:0025126) and has an archegonium egg cell (PO:0025122) located in it." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030038.name: venter

comment: Early in development, the archegonium neck is occluded by a single row of neck canal cells (PO:0030065). At maturity, the neck canal cells (PO:0030065) and the ventral canal cell (PO:0025524) disintegrate, creating a archegonium neck canal (PO:0030066) for the plant sperm cells (PO:0000084) to enter the archegonium (PO:0025126).
def: "A cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is the elongated, apical part of an archegonium (PO:0025126)." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780070588493]
PO:0030039.name: archegonium neck

comment: Term used for bryophytes and pteridophytes. The sporangium base is the sterile part of the sporangium below the sporangium theca. If swollen and distinct from the rest of the sporangium, it is called an apophysis or hypophysis.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is the basal (distal) part of a sporangium." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030040.name: sporangium base

comment: Term used for bryophytes and pteridophytes.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is the main body of a sporangium and has spores located in it." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030041.name: sporangium theca

comment: The peristome is located under the operculum, if an operculum is present. Upon maturity of a capsule, the teeth of the peristome open to release the spores.
def: "A single or double circle of peristome teeth inside a sporangium mouth." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030042.name: peristome

comment: Generally triangular. Peristome teeth may be simple or compound, and may be attached by their tips to the epiphragm.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is a single lobe of a peristome." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030043.name: peristome tooth

comment: Found in mosses. May remain partly attached to the rest of the capsule.
def: "A cardinal organ part that is the apical part of a spore capsule that separates from the rest of the capsule during dehiscence." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030044.name: spore capsule operculum
synonym: "op&#233rculo de la c&#225psula productora de esporas (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Found only in bryophytes in gametophore axes, setae, or leaves. Functions in support rather than conduction. May or may not retain a living protoplast at maturity.
def: "A ground tissue cell with thickened cell walls." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:376821110]
PO:0030045.name: stereid

def: "A gametophyte meristematic apical cell that is part of a protonema." [POC:curators]
PO:0030046.name: protonema meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula meristem&#225tica apical del protonema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A hydrome is composed of only hydroids. Found in bryophytes, in the center of a non-vascular shoot axis (PO:0025029) such as a gametophore (PO:0030018) or seta (PO:0030032). Often surrounded by the leptome (PO:0030048). May function in water conduction and may provide support.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that has as parts hydroid (PO:0025032) cells and cells of no other types." [ISBN:376821110, POC:curators]
PO:0030047.name: hydrome

comment: A leptome is composed of only leptoids (PO:0025033). Found in bryophytes, in non-vascular shoot axes such as a gametophore axis or seta (PO:0030032) or in the midrib of a non-vascular leaf. Often surrounding a central hydrome. May function in the conduction of organic substances, similar to phloem in vascular plants.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that has as parts leptoid (PO:0025033) cells and cells of no other types." [ISBN:376821110]
PO:0030048.name: leptome

comment: Term used for vascular plants to describe the outermost layer of a sporangium wall that is internal to the exothecium.
def: "A portion of ground tissue PO:0025059) that is the sub-epidermal layer of a sporangium wall (PO:0025306)." [ISBN:0471244554, ISBN:9780003686647]
PO:0030049.name: sporangium wall endothecium
synonym: "endotecio de la pared del esporangio (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: A stereome is composed of only stereids. Found only in bryophytes in gametophore axes or non-vascular leaves. May function in support.
def: "A portion of ground tissue that has as parts stereid cells and no other cell types." [ISBN:376821110]
PO:0030050.name: stereome

comment: Often contains both hydrome and leptome. Found in bryophytes. The term central strand is sometimes used to describe a protostele in vascular plants, but this ontology class should only be used for non-vascular plants. Analogous to a vein or vascular bundle in vascular plants.
def: "A portion of plant tissue that is an axial strand in the center of a gametophore axis or seta and has as part a hydrome or a leptome." [ISBN:0029496608, ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030051.name: central strand

def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is part of an antheridium jacket layer (PO:0030053)." [ISBN:9780473067304, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0030052.name: antheridium jacket layer cell
synonym: "capa c&#233lular de la cubierta del anteridio (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Cells in the antheridium jacket layer surround the spermatogenous cells (PO:0025525) and do not give rise to antheridium sperm cells (PO:0025120).
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is a single layer of cells on the outside of an antheridium (PO:0025125)." [ISBN:9780473067304]
PO:0030053.name: antheridium jacket layer
synonym: "capa de la cubierta del anteridio (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Present in some moss species of the family Polytrichaceae.
def: "A portion of parenchyma tissue that forms a circular membrane extending from a spore capsule columella and attached to the ends of the peristome teeth that covers a spore capsule mouth." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030054.name: epiphragm

comment: Raises the sporophyte above the perichaetial bracts. Found in Sphagnum and Andreaea.
def: "A gametophore axis that is a leafless extension of a gametophore stem or branch on which a sporophyte is borne." [ISBN:0029496608, ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030055.name: pseudopodium

comment: May also give rise to sterile cells such as elators (in liverworts) or tapetal cells. In most species outside seed plants, multiple archesporial cells are part of an archesporium or sporogenous tissue.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that divides to gives rise to a sporocyte (PO:0006204) and is part of a sporangium (PO:0025094)." [ISBN:9780070588493, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0030056.name: archesporial cell

comment: Found in mosses. Alar cells occur in an area at the base of a leaf that may be triangular, ovate or rectangular and is sometimes called the alar region. They are different in size, shape, color, thickness, or ornamentation from other cells in the leaf.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) located at the base of a non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075) adjacent to where the leaf attaches to the stem (PO:0009047)." [ISBN:0029496608, ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0030057.name: alar cell

comment: Found in mosses. A brachycyte is a drought tolerant cell that can act as a gemma (PO:0025614) and may give rise to a new plant. Cells of a protonema (PO:0030003) may develop into brachycytes under stress. May form a chain or be separated by tmema cells (PO:0030059).
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that develops from a cell in a protonema (PO:0030003) and has a thick cell wall." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9781405181891, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0030058.name: brachycyte

comment: May be a single cell adjacent to a brachycyte (PO:0030058) or part of a portion of tmema tissue.
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) at the base of a gemma (PO:0025614) or adjacent to a brachycyte (PO:0030058) that breaks down to allow abscission of the gemma or brachycyte." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0030059.name: tmema cell

comment: Found in pleurocarpous mosses. Form in the axils of leaf primordia and may disappear when the gametophore is mature.
def: "An axillary hair that grows in a leaf axil of a non-vascular leaf." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304, POC:curators]
PO:0030060.name: gametophore axillary hair

comment: Found in bryophytes at the base of a gemma (PO:0025614). Participates in abscission of the gemma.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that has as parts tmema cells (PO:0030059)." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780473067304, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0030061.name: tmema

def: "An axillary hair terminal cell that is the long terminal cell of a gametophore axillary hair." [ISBN:9780473067304, POC:curators]
PO:0030062.name: gametophore axillary hair terminal cell
synonym: "c&#233lula terminal de pelo axilar del gamet&#243foro (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Consists of two to a dozen cells.
def: "A axillary hair base that is the basal part of a gametophore axillary hair, below the gametophore axillary hair terminal cell." [ISBN:9780473067304, POC:curators]
PO:0030063.name: gametophore axillary hair base
synonym: "base del pelo axilar del gamet&#243foro (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "An axillary hair basal cell that is part of a gametophore axillary hair base." [ISBN:9780473067304, POC:curators]
PO:0030064.name: gametophore axillary hair basal cell
relationship: part_of PO:0030063 ! gametophore axillary hair base
synonym: "c&#233lula basal del pelo axilar del gamet&#243foro (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: During archegonium development, the archegonium neck canal cells (PO:0030065) and the ventral canal cell (PO:0025524) disintegrate, creating a archegonium neck canal for the plant sperm cells (PO:0000084) to enter the archegonium (PO:0025126).
def: "A native plant cell (PO:0025606) that is one of the axial row of cells in an immature archegonium neck (PO:0030039)." [ISBN:0962073342, POC:Laurel_Cooper]
PO:0030065.name: archegonium neck canal cell
synonym: "c&#233lula del canal del cuello del arquegonio (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: During archegonium development, the archegonium neck canal cells (PO:0030065) and the ventral canal cell (PO:0025524) disintegrate, creating a archegonium neck canal for the plant sperm cells (PO:0000084) to enter the archegonium (PO:0025126).
def: "A canal (PO:0025132) in the center of an archegonium neck (PO:0030039)." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030066.name: archegonium neck canal
synonym: "canal del cuello del arquegonio (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: May give rise to a chloronema, caulonema, protonema rhizoid, tmema cell, or brachycyte.
def: "An protonema sub-apical initial that gives rise to a branch of a protonema." [ISBN:9781405181891]
PO:0030067.name: protonema side branch initial cell
synonym: "rama lateral inicial del protonema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: Part of the epidermis of a thallus or gametophore of a bryophyte or pteridophyte in the gametophytic phase or the stem of a monocot in the sporophytic phase.
def: "An epidermal initial cell (PO:0000349) that gives rise to an epidermal rhizoid (PO:0030071)." [PMID:12917289]
PO:0030068.name: epidermal rhizoid initial cell

comment: Paraphyllia are much smaller than leaves and may be filamentous, scale-like, or leaf-like. Found in pleurocarpous mosses and a few leafy liverworts.
def: "A portion of epidermal tissue that is an outgrowth from the epidermis between the leaves of a gametophore axis." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030069.name: paraphyllium

comment: Found in bryophytes and pteridophytes, especially in mosses.
def: "A slender, usually uniseriate multicellular trichome (PO:0025162) that grows intermixed with the gametangia." [ISBN:0029496608]
PO:0030070.name: paraphysis

comment: Found in bryophytes and pteridophytes growing from the epidermis of a gametophore or the lower surface of a thallus and in some monocots growing from the stem at the cotyledonary node. May be considered a type of trichome.
def: "A rhizoid (PO:0030078) that develops from an epidermal rhizoid initial cell (PO:0030068)." [ISBN:12917289]
PO:0030071.name: epidermal rhizoid
relationship: develops_from PO:0030068 ! epidermal rhizoid initial cell

comment: Found in bryophytes. Often contains both hydrome and leptome. Functions in support and conduction in a phyllid. The term costa is sometimes used for the midrib of monocot leaves, but this ontology class should only be used for non-vascular leaves.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is a single or double strand in the center of a non-vascular leaf and has as part hydrome (PO:0030047) or leptome (PO:0030048)." [ISBN:376821110]
PO:0030072.name: costa

comment: Develops from the outermost layer of an amphithecium in bryophytes.
def: "A portion of epidermis that is the outermost layer of a sporangium wall." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780003686647]
PO:0030073.name: exothecium

comment: Gives rise to sporocytes and may give rise to other sterile cells such as elators.
def: "A portion of plant tissue (PO:0009007) that is the internal part of a sporangium (PO:0025094), bounded by the sporangium wall (PO:0025306), and has as parts archesporial cells (PO:0030056)." [ISBN:8122407927, ISBN:9780003686647]
PO:0030074.name: archesporium

comment: Found in mosses and other bryophytes such as the liverwort Marchantiales.
def: "A disk-shaped cardinal organ part (PO:0025001) that is the apical portion of an antheridiophore (PO:0030033) and bears antheridia (PO:0025125)." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030075.name: antheridium head

comment: Found in Marchantiales.
def: "An umbrella-shaped cardinal organ part that is the apical portion of an archegoniophore and bears archegonia." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030076.name: archegonium head

def: "A protonema side branch initial that gives rise to a protonemal rhizoid." [POC:curators]
is_a: PO:0030067 ! protonema side branch initial cell
PO:0030077.name: protonemal side branch rhizoid initial cell
synonym: "rama lateral inicial del rizoide proton&#233mico (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: May be unicellular or multicellular. Serves to anchor the plant to the substrate, and may function in nutrient and water uptake. Usually lacks chlorophyll. Includes epidermal rhizoids that grow from the epidermis of bryophytes and pteridophytes in the gametophytic phase or from the stems of some monocots, protonemal rhizoids that branch from a protonema, and rhizoids that develop from a basal cell of a gametophore bud.
def: "A plant structure (PO:0009011) that is a uniseriate filament with positive geotropism that grows from an epidermis (PO:0005679) or protonema (PO:0030003)." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030078.name: rhizoid

def: "A rhizoid that is part of a protonema and develops from a protonemal side branch rhizoid initial." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030079.name: protonemal rhizoid
relationship: develops_from PO:0030077 ! protonemal side branch rhizoid initial cell

def: "A gametophyte meristematic apical cell that is part of a rhizoid." [POC:curators]
PO:0030080.name: rhizoid meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical meristem&#225tica del rizoide (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A protonema meristematic apical cell that is part of a caulonema." [POC:curators]
PO:0030081.name: caulonema meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical meristem&#225tica del caulonema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

def: "A protonema meristematic apical cell that is part of a chloronema." [POC:curators]
PO:0030082.name: chloronema meristematic apical cell
synonym: "c&#233lula apical meristem&#225tica del cloronema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: In Physcomitrella patens, a gametophore bud initial typically is more bulbous than a protonema side branch initial, and its plane of first cell division is oblique, rather than perpendicular, to the plane of growth.
def: "A protonema sub-apical initial hat gives rise to a gametophore bud." [POC:curators]
PO:0030083.name: gametophore bud initial cell

comment: Term used for bryophytes. May have one or more layers. An amphithecium may give rise to an exothecium and other layers of a sporangium wall (jacket layer or layers). In true mosses, the amphithecium gives rise to the sporangium wall and the peristome. In hornworts and peat mosses, it gives rise to the sporangium wall and sporogenous tissue.
def: "A portion of plant tissue that is the outer layer or layers of a sporangium early in sporangium development." [ISBN:0962073342]
PO:0030084.name: amphithecium

comment: Term used for bryophytes. In liverworts an early sporangium endothecium produces sporogenous tissue. In Sphagnum, Andreaea, and hornworts, it produces columella and sporogenous tissue.
def: "A portion of ground tissue that is the tissue internal to an amphithecium early in sporangium development." [ISBN:0962073342, ISBN:9780070588493, POC:curators]
PO:0030085.name: protosporangium endothecium

comment: May give rise to a branch of the protonema (including a protonema rhizoid, tmema cell or brachycyte), a gametophore bud, or may not divide further.
def: "An initial cell that is produced by longitudinal division of a sub-apical cell of a protonema." [POC:Ramona_Walls]
PO:0030086.name: protonema sub-apical initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula subapical inicial del protonema (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: In Physcomitrella patens, non-vascular leaf initials arise from the daughter cells of a gametophore axis apical cell. Subsequent division of a non-vascular leaf initial establishes a non-vascular leaf apical cell.
def: "An initial cell (PO:0004011) that is part of a gametophore (PO:0030018) and gives rise to a non-vascular leaf (PO:0025075)." [PMID:19303301]
PO:0030087.name: non-vascular leaf initial cell
synonym: "c&#233lula inicial de la hoja no vascular (Spanish)" EXACT Spanish [POC:Maria_Alejandra_Gandolfo]

comment: The derives_by_manipulation_from relation, is a special case of the RO relation derives_from.  Derives_from implies an instance level derivation that holds between two distinct material continuants when one succeeds the other across a temporal divide in such a way that at least a biologically significant portion of the matter of the earlier continuant is inherited by the later.  Likewise, derives_by_manipulation_from joins two plant structures before and after some manipulation.  Specifically, derives_by_manipulation_from is used to describe the relation between an in vitro plant structure and the in vivo plant structure that is its temporal precursor.
def: "A derives_by_manipulation_from B means: A is a type of in vitro plant structure, and every instance of A exists at a point in time later than some instance of B from which it was created through human manipulation, and every instance of A inherited a biologically significant portion of its matter from the instance of B from which it was derived." [POC:curators]
derives_by_manipulation_from.name: derives_by_manipulation_from

def: "X developmentally related to y if and only if there exists some developmental process (GO:0032502) p such that x and y both participates in p, and x is the output of p and y is the input of p." [RO:0002258]
developmentally_preceded_by.name: developmentally_preceded_by

comment: Note that an assertion to the effect that P preceded_by P1 is rather weak; it tells us little about the relations between the underlying instances in virtue of which the preceded_by relation obtains. Typically we will be interested in stronger relations, for example in the relation immediately_preceded_by, or in relations which combine preceded_by with a condition to the effect that the corresponding instances of P and P1 share participants, or that their participants are connected by relations of derivation, or (as a first step along the road to a treatment of causality) that the one process in some way affects (for example, initiates or regulates) the other.
def: "The assertion P preceded_by P1 tells us something about Ps in general: that is, it tells us something about what happened earlier, given what we know about what happened later. Thus it does not provide information pointing in the opposite direction, concerning instances of P1 in general; that is, that each is such as to be succeeded by some instance of P." [POC:Laurel_Cooper]
preceded_by.name: preceded_by
